a3f1abf485.gt:
Mix the Italian seasoning with 1 tsp olive oil and rub over chicken.
Refrigerate for 4-24 hours.
In a saucepan over medium-low heat add the tomatoes, 2 tsp olive oil, 2 tsp balsamic vinegar, and seasoning as desired.
In a large pan bring 6 cups of water to a boil and cook the pasta according the package directions.
Allow the tomatoes to simmer for 20 minutes, then add the mixed veggies and continue to simmer for another 10 minutes (I used a frozen blend).
Grill the chicken until an internal temp of 165 F is reached (approx.
7 minutes per side).
Pour the tomatoes over the pasta and top with a chicken breast.
a3f1abf485.pred:
[/SYS]

1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet or oven-safe pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chicken breast halves and cook until they are fully cooked through, about 10-12 minutes. Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
3. In the same pan, add the mixed vegetables and cook until they are tender, about 5-7 minutes.
4. Add the diced tomatoes or fresh tomatoes, diced, to the pan and stir to combine.
5. Add the cooked chicken breast halves back to the pan, and stir to combine.
6. Add the whole wheat linguine to the pan and stir to coat the pasta with the tomato and chicken mixture.
7. Season the dish with the Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper to taste.
8. Transfer the pasta and chicken mixture to a baking dish or oven-safe casserole dish.
9. Drizzle the balsamic vinegar over the top of the dish and bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the pasta is cooked through and the chicken is fully cooked.
10. Serve the dish hot and enjoy!

38747a5ef7.gt:
Prepare a large ice bath.
In a large saucepan of salted boiling water, blanch the cauliflower until just starting to soften, 1 to 2 minutes.
Drain and transfer to the ice bath to cool.
Drain again.
In a large saucepan, combine the vinegar with the water, sugar, curry powder and 1 tablespoon of salt and bring to a boil, stirring to dissolve the sugar.
Remove from the heat, stir in the cauliflower and let cool completely.
Refrigerate for 1 hour.
Drain the cauliflower; reserve the brine to pickle more vegetables, if desired.
Preheat the oven to 375.
On a large rimmed baking sheet, toss the cauliflower with the olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Roast for about 35 minutes, stirring once or twice, until tender and browned in spots.
Transfer the cauliflower to a platter and serve.
38747a5ef7.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the cauliflower florets, water, and dark brown sugar.
3. Season the cauliflower mixture with salt, pepper, and curry powder.
4. Transfer the cauliflower mixture to a baking dish and roast in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the cauliflower is tender and slightly caramelized.
5. Remove the baking dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
6. In a small bowl, whisk together the extra-virgin olive oil and curry powder.
7. Pour the olive oil mixture over the cauliflower mixture and toss to coat evenly.
8. Serve the roasted cauliflower immediately, or store it in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

Enjoy your delicious and healthy roasted cauliflower dish!

c6db02633a.gt:
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
Put the ricotta in a fine mesh strainer set over a bowl and let stand 10 minutes to remove the excess liquid.
Transfer the cheese to a bowl and add the eggs, salt and pepper, to taste and the orange zest.
Stir until well combined.
Transfer the mixture to an 8-ounce shallow baking and serving dish and put on a baking sheet.
Bake in the center of the oven until puffed and beginning to brown, about 35 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let stand 5 minutes before serving.
Serve warm with olives and baguette or your favorite bread and enjoy!
c6db02633a.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the ricotta, eggs, salt, and pepper. Mix well to combine.
3. Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish with some oil.
4. Pour the ricotta mixture into the prepared dish.
5. Cut the orange into slices and arrange them on top of the ricotta mixture.
6. Drain the pitted olives and add them to the dish.
7. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 35-40 minutes, or until the edges are slightly golden and the center is set.
8. Remove the dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before cutting it into squares and serving.

[/INST]

8d838c9253.gt:
Heat a Dutch oven over medium heat.
Coat pan with cooking spray.
Add celery, carrot, and onion to pan; cook 12 minutes or until tender, stirring occasionally.
Add garlic; cook 30 seconds, stirring constantly.
Add broth and next 4 ingredients (through pepper); bring to a boil.
Reduce heat, and simmer 12 minutes or until pasta is tender.
Add chicken to pan; cook 3 minutes or until chicken is done.
Sprinkle with cheese.
8d838c9253.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet or oven-safe pot, heat the cooking spray over medium heat. Add the thinly sliced celery, diced carrot, and chopped onion. Cook until the vegetables are tender, about 5-7 minutes.
3. Add the minced garlic and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
4. Pour in the fat-free, less-sodium chicken broth and bring to a simmer.
5. Add the Basic Marinara, canned chickpeas, and uncooked ditalini. Stir to combine.
6. Season the mixture with the freshly ground black pepper and cook for an additional 10-12 minutes, or until the pasta is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
7. Remove the skillet or pot from the heat and stir in the shaved fresh Parmesan cheese.
8. Transfer the mixture to a large oven-safe casserole dish.
9. Place the casserole dish in the preheated oven and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. Remove the casserole from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Food!

07d9e9cc9b.gt:
Combine water, sugar, salt, yeast, oil, and enough flour to make a soft dough.
(You may need more than 3 1/2 cups.)
Knead for 3-4 minutes.
On a greased counter, break off pieces of dough and roll into thin ropes that are about 1 1/2 times the length of your skewers.
Twist the rope around the skewer and place on a greased cookie sheet.
Repeat till all dough is used.
Let twists rise till doubled, about 30 minutes.
While they are baking, combine the glaze ingredients and let site while the bread twists bake so the flavors will blend.
Bake twists at 375F for about 12-15 minutes or till golden brown.
Remove from oven and brush with the butter glaze.
Try not to drool.
07d9e9cc9b.pred:
To create a mouthwatering Food, follow these steps:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the hot water, sugar, salt, and instant yeast. Stir until the yeast is fully dissolved.
2. Gradually add the olive oil, stirring constantly to avoid lumps.
3. Add the flour, one cup at a time, stirring until the dough comes together. If the dough is too dry, add a bit more water; if it is too sticky, add a bit more flour.
4. Once the dough is smooth and comes together, turn it out onto a floured surface. Knead the dough for about 10 minutes, or until it is smooth and elastic.
5. Place the dough in a lightly oiled bowl, cover it with a damp cloth, and let it rise in a warm, draft-free place for about 1-2 hours, or until it has doubled in size.
6. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
7. Punch down the dough, and then divide it into 8-10 equal portions. Shape each portion into a ball, and place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Spread a bit of melted butter on top of each ball of dough, and then sprinkle each with the garlic salt, garlic powder, dill weed, and Italian seasoning.
9. Bake the bread in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until it is golden brown and sounds hollow when tapped.
10. Remove the bread from the oven, and let it cool on a wire rack for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

[/INST]

8ff16b99b6.gt:
Cream the butter and sugar
Beat in the egg
Add malt and beat together
Add the flour & salt if using and mix into a ball I changed to a spoon half way as mixture was going every where lol.
Put dough in the fridge for 30-60 minutes.
I left mine for 60.
This makes the dough easier to roll out.
10 minutes before you roll out the dough Pre heat oven to 150 & line a baking tray with greaseproof paper
Roll out the dough to the thickness of a 1 coin and cut out in rectangular shapes or squares,
Place on the tray and bake for 15-20 minutes until edges go lightly brown.
Mine took 18 minutes
Leave to cool a while on the tray before transferring to a cooling rack
Enjoy with a glass of milk or favourite brew.
8ff16b99b6.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the butter, sugar, and egg. Mix until well combined.
3. Add the malt extract and mix until well combined.
4. Gradually add the self-raising flour, mixing until a smooth dough forms.
5. If the dough is too dry, add a small amount of water, a tablespoon at a time, until the desired consistency is reached.
6. Once the dough is the right consistency, turn it out onto a floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic.
7. Roll out the dough to your desired thickness, and use a cookie cutter to cut out your desired shapes.
8. Place the cookies on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
9. Bake the cookies in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown.
10. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious homemade cookies!

8ffd977e2f.gt:
In 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat, heat Italian sausages and 1/4 cup water to boiling.
Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 5 minutes.
Remove cover and cook until sausages are browned, about 15 minutes.
Remove sausages to cutting board.
When cool enough to handle, cut diagonally into 1/4-inch-thick slices.
While sausages are cooking, cut eggplant into 1/2-inch chunks.
In drippings remaining in skillet, over medium heat, cook eggplant and 2 tablespoons water until eggplant is tender, about 15 minutes, stirring often and adding additional water if necessary to keep eggplant from sticking.
Add spaghetti sauce and sausages; over high heat, heat to boiling.
Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, in saucepot, prepare ziti macaroni as label directs but do not use salt in water.
Drain ziti; return to saucepot.
Add spaghetti-sauce mixture; over medium heat, heat through.
To serve, spoon ziti into 8 individual pasta bowls or dinner plates; top each serving with some ricotta cheese and cracked pepper.
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese if you like.
8ffd977e2f.pred:
[/INST]

[INST] <<SYS>>
To create a delicious and satisfying pasta dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the hot Italian-sausage links until browned and cooked through. Remove from the skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, cook the sweet Italian-sausage links until browned and cooked through. Remove from the skillet and set aside.
4. In the same skillet, add the eggplant and cook until it is tender and slightly browned. Remove from the skillet and set aside.
5. In a large pot, combine the spaghetti sauce, ziti or penne macaroni, part-skim ricotta cheese, cracked black pepper, and cooked sausages. Stir to combine.
6. Transfer the mixture to a large baking dish and top with shredded Parmesan cheese.
7. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the pasta is cooked through and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Serve the dish hot, garnished with coarsely shredded Parmesan cheese.

Enjoy your delicious pasta dish!
<</SYS>>

[/INST]

ea0996a6a7.gt:
start be heating your water & white sugar & cinnamon stick together on high heat about 3 minutes you just want your sugar to desolve.
Now add in all your other ingredients lower temperatures to med- high heat stir well cook down 20-25 minutes consistently stiring till desired consistency.
Enjoy!
ea0996a6a7.pred:
1. In a large saucepan, combine the sugar, water, and cranberry sauce. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat.
2. Add the diced apples, golden raisins, brown sugar, apple cider vinegar, orange juice, pineapple juice, cinnamon stick, cinnamon, salt, and cloves to the saucepan.
3. Reduce the heat to low and simmer the mixture for about 30 minutes or until the apples are tender and the sauce has thickened.
4. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let the mixture cool for a few minutes.
5. Strain the mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into a clean saucepan. Discard the solids.
6. Return the saucepan to the heat and cook the mixture over low heat for about 15-20 minutes or until it reaches your desired consistency.
7. Serve the sauce warm or cold, and enjoy your delicious cranberry apple sauce.

a6a539fdd1.gt:
Season the thighs with adobo.
Heat the olive oil and cook the thighs.
Add the onion and cooked them till tender.
Add the vegetables, honey, basil, italian seasoning and tomato sauce.
And let it simmer for about 8 minutes...Enjoy
a6a539fdd1.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the chicken pieces with the honey, adobo seasoning, and Italian seasoning.
3. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook until it is soft and translucent.
4. Add the chicken mixture to the skillet and cook until the chicken is cooked through and the honey has caramelized.
5. Add the mixed vegetables and cook until they are tender.
6. Pour the canned tomato sauce over the chicken and vegetables, and stir to combine.
7. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
8. Transfer the mixture to a large baking dish, and bake for 25-30 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and slightly thickened.
9. Serve the cooked chicken and vegetables over a bed of rice or noodles. Enjoy your delicious homemade chicken and vegetable dish!

22b18abc2f.gt:
*adding potatoes and corn are optional
Add all ingredients, except shrimp to a large saucepan on high heat.
Bring to a boil for 10 minutes.
Reduce the heat to low.
Add the shrimp and cook until bright pink, about 5 minutes.
Drain the shrimp from the cooking liquid and place in a serving dish.
Chill or eat while warm, enjoy!!!
!
22b18abc2f.pred:
To cook a delicious shrimp dish, follow these steps:

1. Prepare the ingredients:
- Rinse the shrimp and pat them dry with paper towels.
- Peel and chop the onions and garlic.
- Rinse the lemon and cut it into quarters.
- Crush the peppercorns and remove the seeds.
- Combine the crab boil seasoning, bay leaves, and hot sauce in a small bowl.

2. Cook the shrimp:
- In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat.
- Add the shrimp and cook until they are pink and fully cooked through, about 2-3 minutes per side.
- Remove the shrimp from the pot and set aside.

3. Cook the onions and garlic:
- Add the onions and garlic to the pot and cook until they are softened and slightly browned, about 5-7 minutes.

4. Add the liquid:
- Pour in the water and apple cider vinegar, and stir to combine.
- Add the crab boil seasoning mixture and bay leaves, and bring the liquid to a boil.

5. Return the shrimp:
- Add the cooked shrimp back to the pot, and stir to combine.
- Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for about 5-7 minutes, or until the shrimp are cooked through and the sauce has thickened slightly.

6. Serve:
- Remove the shrimp from the pot and place them on a serving platter.
- Pour the sauce over the shrimp, and serve immediately.

Enjoy your delicious shrimp dish!

f4a5f6209b.gt:
preheat oven to 450F
mix together dry ingredients.
in a seperate bowl, mix wet.
slowly add the wet to the dry, and combine until just mixed.
roll out on a lightly floured surface, and use a cutter of choice to create shapes (i used the top of a drinking glass).
bake for about 15 minutes.
f4a5f6209b.pred:
To make delicious Food, follow these steps:

1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the teff flour, amaranth flour, tapioca starch, and cornstarch.
2. Add the baking powder, xanthan gum, salt, and vanilla extract, and mix well.
3. Gradually add the unsweetened soymilk, stirring until the batter is smooth and well-combined.
4. If the batter is too thick, you can add a bit more soymilk to achieve the desired consistency.
5. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
6. Grease a 9-inch (23cm) round cake pan with sunflower oil.
7. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan, smoothing the top with a spatula.
8. Bake the cake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
9. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.
10. Once cooled, spread the desired amount of jam on top of the cake.
11. Enjoy your delicious Food!

Remember to adjust the ingredients and baking time according to your preferences and the specific needs of the recipe.

331c22eb1b.gt:
In a small Mason jar, or jar of choice, combine oats, chia seeds, ground flaxseeds, cinnamon, and sea salt.
Add milk and Greek yogurt.
Stir everything together and place the lid on the jar and give the mixture a good shake to combine the ingredients.
Place the lid back on the jar and refrigerate overnight.
In the morning, you can serve oats either right from the jar or in a bowl.
Simply serve with a sprinkle of sliced almonds, fresh blueberries, and some brown sugar, if desired (it is actually sweet enough if you use vanilla yogurt though!
).
331c22eb1b.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the rolled oats, chia seeds, ground flaxseeds, ground cinnamon, and sea salt. Mix well.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the milk, Greek yogurt, and vanilla extract.
4. Pour the wet mixture into the dry mixture and stir until well combined.
5. Add the blueberries and sliced almonds to the mixture.
6. Transfer the mixture to a greased baking dish and bake for 25-30 minutes or until the oats are golden brown and the mixture is set.
7. Allow the mixture to cool for a few minutes before serving.
8. Serve the baked oat mixture with the brown sugar on top, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious homemade oatmeal!

0998cbac3e.gt:
Heat oven to 400 degrees.
In a large bowl, combine whole wheat flour, 1 cup white flour, brown sugar, baking powder and salt.
Using a pastry blender, or two knives scissors-fashion, cut butter into flour mixture until mixture resembles fine crumbs.
Add nuts or wheat berries.
Stir in the maple syrup and egg and just enough milk so that dough leaves side of bowl and forms a ball.
Turn dough onto a lightly floured surface; gently roll in flour to coat.
Knead lightly; if dough is very soft, roll in flour again.
Transfer to a lightly greased baking sheet.
Pat or roll into an 8-inch disk; cut into 8 wedges, but do not separate.
Bake until golden brown, about 20 minutes.
Immediately remove from baking sheet, and carefully separate.
Serve warm.
0998cbac3e.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the whole wheat flour, white flour, brown sugar, baking powder, and salt.
3. Cut the cold butter into small pieces and add it to the dry ingredients. Using your hands or a pastry cutter, mix the butter into the flour mixture until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg and milk together.
5. Add the egg and milk mixture to the flour mixture, stirring until the dough comes together. If the dough is too dry, add a bit more milk, and if it is too sticky, add a bit more flour.
6. Fold in the chopped walnuts or cooked wheat berries.
7. Grease a baking sheet with vegetable oil or nonstick spray.
8. Roll the dough out on a floured surface to a thickness of about 1/2 inch (1.5 cm).
9. Cut the dough into desired shapes using a cookie cutter or a sharp knife.
10. Transfer the dough shapes to the prepared baking sheet.
11. Bake the cookies for 12-15 minutes, or until they are golden brown around the edges.
12. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious homemade cookies!

10a4bdfe37.gt:
Cook the wild rice according to the directions on the package.
Wild rice generally takes 55-60 minutes to cook.
While thats cooking, in a large soup pot, melt the butter and saute the leeks, carrots, celery, mushrooms, garlic and thyme on medium high heat.
Cook for about 15 minutes, or until the vegetables have softened, stirring occasionally.
Add the flour and stir until blended into the vegetables.
Add the chicken broth and bring to a boil.
Once boiling, cover, turn the heat down to low, and simmer for 30 minutes.
At the 30 minute point, add the wild rice, chives and cooked and diced chicken.
Stir in the cream, half-n-half and sherry.
Cook until thoroughly heated.
Add salt and pepper to taste.
10a4bdfe37.pred:
1. In a large saucepan, combine the uncooked wild rice, butter, and salt. Bring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low and cover the saucepan. Cook for about 45 minutes or until the rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed.

2. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the leek, carrots, celery, and mushrooms. Cook until the vegetables are tender, about 10 minutes.

3. Add the minced garlic and thyme to the skillet, stirring to combine. Cook for an additional 2 minutes.

4. In a small bowl, mix the flour with a little bit of the chicken broth. Gradually pour the flour mixture into the skillet, stirring constantly. Cook for about 2 minutes, or until the sauce thickens.

5. Add the cooked chicken, heavy cream, half-and-half, and sherry to the skillet. Stir to combine. Cook for about 5 minutes, or until the chicken is heated through and the sauce is smooth and creamy.

6. Season the dish with salt and pepper, or to taste. Serve the dish over the cooked wild rice.

[/INST]

01a4e9a11b.gt:
in large frying pan saute with olive oil - thinly sliced onion & thinly sliced garlic until lightly blanched.
add sausage & ground beef.
saute until sausage & beef are braised.
add some wine.
transfer to a large pan.
add halved cherry tomatoes & sliced zucchini.
saute until tomatoes begin to wrinkle.
add V8 & allow to reach a simmer.
add pesto, oregano & thyme.
reduce to level of a thin sauce.
add corn starch & thicken.
add more wine.
last add parsley & chives.
season with salt & fresh pepper.
reduce to sauce thickness (if it needs liquid add more white wine).
Allow to cool & refrigerate overnight for flavors to be infused in the sauce.
Serve over al dente pasta and top with grated romano cheese.
01a4e9a11b.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, kielbasa, and garlic cloves. Season the mixture with salt and pepper.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the cornstarch with a small amount of water to form a slurry.
4. Add the cornstarch mixture to the ground beef mixture, and mix until well combined.
5. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the ground beef mixture, and cook until browned, breaking it up into small pieces as it cooks.
6. Add the V8 vegetable juice, and stir to combine.
7. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it cook for about 15-20 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened.
8. In a large roasting pan, arrange the sliced kielbasa and zucchini on the bottom. Pour the sauce over the top.
9. Season the top layer of zucchini with pesto sauce, fresh parsley, chives, oregano, and thyme.
10. Cover the roasting pan with aluminum foil, and bake in the preheated oven for about 1 hour, or until the kielbasa is cooked through and the zucchini is tender.
11. Remove the roasting pan from the oven, and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

68a1ebd22c.gt:
Combine flour, baking powder, sugar, cardamom and salt in a large bowl.
Whisk egg and water together in a small bowl.
Make a well in center of dry ingredients and add egg mixture.
Mix together gradually with a fork until mixture forms a soft dough.
If it's too sticky, add 1 or 2 tablespoons of flour (one at a time).
Cover dough with a wet towel or plastic wrap and leave 30 minutes or longer.
Heat 4 cups of oil in a deep, heavy pot (cast iron is preferable) until is reaches 360F
While oil is heating, roll dough out on a floured surface into a rectangle 1/2 inch thick.
Use a sharp knife to cut into 20 equal rectangles.
Fry maandazi in batches of 5, for about 5 minutes per batch, turning to brown both sides.
Hint: Turn the mandaazi before it gets too puffy, or the air bubbles will prevent you from turning it at all.
Remove from oil when both sides are golden brown.
Serve warm, dipped in powdered sugar if desired.
68a1ebd22c.pred:
[INST]
To create a delicious savory Food, follow these steps:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the white flour, baking powder, sugar, and cardamom.
2. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg and add the salt.
3. Gradually add the water to the egg mixture, stirring constantly to avoid lumps.
4. Pour the liquid mixture into the dry ingredients and mix until a smooth dough forms.
5. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic.
6. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
7. Roll out the dough on a floured surface to your desired thickness.
8. Cut out desired shapes using a cookie cutter or a knife.
9. Place the shaped dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
10. Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
11. Remove from the oven and let cool on a wire rack.

Enjoy your delicious savory Food!
<</SYS>>

[/INST]

3bcfc9dd72.gt:
Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
Drizzle olive oil on a rimmed baking sheet.
Spread spinach leaves in a thick layer covering the baking sheet.
Arrange onions and artichokes over the spinach, and drizzle the marinade from the jar over the entire salad.
Sprinkle with the cheese (and sausage, if you wish).
Bake for about 10 minutes, or until the spinach is wilted but NOT crispy.
3bcfc9dd72.pred:
To cook a delightful Food, follow these steps:
1. Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet or pan over medium heat.
2. Add 1 (10 ounce) package of spinach, rinsed, stemmed, and dried. Cook until the spinach is wilted and slightly tender, about 3-5 minutes.
3. Add 1 red onion, thinly sliced, and cook until it is softened and slightly caramelized, about 5-7 minutes.
4. Add 1 (8 ounce) jar of marinated artichoke hearts, and cook until they are heated through and slightly tender, about 5-7 minutes.
5. In a small bowl, mix 1 cup of crumbled feta cheese with a pinch of salt and pepper.
6. Add the feta cheese mixture to the skillet with the cooked spinach and artichoke hearts. Cook until the cheese is melted and the ingredients are well combined, about 2-3 minutes.
7. Serve the cooked Food immediately, garnished with fresh parsley or a drizzle of extra virgin olive oil, if desired.

This delightful Food is a delicious and healthy combination of spinach, artichoke hearts, and feta cheese, all cooked together in a flavorful and satisfying manner. The ingredients are versatile and can be easily customized to suit individual tastes and preferences.

7a39ad4f0a.gt:
In a large pot, combine the stock with the carrots, celery, onion, leek, potato, ginger, cumin, coriander, and cayenne, and bring to a boil.
Cover and simmer over low heat until the vegetables are tender, 20-25 minutes.
Working in batches, puree the soup in a food processor(or blender), then return to the pot.
Stir in buttermilk and lemon juice, and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Reheat gently.
Ladle into bowls, and sprinkle with the parsley and serve.
Enjoy!
7a39ad4f0a.pred:
1. In a large pot, combine the vegetable broth (or chicken broth), carrot, celery, onion, leek, sweet potato, and spices (ground cumin, coriander, cayenne pepper, and ground ginger). Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 20-25 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.

2. While the soup is cooking, prepare the buttermilk mixture by combining the buttermilk, lemon juice, and salt. Set aside.

3. Once the vegetables are tender, use a hand blender or transfer the mixture to a blender to puree until smooth.

4. Taste the soup and adjust the seasoning as needed.

5. Stir in the buttermilk mixture and serve the soup hot.

6. Garnish with a sprinkle of fresh parsley, if desired.

[/INST]

80c8683fe0.gt:
To toast nuts, preheat oven to 375F (190C).
Spread nuts out on a baking sheet and bake until lightly toasted, about 5 minutes.
Nuts can be stored in the refrigerator.
Wash and separate endive into leaves.
Dry with a clean tea towel.
If not serving right away, place in a plastic bag and refrigerate for up to 1 day.
Whisk olive oil with vinegar, garlic, salt and pepper.
Taste and add more vinegar if needed.
Dressing can be left at room temperature for several hours or refrigerated in a sealed jar.
Vinaigrette becomes cloudy when cold.
When ready to serve, let vinaigrette come to room temperature.
Arrange endive on individual plates.
Shake vinaigrette and drizzle over salad.
Scatter toasted nuts over top.
Serve right away.
80c8683fe0.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the toasted walnuts, almonds, or hazelnuts.
3. In a small mixing bowl, whisk together the olive oil, balsamic vinegar, minced garlic clove, and salt.
4. Pour the olive oil mixture over the nuts and toss to coat evenly.
5. Spread the nuts out on a baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they are golden brown and fragrant.
6. Remove the nuts from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
7. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooled nuts with the curly endive lettuce.
8. Drizzle the olive oil mixture over the salad and toss to combine.
9. Season the salad with salt and pepper to taste.
10. Serve the salad immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.

[/INST]

ea6256f97c.gt:
Beat margarine or butter and granulated sugar in a medium mixing bowl with an electric mixer on medium high speed until light and fluffy.
Add eggs, sour cream, and vanilla; beat until well combined.
Stir together flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Add to butter sugar mixture; beat until combined.
Stir in raisins and 2/3 cup of fruit cake mix.
Spread batter evenly into a greased and floured 13x9x2-inch baking pan.
Stir together brown sugar, cinnamon, pecans, and 1/3 cup of fruit cake mix.
Sprinkle evenly over batter and pat down.
Bake in a 350F oven for 40 to 45 minutes or until toothpick inserted into center comes out clean.
Serve warm or cooled.
ea6256f97c.pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 23 cup margarine or 23 cup butter, 1 cup granulated sugar, and 2 eggs. Beat until well combined.
3. Add the 1 (8 ounce) container sour cream, 1 teaspoon vanilla, 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 12 teaspoon baking soda, 12 teaspoon salt, and 12 cup raisins. Mix until well combined.
4. Gradually add the 12 cup brown sugar, 12 teaspoon ground cinnamon, and 23 cup chopped toasted pecans. Mix until well combined.
5. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9x13 inch baking dish.
6. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
7. Allow the cake to cool for a few minutes before cutting it into squares and serving.

[/INST]

efba40ac8b.gt:
In a medium saucepan, bring 2 1/4 cups of water to a boil.
Add the rice and a generous pinch of salt.
Stir once, cover and simmer over low heat until the water is absorbed and the rice is tender, about 20 minutes.
Remove from the heat and let steam, covered, for 20 minutes.
Fluff the rice with a fork and spread it out on a plate to cool slightly.
Meanwhile, in a large skillet, toast the tea over moderately low heat, stirring, until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Transfer the tea to a plate and let cool, then finely crumble with your fingers.
In the skillet, melt the butter.
Add the onion and cook over moderately low heat, stirring occasionally, until very soft but not browned, about 12 minutes; season with salt.
Add the rice and tea and cook over moderate heat, stirring gently, until the rice is hot and the tea is evenly distributed, about 2 minutes.
Gently fold in the crabmeat and cook until warmed through, about 2 minutes.
Season generously with pepper.
Transfer to a platter and garnish with sesame seeds.
Serve right away.
efba40ac8b.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large saucepan, combine the jasmine rice, kosher salt, and pepper. Cook the rice according to the package instructions, usually about 15-20 minutes.
3. While the rice is cooking, melt the butter in a small saucepan over low heat.
4. Add the minced white onion to the saucepan and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
5. Add the jumbo lump crabmeat to the saucepan and cook until heated through, about 3-4 minutes.
6. Season the crab mixture with black sesame seeds and remove from heat.
7. Once the rice is cooked, transfer it to a large mixing bowl.
8. Add the cooked crab mixture to the rice and stir to combine.
9. Serve the crab and rice mixture immediately, garnished with black sesame seeds.

[/INST]

6eccb4afe2.gt:
Cook pasta according to package directions, omitting salt and fat.
Drain pasta in a large colander over a bowl, reserving 1/2 cup cooking liquid.
Rinse pasta under cold water; drain.
Drain tuna, reserving 2 tablespoons oil.
Grate 2 teaspoons rind from lemon; squeeze 3 tablespoons juice.
Combine reserved oil, rind, and juice in a large bowl; stir with a whisk.
Add pasta to oil mixture, tossing to coat.
Fold in tuna and apple.
Remove fronds from fennel bulb; finely chop fronds to measure 3 tablespoons.
Remove and discard stalks.
Thinly slice fennel bulb.
Stir fronds and sliced fennel into pasta mixture.
Add reserved pasta liquid and 1/2 teaspoon salt, tossing to coat pasta salad evenly.Sustainable Choice: Industry label regulations require solid white tuna to be from the albacore variety.

[INST]
1. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions.
2. While the pasta is cooking, drain the tuna and flake it into bite-sized pieces.
3. In a large bowl, combine the cooked pasta, tuna, sliced apple, and chopped fennel.
4. Squeeze the lemon juice over the mixture and toss to combine.
5. Season the salad with salt, pepper, and a drizzle of olive oil, if desired.
6. Serve the salad immediately, or refrigerate it for a few hours before serving to allow the flavors to meld together.

[/INST]

dba5f2108e.gt:
For the pork medallions: Heat grill to medium heat.
Place pork medallions in a bowl, add olive oil and spices.
Mix until all the pork is covered in the olive oil mixture.
Place pork on grill and cook 5 minutes per side.
Cover and let it rest for 5 minutes.
For the asparagus: Cut off the ends of the asparagus.
Place in a bowl and add olive oil and a sprinkle of salt and pepper.
Wrap each piece of asparagus with prosciutto.
Place asparagus on grill set on medium heat.
Turn every couple of minutes until asparagus is fork tender, about 5 to 10 minutes.

2. In a large bowl, combine pork tenderloin, olive oil, garlic powder, black pepper, thyme, parsley, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
3. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to 2 hours.
4. In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the pork medallions and cook until browned on both sides, about 2-3 minutes per side.
5. Remove the pork from the skillet and set aside.
6. Add asparagus to the skillet and cook until tender, about 3-4 minutes.
7. Add the cooked pork medallions back to the skillet and toss to combine.
8. Add the olive oil, salt, and pepper to taste, and toss again.
9. Transfer the pork and asparagus mixture to a baking dish.
10. Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the pork is cooked through and the asparagus is tender.
11. Serve immediately.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

8a7f317318.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 F. Spray a 9-inch glass pie plate with cooking spray or use a silicon pie plate.
In a 10-inch skillet, cook beef and onion over medium heat.
Stir occasionally.
Drain.
Add salt, garlic powder and Cajun seasoning.
Spread in pie plate.
Sprinkle with cheese.
In a small bowl stir the Original Bisquick mix, milk, and eggs with a wire wish until blended.
Pour into pie plate.
Bake about 20-25 minutes or until a knife inserted into the center comes out clean.
You can add to your slice ketchup, BBQ sauce, bacon or anything else you would normally top your cheeseburger with.
8a7f317318.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the ground beef over medium heat until it is browned, breaking it into small pieces as it cooks.
3. Add the chopped onion and cook until softened.
4. Add the shredded cheddar cheese and cook until melted and bubbly.
5. In a separate bowl, mix the Original Bisquick mix, milk, and eggs.
6. Pour the mixture over the beef and onion mixture in the skillet.
7. Cook the mixture over medium heat, stirring constantly, until it is cooked through and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Spray a 9x13 inch baking dish with cooking spray.

10. Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the center is fully cooked.
11. Allow the casserole to cool for a few minutes before cutting it into slices and serving.

This delicious and satisfying meal can be enjoyed by everyone, and the combination of ingredients creates a flavorful and filling dish.

42aebc99ee.gt:
Chop strawberries.
Divide 260g (1 cup) vanilla yoghurt among four serving glasses.
Divide one-third of the strawberries among the glasses.
Sprinkle 2 tsp Milo over the strawberries in each glass.
Continue layering with 520g (2 cups) vanilla yoghurt, the remaining strawberries and 40g (1/3 cup) Milo.
Serve.

2. Mix the ingredients well to ensure that the strawberries are evenly coated with the milo mixture.
3. Transfer the mixture to a suitable container, such as a large mixing bowl or a baking dish.
4. Cover the container with a lid or plastic wrap, and refrigerate the mixture for at least 2 hours or overnight.

Enjoy your delicious strawberry yogurt dessert!

ddf57796e4.gt:
Drain pineapple, reserving 1 cup of chunks, 1/2 cup juice (reserving juice for other purposes).
Combine 1/2 cup of the juice, ginger, soy sauce, cilantro and meat in bowl.
Cover bowl, marinate for 15 minutes.
In large, nonstick skillet, heat oil, add garlic, saute 30 seconds, until fragrant.
Remove the meat from the marinade, place in the skillet.
Stir fry 5 minutes, just until cooked through, remove the meat and keep warm.
Combine marinade and cornstarch in bowl.
Add the beans, chilies, pepper and marinade to skillet; stir fry 4 minutes (or until veggies are crisp tender and mixture is thickened).
Stir in 1 cup pineapple chunks, scallions and meat; heat through.

7b0bd717e5.gt:
Soften the butter in the microwave and leave to cool slightly.
Sift the cake flour.
Separate the eggs.
Make meringue by whisking the egg whites, adding the sugar gradually until stiff peaks form.
In a separate bowl, beat the egg yolks and whisk in the melted butter a little at a time.
Then add the milk and the sifted flour, and mix gently.
Add in the meringue from Step 2 and carefully fold it in with a rubber spatula.
Cook in a waffle maker.
(I set my waffle maker to the medium setting and cooked for 3-4 minutes.)
NOTE: Increasing the sugar to 50 g will produce deliciously sweet waffles that are great even without a topping (however, they'll be soft and moist as opposed to crunchy).
Recipe Photo The waffle pictured was dusted with powdered sugar and served with lightly whipped fresh cream (100 ml heavy cream, 1 tablespoon sugar, vanilla essence) and pineapple.
7b0bd717e5.pred:
To make a delicious cake, start by preheating your oven to 180°C (350°F). In a large mixing bowl, combine the 2 eggs, 1 tbsp granulated sugar, and 50 grams unsalted butter. Whisk the ingredients together until smooth and well-combined. Add the 100 ml milk and 100 grams cake flour, and continue to mix until the batter is smooth and free of lumps.

Pour the batter into a greased and floured cake pan, and bake for about 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.

Once the cake is fully cooled, you can serve it to your family and friends, or enjoy it as a delicious treat.

30ddae3add.gt:
Slice the sausage, clean the vegetables and slice the zucchini.
Other vegetables will work for this as well (some ideas are mushrooms, onions, peppers, or tomatoes).
Throw everything in the pot except the cream and Parmesan.
Bring to a boil as then simmer for about 10 minutes.
Stir frequently and check noodles for doneness at about 7 minutes.
Remove from heat once the noodles are done.
Any extra liquid is fine as the pasta will dry out after sitting for a minute or two.
Add the cream and Parmesan (you can add a couple tablespoons of olive oil instead of cream should you choose to).
Stir well.
Enjoy!

3c81571916.gt:
Preheat oven to 375, in a large bowl combine all ingredients mix well.
lightly spray your 8x8 baking dish and add meat mixture to form an loaf.
bake uncovered about an hour or until thermometer reaches 170.

6b99a23505.gt:
Peel the bulb of garlic, which should equal around 10 cloves.
I prefer to mash it finely with a mortal and pestle (the old-fashioned way) but feel free to use a food processor.
Combine the salt and garlic cloves in whatever manner you choose, and grind them up well.
Then prepare the boxed mashed potatoes as directed for the smallest serving possible.
(Youll need about 1/2 cup.
2-3 servings on a box of mashed potatoes is about 1 cup.
So feel free to take out a spoon and eat the other half of the mashed potatoes.)
Let the mashed potatoes cool.
Go back to the garlic, and add the mayonnaise, the lemon juice and about half of the oil (about 1/4 of a cup).
Blend together in processor or blender.
Then add about 1/4 cup of the mashed potatoes and half of the oil you have left (about 1/8 of a cup).
Blend more.
(You may need to stick a spoon down in there to ensure that it mixes thoroughly).
Now add the remainder of your mashed potatoes and oil.
Give it a good final blend.
You may need to add more oil or potatoes, depending on whether you want it thicker or thinner.
Serve with pita bread, pita chips, chicken kabobs, or my Kafta (Kofta) recipe that Ive posted here in my recipe box.
Enjoy!
6b99a23505.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the mashed potatoes, garlic, salt, and lemon juice. Mix well.
3. Gradually add the mayonnaise, stirring until the mixture is smooth and creamy.
4. Add the canola oil and mix until the potatoes are evenly coated.
5. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish, and spread it evenly.
6. Bake the potato mixture in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until it is golden brown and cooked through.
7. Serve the cooked potato mixture immediately, or let it cool slightly before serving.

[/INST]

b9f129d26e.gt:
Heat a large nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray over medium-high heat.
Add ham, green chiles, and mushrooms; saute 5 minutes.
Remove from pan.
Wipe pan clean.Place 1 tortilla in pan.
Sprinkle 2 tablespoons cheese over half of tortilla; arrange 1/2 cup ham mixture over cheese.
Sprinkle with 2 tablespoons cheese; fold in half.
Cook 1 minute on each side or until cheese melts.
Repeat procedure with remaining tortillas, cheese, and ham mixture.
b9f129d26e.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
3. In a large skillet, heat the cooking spray over medium heat. Add the chopped ham and cook until it is browned and crispy.
4. Add the canned chopped green chiles and cook for a few more minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. In a separate bowl, mix the shredded reduced-fat extra-sharp cheddar cheese.
6. In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs and milk.
7. Carefully pour the egg mixture over the ham and green chile mixture in the skillet. Stir gently to combine.

9. Carefully transfer the mixture to the prepared baking dish.
10. Sprinkle the shredded cheese evenly over the top of the casserole.
11. Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
12. Allow the casserole to cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious homemade casserole!

b4611b4385.gt:
Heat should be medium-high and rack about 4 inches from fire.
Put shrimp and garlic in a food processor and pulse until just chopped; remove to a large bowl.
Working in batches, grind pork fat until just chopped (be careful not to overprocess).
Add to bowl.
Then grind meat until just chopped, again being careful not to overprocess; add to bowl.
Mix shrimp, pork fat and meat with soy sauce, scallions, cilantro, chili and ginger; sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Shape into 8 patties.
Grill about 4 minutes, then turn and cook for a total of 8 to 10 minutes, or until nicely browned and cooked through.
Garnish with scallions, cilantro, cabbage and pickled pepper, to taste.
b4611b4385.pred:
[TUTORIAL]
1. Prepare the ingredients: Rinse the shrimp and peel the garlic and ginger. Cut the pork into 1-inch cubes and chop the scallions.

2. In a large bowl, combine the shrimp, pork, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, and scallions. Mix well to ensure the ingredients are evenly distributed.

3. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.

4. While the meat mixture is marinating, prepare the cabbage and pickled pepper (if using).

5. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).

6. In a separate bowl, mix the cornstarch with a small amount of water to create a slurry. Set aside.

7. Heat a large skillet or oven-safe pan over medium heat. Add a small amount of oil and cook the pork until it is browned and cooked through. Remove the pork from the pan and set aside.

8. Add the remaining oil to the pan and cook the shrimp until they are pink and cooked through. Remove the shrimp from the pan and set aside.

9. Add the marinated meat mixture to the pan and stir to combine with the cooked shrimp. Cook for a few minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.

10. Add the cornstarch slurry to the pan, stirring constantly to prevent lumps. Cook until the sauce thickens slightly.

11. Add the cooked pork back to the pan and stir to combine.

12. Serve the dish over a bed of cooked rice or noodles, garnished with shredded cabbage and pickled pepper (if using).

[/TUTORIAL]

[/INST]

75b28019b4.gt:
Heat oil in medium skillet on medium-high heat.
Add chicken; cook 7 min.
on each side or until cooked through (170F).
Meanwhile, prepare Dinner as directed on package, substituting large skillet for the saucepan.
Add tomatoes, onions and parsley to prepared dinner; mix lightly.
Top with the chicken.
75b28019b4.pred:
To cook a delightful Food, follow these steps:
1. Heat 1 Tbsp. oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
2. Season the chicken thighs with salt, pepper, and any other desired seasonings.
3. Add the chicken thighs to the skillet and cook until they are browned on both sides and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes per side.
4. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
5. Add the remaining 1 Tbsp. oil to the skillet and cook the onions until they are soft and translucent.
6. Add the diced tomatoes and cook for a few more minutes until they are heated through.
7. In a separate pot, bring the chicken broth to a boil.
8. In a small bowl, mix the macaroni and cheese according to the package instructions.
9. Add the cooked chicken to the skillet with the onions and tomatoes, and stir to combine.
10. Pour the chicken broth into the skillet, stirring to combine the ingredients.
11. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 10-15 minutes, or until the macaroni is cooked through and the sauce has thickened slightly.
12. Stir in the chopped fresh parsley and serve the dish immediately.

The key to a delightful Food is the combination of flavors and textures, as well as the careful preparation of the ingredients. The chicken thighs provide a tender and juicy protein, while the macaroni and cheese adds a creamy and comforting element. The onions and tomatoes add a touch of freshness and acidity, and the green onions and parsley add a pop of color and aroma. By following these steps, you can create a delicious and satisfying meal that everyone will enjoy.

dbf1079c1d.gt:
Preheat the oven to 350F.
Lightly oil a 12-inch springform pan or 12 cups of a muffin tin.
In a small pot, combine the water, cinnamon stick and cloves and bring to a boil over medium heat.
Turn off the heat and let the spices steep for 15 minutes.
Strain.
In a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment, whip the olive oil and brown sugar together until fluffy.
Add the spice water, petimezi, orange peel and tsipouro (or ouzo or grappa).
Mix well.
Dissolve the baking soda in the orange juice and stir into the petimezi mixture.
Sift 5 cups of flour into a medium bowl.
Gently whisk the flour into the petimezi mixture.
If the batter is loose, add a little more flour.
Stir in the chocolate chips, if using and scrape the batter into the springform or muffin cups.
Toss the granulated sugar and sesame seeds together and sprinkle over the cake.
Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 50 minutes for the cake, 40 to 45 minutes for the cupcakes.
Serve the cake as is, or with a bit of petimezi or chocolate syrup drizzled over or around it.
Serve the cupcakes, if making, the same way.
Petimezopita is delicious with vanilla ice cream, too.
dbf1079c1d.pred:
1. In a large saucepan, combine the water, cinnamon stick, and whole cloves. Bring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 15 minutes.
2. In a separate saucepan, heat the Greek extra virgin olive oil over medium heat. Add the brown sugar and stir until it melts.
3. Add the petimezi, or grape molasses, to the saucepan with the melted sugar. Stir well to combine.
4. Add the grated peel and juice of the two large oranges to the saucepan. Stir well to combine.
5. Add the Greek tsipouro, ouzo, or grappa to the saucepan. Stir well to combine.
6. Add the baking soda to the saucepan and stir well to combine.
7. Gradually add the flour to the saucepan, stirring constantly to avoid lumps. Cook for about 5 minutes, or until the mixture thickens.
8. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the dark chocolate chips.
9. Add the sesame seeds and stir well to combine.
10. Pour the mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
11. Bake the cake in a preheated oven at 350°F (175°C) for about 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
12. Allow the cake to cool for a few minutes before cutting it into squares and serving.

[/INST]

Combine all of the ingredients in a pot and stir to coat the carrots evenly.
Set over a medium heat and cook, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes or until tender.

44be4e7085.gt:
Mix together the brown sugar, rice wine, and rice wine vinegar in a small bowl until smooth.
Combine the coconut milk and peanut butter in a small saucepan over low heat.
Heat and stir until the peanut butter melts, being careful to not allow the coconut milk to boil.
Stir the sugar mixture into the coconut milk mixture; pour into a bowl; stir in the soy sauce, sesame oil, garlic, chili sauce, ginger, and fish sauce.

03e6762fab.gt:
Combine the potatoes, spinach, carrots, turnips, garlic, and lentils in a slow cooker.
Pour enough water over the mixture to cover.
In a bowl, stir the fresh basil, chili powder, cinnamon, dried basil, paprika, turmeric, cayenne pepper, ground ginger, sea salt, and black pepper; stir into the slow cooker.

fefd0facd1.gt:
Trim the bottoms of the asparagus and place in a shallow dish.

1156557bd2.gt:
To make vinaigrette, whisk together mustard, vinegar, and 1 tablespoon oil in a medium bowl.
Season with salt and pepper.
Heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add asparagus, and season with salt and pepper.
Reduce heat to medium-low.
Cook, stirring frequently, until asparagus are just tender, 10-12 minutes.
(If the spears begin to brown, reduce heat to low.
).
Transfer aspargus to serving dish.
Drizzle with the vinaigrette, toss, and serve immediately.
1156557bd2.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the Dijon mustard, sherry wine or red wine vinegar, and olive oil. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
3. In a large bowl, toss the thin asparagus with the olive oil mixture.
4. Spread the asparagus on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
5. Roast the asparagus in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until it is tender and slightly charred.
6. Remove the asparagus from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Serve the roasted asparagus immediately, or let it cool and store it in an airtight container for later use.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

9cac29f01e.gt:
Mash the avocados roughly with a fork.
I like mine a bit chunky so I dont go too crazy with the mashing.
Add in the minced garlic, diced jalapeno and diced red onion.
Stir in the diced tomatoes.
Add the juice of the limes and salt and pepper to taste.
9cac29f01e.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the chopped avocados, minced garlic, chopped jalapeno, finely diced red onion, and chopped tomato.
3. Add the juiced limes, salt, and pepper to the bowl, and mix well.
4. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish, and bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the avocado is tender and the mixture is slightly melted.
5. Serve the savory Food immediately, and enjoy!

[/INST]

ff146bd853.gt:
NOTES: You MUST use butter or oil; margarine will not work.
A large cast-iron skillet works best for this, but any large non-stick skillet will work.
This recipe will work with nearly any type of boneless fish fillets, but catfish seems to be one of the tastiest.
This recipe produces a LOT of smoke, so make sure you have a good vent above your stove, or open some doors and/or windows.
Mix all dry ingredients together.
Coat fillets evenly with mixture.
Heat small amount of butter or oil in skillet until hot.
Place fillets in skillet.
Cook 3-5 minutes on each side.
Change butter or oil if it gets too black.
ff146bd853.pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the catfish fillet, black pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, parsley flakes, ground red pepper, salt, oregano, and thyme. Mix well to ensure all ingredients are evenly distributed.
3. Heat butter or oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Once hot, add the catfish mixture and cook for about 5-7 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
4. Transfer the cooked catfish to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
5. Serve the catfish with a side of your choice, such as rice, potatoes, or a green salad. Enjoy your delicious and flavorful catfish dish!

5e144fbd37.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Spread a thin layer of sauce on the bottom of a 9"x13" casserole.
Cover with a layer of noodles (3 or 4 noodles should be enough).
Place ricotta in a bowl and add about 1/4 cup of water, stirring until blended.
Spread 1/3 of this mixture over the pasta (you can use a cake spatula).
Spread 1/3 of the remaining pasta sauce over the cheese.
Spread 1/3 of the vegetables over the sauce.
Sprinkle 1/3 of the mozzarella over the veggies.
Repeat twice starting with the noodles and ending with the mozzarella.
Cover and bake until the noodles are tender (35 to 40 minutes).
Remove cover and bake 5 minutes until cheese starts to become golden.
Remove from oven and allow to stand for 5 minutes before cutting into squares.
5e144fbd37.pred:
1. Begin by preheating your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the pasta sauce, ricotta cheese, and steamed vegetables. Mix well to ensure the ingredients are evenly distributed.
3. Add the mozzarella cheese to the mixture, and stir gently to combine.
4. If desired, you can add some herbs or spices to enhance the flavor, such as basil, oregano, or red pepper flakes.
5. Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish with some olive oil or cooking spray.
6. Pour the pasta sauce mixture into the prepared baking dish.
7. Bake the lasagna in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Remove the lasagna from the oven, let it cool for a few minutes, and then slice it into individual portions.

Enjoy your delicious homemade lasagna!

1d78b03064.gt:
If using dried chickpeas, soak in plenty of water for 6-24 hours.
Drain, cook in plenty water for about 1 1/2 hour.
Drain and proceed as follows.
Preheat oven to 425F.
Grease baking sheet with the oil.
Mix salt pepper and chili powder (or whatever spices you want to use) in a big plastic bag.
Add chickpeas and shake until coated.
Place chickpeas on baking sheet.
Bake for about 30 minutes, or until golden and crisp.
1d78b03064.pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the canned chick-peas, drained and rinsed, with the olive oil, salt, pepper, and chili powder. Mix well to ensure the ingredients are evenly distributed.
3. Spread the mixture evenly on a baking sheet or a large roasting pan.
4. Roast the chick-pea mixture in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until it is golden brown and crispy.
5. Remove the baking sheet or roasting pan from the oven and let the chick-pea mixture cool for a few minutes.
6. Serve the crispy chick-peas as a side dish or snack, or use them as an ingredient in a larger recipe, such as a salad, sandwich, or main course.

[/INST]

[/INST]

[/INST]

56cf2ad64f.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Spread almonds on baking sheet, and toast 5 to 7 minutes, or until light brown and fragrant.
Transfer to bowl.
Meanwhile, toast coriander, cumin, and salt in skillet over medium-low heat 3 minutes, or until coriander is light brown and mixture is fragrant, swirling pan constantly.
Place in bowl with almonds.
Cool completely.
Coarsely grind almond-spice mixture and sumac in food processor, or grind with mortar and pestle.
Transfer to bowl, and stir in sesame seeds.
Store in airtight container.
56cf2ad64f.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the almonds, coriander seeds, cumin seeds, and salt.
3. Add the sumac and toasted sesame seeds to the bowl, stirring to combine.
4. Spread the mixture evenly on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
5. Roast the mixture in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the nuts are golden brown and fragrant.
6. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the mixture cool completely.
7. Once cooled, transfer the mixture to a food processor or blender and blend until it reaches a fine, powdery consistency.
8. Store the ground nuts and seeds mixture in an airtight container or jar for future use.

This recipe will yield a delicious and aromatic ground nut and seed mixture that can be used as a topping for various dishes, such as salads, grains, or even as a base for a nutritious and flavorful granola.

e3e663cf8f.gt:
Place all in a blender and blend till smooth.
If you use fresh berries you can add ice cubes.
e3e663cf8f.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flax seed, banana, frozen berries, and orange juice.
3. Stir until the ingredients are well combined.
4. Add the wheat grass powder and mix until the ingredients are well combined.
5. Pour the mixture into a baking dish and bake for 30-40 minutes, or until the mixture is bubbly and the edges are slightly crispy.
6. Remove the dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Serve the dish immediately, or let it cool completely before storing in the refrigerator.

This delicious dish combines the natural sweetness of the banana, the fruity flavors of the frozen berries, and the tangy taste of the orange juice. The wheat grass powder adds a nutritious boost and a vibrant green color to the dish. This dish is not only visually appealing but also packed with essential nutrients, making it a healthy and satisfying meal.

74728bdde9.gt:
1.
Prepare rice according to package.2.
Combine hoisin and next 5 ingredients in a bowl.
Reserve 4 teaspoons.3.
Heat a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
Add 1 tablespoon canola oil.
Sprinkle fillets with salt.
Add two fillets to pan; cook 4 minutes.
Turn; brush each with 1 teaspoon hoisin mixture.
Cook 2 minutes.
Remove fish from pan.
Repeat with 1 tablespoon canola oil, 2 fillets, and 2 teaspoons hoisin mixture.4.
Heat a skillet over high heat.
Add 1 tablespoon canola oil.
Add peas and onions; saute 1 minute.
Add mushrooms; saute 2 minutes.
Place 1/2 cup rice onto each of 4 plates.
Top each with 1 fillet and 1/2 cup vegetables; drizzle with 1 teaspoon hoisin mixture.
74728bdde9.pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the boil-in-bag brown rice, hoisin sauce, water, lower-sodium soy sauce, minced fresh ginger, dark sesame oil, and black pepper. Mix well.
2. In a separate bowl, whisk together the canola oil, divided, and the kosher salt.
3. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
4. Heat a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add the canola oil and the flounder fillets, seasoned with salt. Cook until the fish is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork, about 4-5 minutes per side.
5. Remove the cooked fish from the skillet and set aside.
6. In the same skillet, add the sliced shiitake mushroom caps and cook until they are tender, about 3-4 minutes.
7. Add the sliced snow peas to the skillet and cook until they are tender but still crisp, about 2-3 minutes.
8. Add the cooked rice mixture to the skillet and stir to combine. Cook for a few minutes until the rice is heated through and the flavors are well-mixed.
9. Serve the rice and mushroom mixture over the cooked fish.

[/INST]

This delicious meal can be enjoyed with friends and family, providing a satisfying and flavorful dining experience.

6a0d7996ca.gt:
Pour milk into pint-size glass jar, and stir in kefir grains.
Cover jar with several layers of cheesecloth or paper towels, and secure with rubber band.
Store jar at room temperature out of direct sunlight and allow kefir to ferment until thickened.
(Healthy kefir grains will thicken milk in 24 hours, though this process may take as few as 12 hours in warmer temperatures, or as long as 48 hours in cooler temperatures.)
Check kefir periodically to gauge thickness.
When mixture reaches desired thickness, strain kefir into glass, stirring gently until only kefir grains remain in strainer.
(To keep kefir grains viable, stir into new batch of milk within 48 hours.)
Combine prepared kefir, orange juice, vanilla, and sugar in blender.
Pulse to combine.
Blend in ice cubes individually until as creamy and frothy as you like.
Taste, and blend in more sugar to sweeten as desired.
6a0d7996ca.pred:
1. In a blender, combine 1 cup whole or low-fat milk, 1 tsp. milk kefir grains, and 1 1/2 cups fresh orange juice.
2. Blend the mixture until smooth and creamy.
3. Add 1 tsp. vanilla extract to enhance the flavor.
4. Gradually pour in 1/4 cup sugar, stirring to dissolve the sugar.
5. Add 15 ice cubes to the blender, and blend until the ice is fully incorporated and the mixture is cold and frothy.
6. Pour the frothy mixture into a glass, and enjoy your refreshing and delicious milkshake.

This step-by-step guide provides a simple and easy-to-follow recipe for creating a delicious milkshake using the provided ingredients. The milkshake is a refreshing and healthy beverage that combines the nutritious benefits of milk, orange juice, and ice, while the addition of vanilla extract and sugar adds a sweet and creamy touch.

dc17b08e51.gt:
Combine first 8 ingredients in a food processor; process until smooth.
Add pepper.
Spoon 1 teaspoon of tapenade over each baguette slice.
Arrange on a serving platter; garnish with orange sections, if desired.
dc17b08e51.pred:
To prepare a tasty Food, follow these steps:
1. In a small bowl, mix the pitted nicoise olives, capers, and grated orange rind.
2. In a large bowl, combine the extravirgin olive oil, orange juice, fennel seeds, water, and garlic cloves. Whisk to combine.
3. Add the pitted nicoise olives and capers mixture to the large bowl, and stir to combine.
4. Season the mixture with pepper to taste.
5. Toast the French bread baguette slices.
6. Cut the orange into sections and halve them.
7. Serve the tasty Food alongside the orange sections, as desired.

The tasty Food is a delicious and healthy dish that combines the flavors of olives, capers, and orange rind with the nutritional benefits of the fennel seeds, garlic, and extravirgin olive oil. The toasted French bread baguette slices add a satisfying crunch to the dish, while the orange sections provide a refreshing and vibrant contrast to the flavors. This dish is perfect for a light lunch or a side dish to accompany a main course.

dfe6f1be35.gt:
Heat unsalted butter in a stainless steel, thick-bottomed sauce pan, over a low-medium flame.
Allow the oil (ghee) to separate from the milk solids.
Periodically remove the foam that accumulates at the top.
When the oil is clear in color, the ghee is done.
Remove from the stove and allow to cool for a while, than carefully pour off the ghee into a wide-mouthed jar through several layers of cheese cloth secured to the opening of the jar or through a fine mesh strainer.
Cover the jar and store at room temperature.
dfe6f1be35.pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the flour, baking powder, and salt.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture, alternating with the milk, and mix until just combined.
6. Fold in the cheesecloth-wrapped chocolate chips.
7. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9-inch (23 cm) round cake pan.
8. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
9. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.

e07fd8f60a.gt:
Preheat the oven to 350.
Set the squash on a large rimmed baking sheet, cut sides up, and brush with the 3 tablespoons of melted butter.
Sprinkle the sugar in the cavities and season the squash with salt and pepper.
Turn the squash over on the baking sheet and roast for about 1 hour, or until tender and browned at the edges.
Meanwhile, heat the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter in a medium skillet.
Add the chestnuts and thyme sprigs and cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until the chestnuts are lightly browned and glazed with the butter, 8 to 10 minutes.
Discard the thyme sprigs.
Cut each squash half into 4 wedges and arrange on a large platter.
Sprinkle with the glazed chestnuts and the red currants.
Drizzle the squash with the pomegranate molasses and serve.
e07fd8f60a.pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the squash with the melted butter, sugar, salt, and pepper. Spread the squash out on a baking sheet and roast for 30-40 minutes, or until tender and slightly caramelized.
3. While the squash is roasting, prepare the chestnuts. Place the chestnuts in a large pot, cover with water, and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20-30 minutes, or until the chestnuts are tender. Drain the chestnuts and let them cool.
4. In a small bowl, mix the red currants or seeds from the pomegranate with the pomegranate molasses.
5. When the squash is cooked, remove it from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
6. In a large bowl, toss the roasted squash with the chestnuts, red currants or seeds, and thyme sprigs.
7. Serve the squash and chestnut mixture immediately, or refrigerate it for a few hours before serving.
