98695d84fe.gt:
Heat broiler.
Using a sharp knife, lightly score eggplant flesh in a criss-cross pattern.
Arrange the eggplant skin side up in a single layer on a non-stick broiler pan.
Lightly brush with half the oil; broil 4 inches away from heat source for 3 minutes or until dimpled but not charred.
Meanwhile, in a small bowl combine soy sauce, sugar and mirin.
Turn eggplant slices over and brush with remaining oil; broil 1 minute.
Brush with soy sauce mixture; broil 1 more minute more until eggplant is tender when it's pierced with a knife.
Sprinkle with scallions before serving.
98695d84fe.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the eggplant halves with 2 tablespoons of the olive oil, and season with salt and pepper.
3. Spread the eggplant halves on a baking sheet, and roast them in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
4. In a small bowl, mix the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil with the reduced sodium soy sauce, sugar, and mirin.
5. Remove the roasted eggplant halves from the oven, and let them cool for a few minutes.
6. Brush the eggplant halves with the soy sauce mixture, and transfer them back to the oven. Roast for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until the sauce is bubbly and slightly caramelized.
7. Remove the eggplant from the oven, and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. In a small bowl, mix the minced scallions with a pinch of salt.
9. Serve the roasted eggplant halves with a dollop of the scallion mixture on top.

[/INST]

4782c93d83.gt:
In a large bowl, combine carrots, orange juice, raisins, ginger, salt and red pepper.
Toss to mix and cover.
Marinate in refrigerator at least 1 hour or up to 8.
To serve, halve avocados and remove pit.
Peel and slice into very thin slices.
Place a few avocado slices on each plate decoratively and top with carrot mixture.
4782c93d83.pred:
To cook a delicious and nutritious meal using the ingredients provided, follow these steps:

1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the grated carrots, orange juice, and golden raisins. Mix well to ensure the carrots are evenly coated with the juice.
3. Add the minced ginger, salt, and crushed red pepper flakes to the bowl. Mix until well combined.
4. Add the avocados to the bowl and mash them using a fork or a potato masher. Mix the avocado into the carrot mixture until well combined.
5. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish or a casserole dish.
6. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the carrots are tender and the mixture is heated through.
7. Serve the dish hot, and enjoy your delicious and nutritious meal!

[/INST]

8b231f2c0b.gt:
In a double boiler over medium heat, melt the butter and chocolate chips, whisking constantly until combined.
Whisk in the evaporated milk and powdered sugar and bring to a boil, stirring often, for 8 minutes.
Remove from heat and add vanilla.
Store in a glass container in the refrigerator.
Keeps for several weeks.
Makes approximately 3 cups.
8b231f2c0b.pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the chocolate chips and mix until well combined.
4. Add the evaporated milk and vanilla, and mix until smooth.
5. Gradually add the powdered sugar, mixing until well combined.
6. Pour the mixture into a greased 9x9 inch baking pan.
7. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
8. Allow the bars to cool completely before cutting into squares.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

9f7b08be0e.gt:
Preheat oven to 300 F. Line a baking sheet with a Silpat or parchment paper and set aside.
In a large bowl, combine oats, macadamia nuts, flax seed, wheat germ and salt.
Set aside.
In a small saucepan, combine brown sugar, honey and oil.
Cook over medium heat 2-3 minutes until sugar is dissolved.
Pour over the oat mixture, tossing gently to coat.
Bake for 45 minutes, stirring every 15 minutes, making sure not to burn the nuts.
Remove from the oven and let it cool.
Keep it flat and allow it to cool completely stirring a couple of times to break the mixture up.
Once cool, add the shredded coconut and the dried pineapple.
Store in an airtight container for up to 1 month.
*Notes: If you prefer your coconut toasted, feel free to add it to the oat mixture before it goes into the oven.
In this recipe, I kind of prefer it untoasted, but do whatever floats your boat!
9f7b08be0e.pred:
To cook a delightful Food, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 6 cups of Old Fashioned Oats, 2 cups of Macadamia Nuts, and roughly chopped Flax Seed.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the 2 tablespoons of Wheat Germ, 1/2 teaspoon of Salt, 1/2 cup of Brown Sugar, and 1/2 cup of Honey.
4. Add the Vegetable Oil to the dry ingredients and mix until well combined.
5. Add the Sweetened Shredded Coconut, 1 cup of Dried Pineapple, and mix until well combined.
6. Pour the mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
7. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the center is set.
8. Allow the dish to cool for a few minutes, then cut it into 12 equal pieces.

This delightful Food is a delicious and nutritious oatmeal-based dish that combines the natural flavors of oats, nuts, and fruits. The combination of oats, nuts, and coconut adds a satisfying crunch, while the pineapple and honey provide a sweet and tangy flavor. This dish is perfect for breakfast or a healthy snack, and it can be customized with additional ingredients or flavors to suit your preferences.

43ba871465.gt:
Cream margarine and sugar.
Add egg, beat thoroughly.
Add molasses and blend.
In another bowl mix dry ingredients, then add to wet ingredients.
Mix to combine.
Roll into small balls (3/4" - 1").
Coat balls in sugar, place on cookie sheet 2 inches apart, bake at 350F for 10-12 minutes.
Yield is approximate, depending on size.
Time to make about 10 minutes to prepare dough, and I estimated 10 minutes to roll into balls and coat with sugar.
43ba871465.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the white sugar, margarine, and egg. Mix until smooth and creamy.
3. Gradually add the molasses, flour, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, ground ginger, and ground cloves. Mix until well combined.
4. If you want to roll the dough, add the additional 12 cup sugar and mix until the sugar is well incorporated.
5. If you are not rolling the dough, you can proceed to the next step.
6. Pour the dough onto a lightly floured surface and roll out to your desired thickness.
7. Transfer the rolled dough to a greased baking sheet or a silicone mat.
8. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until the edges are golden brown.
9. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious homemade cookies!

f4e0bc9330.gt:
combine chopped broccoli and chicken broth and bring to a boil.
cook until broccoli is tender.
in a separate pan saute onions in butter until translucent but not browned.
add this mixture to the broccoli and broth stirring in the flour.
cook until thickened.
add milk, cream, seasoning and cheese.
simmer until cheese melts, but do not boil before serving.
f4e0bc9330.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the chicken broth, flour, and pepper, stirring constantly until the mixture thickens.
4. Gradually add the milk, heavy whipping cream, and thyme, stirring until smooth.
5. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 10 minutes, or until it thickens slightly.
6. Add the grated yellow cheese, stirring until melted and combined.
7. In a large mixing bowl, combine the chopped broccoli, chicken broth mixture, and salt.
8. Transfer the mixture to a 9x13 inch baking dish.
9. Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the broccoli is tender and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. Remove the casserole from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

This recipe for a cheesy broccoli casserole is a delicious and comforting dish that can be enjoyed by people of all ages. The combination of tender broccoli, creamy cheese, and the savory flavors of the chicken broth and onion make it a satisfying and filling meal.

93fa251248.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Grease an 8-inch square baking dish.
Whisk eggs, oil, and brown sugar together in a bowl until brown sugar is dissolved.
Combine oats, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt in a separate bowl; stir into egg mixture just until moistened.
Spoon oat mixture into prepared baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until edges are golden brown, 20 to 25 minutes.
93fa251248.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, vegetable oil, brown sugar, and baking powder until well combined.
3. Add the oats, cinnamon, and salt to the bowl and stir until well combined.
4. Pour the mixture into a greased 9x9 inch baking dish.
5. Bake the oatmeal in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the center is set.
6. Remove the baking dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before cutting it into squares.
7. Serve the cooked oatmeal warm, and enjoy your delicious Food!

3b92f8e755.gt:
Heat oven to 375 degrees.
Place a ridged cast-iron skillet or other heavy skillet over medium-high heat.
Working in batches, brush eggplant slices on both sides with olive oil and cook, turning, until soft and (if using a ridged pan) crisscrossed with grid marks.
Set aside and allow to cool.
In a large bowl, combine feta, pine nuts, raisins, 1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil, bread crumbs, garlic, lemon zest, mint and parsley.
Mix in egg, and season to taste with salt and pepper.
Spread eggplant slices on a surface, and divide stuffing evenly among them, placing 1 to 2 tablespoons at one end of each slice.
Roll up slices tightly to secure filling, and place in a 9-by-13-inch baking dish (or other shallow baking pan in which rolls fit snugly in a single layer).
Pour crushed tomatoes on top of eggplant rolls.
Arrange mozzarella slices in a line lengthwise down center of pan.
Drizzle olive oil evenly over pan, and season to taste with salt and pepper.
Bake until cheese has melted and eggplant is bubbling and fragrant, 25 to 30 minutes.
Remove from heat and allow to stand 5 to 10 minutes.
Serve hot.
3b92f8e755.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the egg, crumbled feta cheese, minced garlic, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the bread crumbs, grated lemon zest, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
4. In a large skillet or oven-safe pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the eggplant slices and cook until they are tender and slightly browned, about 5-7 minutes per side.
5. Remove the eggplant slices from the pan and place them on a baking sheet.
6. Drizzle the eggplant slices with olive oil and sprinkle with the bread crumb mixture.
7. Bake the eggplant slices in the preheated oven for 10-15 minutes, or until they are golden brown and crispy.
8. In a large bowl, mix the drained raisins, chopped parsley, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
9. In a large skillet or oven-safe pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the canned crushed tomatoes and bring to a simmer. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
10. In a large bowl, mix the beaten egg with the crumbled feta cheese, minced garlic, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
11. In a large skillet or oven-safe pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the egg mixture and cook until the bottom is set, about 5-7 minutes.
12. Carefully slide the fried egg onto the tomato sauce in the pan. Cook for a few more minutes, or until the egg is cooked to your desired level of doneness.
13. Serve the fried egg on top of the tomato sauce, garnished with the chopped parsley and a drizzle of extra virgin olive oil.

Enjoy your delicious and healthy meal!

263a0fdd20.gt:
Heat oven to 350F.
Prepare cake batter as directed on package; pour into parchment-lined 15x10x1-inch pan.
Bake 18 to 20 min.
or until toothpick inserted in centre comes out clean.
Cool completely.
Beat cream cheese and butter in large bowl with mixer until creamy.
Blend in vanilla.
Gradually add sugar, beating well after each addition.
Cut cake lengthwise, then crosswise in half.
Stack cake layers on plate, spreading cream cheese frosting between layers and on top of cake.

2. Grease and flour a 9-inch (23 cm) round cake pan.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the carrot cake mix, softened Philadelphia Brick Cream Cheese, and softened butter.
4. Add the vanilla extract and mix until well combined.
5. Gradually add the icing sugar, mixing until the batter is smooth and well combined.
6. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
7. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
8. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.

fe5d11c597.gt:
Heat oven to 350F.
Combine 1 cup sugar and 1/2 cup margarine in large mixer bowl.
Beat at medium speed until creamy.
Add egg and vanilla, and continue beating until well mixed.
Reduce speed to low,and add all remaining cookie ingredients except marshmallows.
Beat until well mixed.
Drop dough by rounded teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake for 6-7 minutes or until edges are just set.
Remove from oven.
Press 1 marshmallow half onto center of each cookie.
Continue baking for 2 minutes or until marshmallow is softened.
Cool 1 minute; remove from cookie sheets.
Cool completely.
Combine all frosting ingredients except milk in small mixer bowl.
Beat at low speed, adding enough milk for desired spreading consistency.
Frost cooled cookies, covering entire marshmallow.
Variations: Before putting frosting over cooled cookies, spread a thin layer of peanut butter, caramel, or seedless raspberry jelly over marshmallow, and then add your frosting.
fe5d11c597.pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a 9x13 inch baking dish.
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the sugar and margarine until light and fluffy. Add the egg and vanilla, and mix well.
3. Gradually add the flour, cocoa, baking soda, and salt, mixing until well combined.
4. Stir in the milk and mix until smooth.
5. Fold in the marshmallows and mix until well combined.
6. Pour the batter into the prepared baking dish.
7. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
8. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.

To make the frosting, combine the powdered sugar, unsweetened cocoa, and salt in a large mixing bowl. Gradually add the milk, stirring until smooth. If the frosting is too thick, add more milk, a teaspoon at a time, until the desired consistency is reached.

Assemble the Food by spreading the frosting over the cooled cake, and then placing the marshmallow halves on top.

Enjoy your mouthwatering Food!

904095d715.gt:
In a 10-inch heavy saute pan, heat 1 ounce of clarified butter over high heat.
Add sliced mushrooms one handful at a time to saute pan.
As mushrooms begin to develop rich, brown color, push them to the outside of the saute pan.
Turn the mushrooms over as they begin to color.
When pan becomes dry, add remaining clarified butter to the pan.
Add another handful of mushrooms to the pan and continue until all mushrooms have been added.
Season with salt and pepper after the last addition to the pan has been made.
Make a hole in the middle of the pan and add the shallots.
Deglaze pan with cognac, scraping up any browned mushroom bits.
Add the chives.
Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.
904095d715.pred:
To cook a delightful Food, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the cremini mushrooms with the clarified butter, salt, and pepper.
3. Spread the mushrooms evenly on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
4. Roast the mushrooms in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and golden brown.
5. Remove the mushrooms from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
6. In a small bowl, mix the minced shallots, cognac, and chives.
7. Once the mushrooms have cooled, toss them in the cognac mixture.
8. Serve the mushrooms immediately, garnished with additional chives if desired.

The delightful Food is a roasted cremini mushroom dish with a rich, flavorful cognac sauce. The combination of the earthy mushrooms, the warmth of the cognac, and the freshness of the chives creates a delicious and satisfying dish.

a562032555.gt:
Mix the flour and salt in a large mixing bowl with a wooden spoon.
In another large bowl, empty the yeast package, then slowly add the warm water, mixing with a fork to fully dissolve the yeast.
When the yeast mixture forms some bubbles, add the mixture to the flour/salt, then add the three eggs.
Mix the batter, then set the bowl on top of your refrigerator (or other warm place), cover with damp dish towel.
After 20 minutes, check the dough for rising, mix again and let rise for another 20 minutes.
In a saucepan, heat the oil to medium heat.
Add the dough by the spoonful (about the size of 2 golf balls) Experiment with the first batch to make sure the oil is not too hot.
Remove when golden brown and place on paper bags to absorb the oil.
Place warm Zeppoles in a paper bag with powdered sugar and SHAKE.
Cover with powdered sugar.
a562032555.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the corn oil, all purpose flour, yeast, warm water, eggs, salt, and powdered sugar. Mix until well combined.
3. Gradually add the remaining cup of warm water, stirring continuously to avoid lumps.
4. Knead the dough until it becomes smooth and elastic, about 5-7 minutes.
5. Place the dough in a lightly greased bowl, cover it with a damp cloth, and let it rise in a warm place for about 1-1.5 hours, or until it has doubled in size.
6. Punch down the dough, and then transfer it to a lightly floured surface.
7. Roll out the dough into a rectangle, about 1/2 inch thick.
8. Spread the prepared dough with the remaining cup of corn oil, and then sprinkle the top with the remaining 3/4 cup of all purpose flour.
9. Roll the dough up from the long side, and then cut it into 1-inch slices.
10. Place the slices on a baking sheet, and bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until they are golden brown.
11. Remove the baked scones from the oven, and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

These delicious scones can be enjoyed with a cup of tea or coffee, and can be served as a delightful snack or breakfast option.

6ad5b0a9bb.gt:
Pour 4 oz A&W Rootbeer in a glass
Add vodka and syrup to the root beer, stir well and add ice
6ad5b0a9bb.pred:
1. In a blender, combine 4 oz Diet A&W Rootbeer, 1 oz Sugar free Vanilla Syrup, and 1 1/2 oz Smirnoff Vanilla Vodka.
2. Blend the mixture until smooth and well combined.
3. Pour the blended mixture into a glass filled with ice.
4. Stir the mixture gently to ensure the ice is evenly distributed.
5. Enjoy your delicious and refreshing Smirnoff Rootbeer Float.

45b311a5c9.gt:
Heat oven to 450*.
Grease 6 6oz custard cups.
Beat eggs slightly; beat in flour, milk, and salt.
Beat just until smooth, do not overbeat.
Fill custard cups 1/2 full.
Bake 20 minutes.
Reduce oven temp to 350*.
Bake 20 minutes longer.
Remove from cups.
Serve warm.
45b311a5c9.pred:
[/INST]

[INST] <<SYS>>
To create a delicious and satisfying breakfast dish, you can make a simple frittata. Here's the recipe:
1. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, flour, milk, and salt.
2. Heat a non-stick pan or oven-safe skillet over medium heat. Add a small amount of butter or oil to the pan.
3. Pour the egg mixture into the pan, spreading it evenly. Cook the frittata until the edges begin to set, then cover the pan with a lid.
4. Cook for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until the frittata is fully set and the center is cooked through.
5. Remove the frittata from the pan and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing it into wedges and serving.

Enjoy your delicious frittata made with the provided ingredients!

8b7c0b0b5a.gt:
PLACE frozen yogurt in bowl.
Top with remaining ingredients.
Serve a cookie with the sundae.
8b7c0b0b5a.pred:

2. In a small bowl, mix the low-fat frozen yogurt and fat free chocolate syrup until smooth.
3. Spread the mixture evenly onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
4. Bake the yogurt mixture in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until it is set and slightly crispy on the edges.

292b683c3f.gt:
Blend ice first just a tad.
Then add your milk, hot coffee(don't worry it won't melt anything that much at all.
), oreos and everything else.
Blend for about 1 minute and a half and pour it in a glass.
Enjoy guys.
Please don't get mad if u don't like it.
I was just experimenting and it actually came out pretty good.
Wish I had whipped cream and syrup or it'd be amazing.
I had no heavy cream so I couldn't make it..
If u don't like it though just make whatever changes or additions you feel and tell me what u did and post ur pics.
Thank u all.
Some people may add more oreos or sweetener.
That's up to u. I ran out of my sugar syrup so I didn't add any sugar.
Enjoy everyone.
292b683c3f.pred:
[INST]
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the hot freshly brewed coffee, half and half, or milk, and ice blended a little before anything is added.

59d1e62c4c.gt:
Heat a saucepan over medium heat.
Melt the butter and stir in the garlic and ginger.
Cook for 1 to 2 minutes, or until the garlic is lightly browned.
Add the soy sauce, sake, pineapple juice, rice vinegar and brown sugar.
Bring up to a gentle boil and simmer for 3 minutes.
Whisk the water and the cornstarch together and then whisk mixture into the teriyaki sauce and simmer until thickened, 8 to 10 minutes.
Set aside.
Rinse the chicken wings and pat them dry.
Generously season the chicken with salt and black pepper.
Dredge the wings in flour, shaking off any excess flour, and set aside.
In a large saucepan or deep fryer, heat the oil to about 375.
Fry the chicken wings in small batches until golden brown, 8 to 10 minutes.
Shake off any excess oil and place on paper towels to drain.
Continue frying the chicken in batches until all of the wings are cooked.
Toss the wings in the teriyaki sauce and sprinkle with green onions.
Serve warm.
59d1e62c4c.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the chicken wings, soy sauce, sake, pineapple juice, rice vinegar, brown sugar, water, cornstarch, and salt. Allow the mixture to marinate for at least 30 minutes.
3. In a small bowl, mix the minced garlic and ginger.
4. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the marinated chicken wings and cook until they are golden brown and cooked through, about 10-12 minutes.
5. Remove the chicken wings from the skillet and set aside on a plate.
6. In the same skillet, add the minced garlic and ginger mixture. Cook for about 2 minutes, or until fragrant.
7. Add the flour to the skillet and stir until it forms a smooth, thick paste. Cook for about 1 minute, or until the flour is cooked through.
8. Slowly pour the beaten eggs into the skillet, stirring constantly. Cook until the eggs are fully cooked and the mixture is smooth and creamy.
9. Add the cooked chicken wings back to the skillet and stir to combine.
10. Season the dish with salt and pepper to taste.
11. Serve the dish over rice or noodles, garnished with sliced green onions.

[/INST]

b61f1917f7.gt:
For the salad: First place lettuce in a bowl, then top with chicken, onion, nectarine, raspberries, celery and almonds.
Pour vinaigrette over top and serve!
For the dressing: Put all ingredients in a container that has a good sealing lid and shake the snot out of it.

[/SYS]

[SYS]Add the raspberries to a bowl and toss them with a little bit of olive oil, salt, and honey. Set aside.

[/SYS]

[SYS]In a large bowl, combine the lettuce, chicken, red onion, and nectarine.

[/SYS]

43d8c95718.gt:
Brew coffee using a ratio of about 1 1/2 tablespoons coffee per cup of water.
(We used a single brew coffee maker and used the espresso strength setting that uses less water and brews a stronger coffee.)
Set the coffee aside to reach room temperature or place it in the refrigerator for 10-15 minutes to cool quickly.
Add the room temperature coffee, creamer, raspberry and hazelnut syrups, and the ice into a blender and blend until smooth.
Pour the drink into a tall glass and enjoy!
Optional garnishes: top with whipped cream, shaved chocolate, mint leaves and a raspberry.
43d8c95718.pred:
1. First, prepare the coffee by pouring 4 ounces of Godiva Chocolate Truffle Coffee into a cup.
2. Add 2 tablespoons of Hazelnut Flavored Creamer (or half-and-half) to the cup, stirring gently to combine the ingredients.
3. Next, add 2 teaspoons of Raspberry Syrup and 2 teaspoons of Hazelnut Syrup to the cup, stirring again to mix well.
4. Crush the ice in a separate container using a fork or a similar tool, ensuring that the ice is uniformly crushed.
5. Pour the crushed ice into the cup with the coffee and creamer mixture, stirring gently to combine all the ingredients.
6. Enjoy your delicious, chocolate-flavored coffee drink, which is both creamy and fruity, with a hint of hazelnut and raspberry flavors.

This recipe combines the rich, smooth taste of the Godiva Chocolate Truffle Coffee with the creamy texture of the Hazelnut Flavored Creamer (or half-and-half) and the sweetness of the Raspberry Syrup and Hazelnut Syrup. The crushed ice adds a refreshing, icy touch to the drink, making it a delightful and indulgent treat.

54bc08b13e.gt:
Combine cream, milk, water, cocoa powder, corn syrup, and salt in a medium saucepan.
Bring to a simmer over medium heat, whisking until cocoa powder is completely dissolved.
Remove from heat and add chocolate, butter, and vanilla, stirring until chocolate is melted and sauce is smooth.
Serve warm.
54bc08b13e.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a medium saucepan, combine the heavy cream, whole milk, water, and unsweetened cocoa powder. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens and comes to a boil.
3. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the corn syrup, fine salt, and bittersweet chocolate. Allow the mixture to cool slightly.
4. In a large mixing bowl, beat the butter until soft and creamy. Gradually add the cooled chocolate mixture, beating until smooth.
5. Stir in the vanilla extract.
6. Transfer the mixture to a greased 9-inch (23cm) springform pan.
7. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for about 35-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
8. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for about 10 minutes before removing it from the pan and allowing it to cool completely on a wire rack.

[/INST]

0935eaa489.gt:
Microwave chocolate in microwaveable bowl on MEDIUM 2 min.
or until chocolate is almost melted, stirring after 1 min.
Stir until chocolate is completely melted.
Stir in 3/4 cup each of the grahams and marshmallows.
Spread onto waxed paper-covered baking sheet.
Decorate with remaining grahams and marshmallows.
Refrigerate 1 hour or until firm.
Break into 60 pieces.
0935eaa489.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the Baker's Semi-Sweet Chocolate, Teddy Grahams Honey Cookie, and Jet-Puffed Miniature Marshmallows.
3. Stir the ingredients until well combined.
4. Spread the mixture evenly on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
5. Bake the mixture in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are slightly crispy and the center is set.
6. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Using a spatula or your hands, carefully spread the mixture into a flat, even layer.
8. Cut the mixture into desired shapes using a cookie cutter or a knife.
9. Allow the cookies to cool completely on a wire rack.

Enjoy your delicious homemade chocolate marshmallow cookies!

d3047450d6.gt:
Boil the water and pour a small amount in the teapot, swishing it around to warm the pot.
Combine the mint and green tea and sugar in the teapot, then fill it with the rest of the hot water.
Let the tea brew for three minutes.
Set out glasses for the tea.
A shot-glass is close to the slender glasses used in Morocco.
Fill just one glass with the tea, then pour it back in the pot.
Repeat.
This helps to dissolve and distribute the sugar.
Pour the tea.
You want a nice foam on the tea so always pour with the teapot a high distance above the glasses.
If you do not have at least a little foam on the top of the first glass, then pour it back into the teapot and try again until the tea starts to foam up nicely.
Garnish with the remaining sprigs of mint.
d3047450d6.pred:
1. Begin by washing the sprigs of fresh mint thoroughly under cold water.
2. In a large saucepan or pot, combine the green tea, sugar, and water. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally.
3. Reduce the heat to low and allow the mixture to simmer for about 5 minutes, or until the sugar has dissolved and the tea has infused the flavors.
4. Remove the saucepan from the heat and allow the tea to cool slightly.
5. Carefully remove the sprigs of fresh mint from the water and discard the leaves.
6. Pour the cooled tea mixture into a clean glass or pitcher.
7. Stir in the 10 sprigs of fresh mint, reserving a few sprigs for garnish.
8. Chill the tea mixture in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour or until it reaches your desired temperature.
9. Serve the chilled tea in glasses, garnished with the reserved fresh mint sprigs.

Enjoy your refreshing and delicious mint tea!

eef728c6b8.gt:
Lightly coat a nonstick skillet with cooking spray.
Cook the onion and chiles in the skillet over medium heat for 3 minutes, stirring constantly.
In a small bowl, whisk together egg substitute, cheese, pepper, and Tabasco (if using).
Pour into skillet and scramble for 3 to 4 minutes, until the eggs are done to taste, but not dry.
Place the egg mixture along one-third of the tortilla, about 2 inches away from the bottom.
Fold up the lower edge, then roll from the side to form a burrito.
eef728c6b8.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the butter-flavored cooking spray, chopped onions, and drained canned green chili. Stir until well combined.
3. Add the egg substitute, shredded fat-free monterey jack cheese, and pepper. Stir until well combined.
4. If desired, add a dash of liquid hot pepper sauce for extra flavor.
5. Spread the mixture evenly over the tortillas, leaving a small border around the edges for the crust.
6. Roll the tortillas up, starting from the short end, and place them seam-side down in a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
7. Bake the enchiladas in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the filling is set and the tortillas are golden brown.
8. Remove the enchiladas from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before slicing them into wedges and serving.

Enjoy your delicious homemade enchiladas!

5fff64fad0.gt:
Preheat oven to 375
Melt butter and place in the pan you are using for the cobbler
In a medium Mixing bowl mix together flour, baking powder, 1 cup of sugar and milk ( do not mix while in pan)
On high heat in a medium pot, mix all other ingredients peaches, Lennon juice, Brown sugar, and 2 teaspoons of cinnamon
Poor heated ingredients into pan ( do not mix while in pan)
Sprinkle 2 teaspoons of cinnamon over top
Place in oven
Cook for 30 minutes or until top is golden brown
Serve hot or cool over vanilla ice cream
5fff64fad0.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 1/2 cup unsalted butter, 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1 tbsp baking powder, and pinch of salt. Mix until the dough comes together.
3. Add the 2 cups sugar and 1/4 cup brown sugar, and mix until the dough is smooth and free of lumps.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the 3 canned peaches, 4 tsp ground cinnamon, 1/3 cup brown sugar, and 1 tsp lemon juice.
5. Add the peach mixture to the dough, and mix until well combined.
6. If the dough is too dry, add a splash of milk to achieve the desired consistency.
7. Transfer the dough to a greased baking sheet, and shape it into a flat, even disc.
8. Bake the dough in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until it is golden brown and cooked through.
9. Allow the baked dough to cool for a few minutes before cutting it into slices.
10. Serve the cooled slices with a dollop of whipped cream or ice cream, if desired.

[/INST]

e946c009a6.gt:
In a large nonstick skillet, combine mushrooms, chopped onions and 1/2 cup water.
Cook over medium-high heat, stirring often, until liquid has evaporated and vegetables are beginning to brown.
To deglaze, add 1/3 cup of the vegetable broth and stir to scrape any browned bits free from pan bottom.
Continue to cook, stirring occasionally, until vegetables begin to brown again.
Repeat deglazing and browning steps 2 more times, using 1/3 cup broth each time.
Onion should be golden brown.
This should take about 15 to 20 minutes total.
Remove pan from heat.
In a large bowl, beat eggs to blend.
Stir in shredded zucchini, mushroom mixture, bread crumbs, cheese, pepper and oregano.
Turn into greased 9x13" baking dish, spreading out evenly.
Bake uncovered at 350 until casserole appears set in center when dish is gently shaken -- about 35 minutes.
Let stand 5 minutes, then serve.
e946c009a6.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the mushrooms, onion, and vegetable broth. Season with salt, pepper, and oregano.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and set aside.
4. In a third bowl, mix together the breadcrumbs and grated parmesan cheese.
5. Dip the shredded zucchini in the egg mixture, then coat it in the breadcrumb mixture.
6. Place the breaded zucchini on a baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown.
7. Remove the zucchini from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Carefully slice the cooked zucchini into bite-sized pieces.
9. Serve the zucchini on a plate, garnished with parmesan cheese and a sprinkle of pepper.

[/INST]

df541b69a3.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Coat baking sheet once with cooking spray.
Set aside.
Coat large skillet with cooking spray and place over low heat.
Add onion; cook, stirring often, until just softened, about 3 minutes.
Add garlic and stir 30 seconds.
Add soy meat, breaking it up with a wooden spoon.
Stir in tomatoes, roasted jalapeno, chili powder and cumin.
Mix well.
Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, 8 minutes.
Meanwhile, stack tortillas, wrap in foil and bake until warm and pliable, 8 to 10 minutes.
(Alternatively, using tongs, heat each tortilla over an open flame.)
Place tortillas on work surface and spoon about 3/4 cup meat filling in center of each.
Fold in sides and roll up, jelly-roll style.
Place on prepared baking sheet, seam side down.
Bake until chimichangas are lightly browned, about 30 minutes.
Serve hot with salsa.
df541b69a3.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic, and cook until the onion is translucent.
3. Add the ground soy "meat" to the skillet, breaking it up into small pieces as it cooks. Cook until the meat is browned and cooked through.
4. Add the canned diced tomatoes, roasted jalapeno pepper, chili powder, and cumin to the skillet. Stir to combine.
5. In a small bowl, mix the flour with a little water to form a slurry. Slowly pour the slurry into the skillet, stirring constantly to prevent lumps. Cook for a few minutes, or until the sauce thickens.
6. Place the tortillas on a baking sheet and spoon a little of the meat and tomato sauce onto each tortilla.
7. Bake the tortillas in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the tortillas are crispy and the filling is hot.
8. Serve the tortillas with a dollop of Fresh Tomato Salsa on top.

[/INST]

f5564fb5c4.gt:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
Cut cheese slices into quarters, then cut each piece diagonally in half.
Place crackers in single layer on baking sheet; top with ham and cheese.
Bake 4 to 5 min.
or until cheese is melted.
Top with preserves and onions.
f5564fb5c4.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Cut the 3 KRAFT Slim Cut Swiss Cheese Slices into small, bite-sized pieces.
3. Toast the 24 woven wheat crackers in the oven for about 5 minutes, or until they are golden brown.
4. Slice the 6 slices of OSCAR MAYER Deli Fresh Smoked Ham into bite-sized pieces.
5. In a small bowl, mix the peach preserves with the green onion, sliced.
6. Arrange the toasted crackers on a serving platter or individual plates.
7. Place the sliced ham on the crackers.
8. Distribute the small pieces of Swiss cheese on top of the ham.
9. Drizzle the peach preserves mixture over the cheese.
10. Serve immediately and enjoy your delicious cheese and ham appetizer.

05096fc3ad.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F Coat a standard (12 cup) muffin tin with cooking spray.
In a large bowl, whisk egg whites, sugar, cocoa and salt until combined.
Add coconut; mix until well coated.
***I would add the sliced almonds in at this point with the coconut.
They didn't want to stick to the tops of the cookies!
***.
Dividing evenly, spoon mixture into muffin tin and pat in gently with moistened fingers.
Sprinkle with almonds and pat on gently.

37568c51b9.gt:

Cut the beef in thin slices.

Cut the enoki mushrooms into 3 even lengths, and shred apart.
Cut the tofu into 2 cm cubes.
Bring the dashi stock to a boil and add the ingredients.

Serve in bowls scattered with some chopped green onion.

1 block of Tofu: This is a versatile and protein-rich ingredient that can be used in various dishes, such as stir-fries, soups, or even as a main course.

1 pack of Enoki mushrooms: These mushrooms are small, tender, and have a mild flavor. They are often used in Asian cuisine, adding a subtle earthiness to the dish.

4 cup Dashi stock: Dashi is a Japanese stock made from fish, seaweed, and other ingredients. It is used as a base for many Japanese dishes and provides a rich, umami flavor.

3 tbsp Sake: Sake is a Japanese rice wine that adds a slightly sweet and savory taste to the dish.

1 tbsp Mirin: Mirin is a sweet, low-alcohol rice wine that adds a mild, sweet flavor to the dish.

1/2 to 1 teaspoon Salt: Salt is essential for balancing the flavors in the dish and bringing out the natural taste of the ingredients.

2 tbsp Usukuchi soy sauce: Usukuchi soy sauce is a type of soy sauce that is made from fermented soybeans and has a rich, savory flavor.

1 to garnish Green onion: Green onions add a touch of freshness and a mild, onion-like flavor to the dish.

To prepare the dish, start by cutting the tofu into bite-sized pieces and marinating them in the Dashi stock, Sake, Mirin, and Salt mixture. This will help to tenderize the tofu and enhance its flavor. After marinating, heat a pan or wok over medium heat and cook the tofu until it is golden brown and slightly crispy on all sides.

Next, add the Enoki mushrooms to the pan and cook until they are tender but still slightly crunchy. This will take about 3-5 minutes.

Add the Usukuchi soy sauce to the pan and stir to combine

ed226be03e.gt:
Heat oil in a small frying pan over low heat until hot, about 1 minute.
Add chile flakes and remove from heat.
Let cool to room temperature.
Strain through a fine mesh strainer if desired, then transfer to a container and cover until ready to use.
Heat half of a gas or charcoal grill to high (about 400 degrees F) and the other half to low (about 300 degrees F).
Divide dough in 1/2 and roll into 2 rounds about 1/4 inch thick and 10 inches in diameter.
Brush the top of 1 round with olive oil and sprinkle with salt.
Lay dough oiled side down on the hotter half of the grill and brush the top with oil and sprinkle with salt.
Grill without moving until grill marks form on the bottom of the dough, about 2 minutes.
Flip dough with a spatula or tongs to the cooler half of grill.
Spread 1/2 of the sauce evenly over the dough, sprinkle 1 tablespoon of the Parmesan cheese over the sauce, then top with 1/2 of the peppers, 1/2 of the sausage, and 1/2 of the mozzarella.
Cover and grill, rotating if necessary to avoid any hot spots, until dough is lightly charred and cheese is melted, about 8 to 10 minutes.
Transfer pizza to a cutting board, sprinkle 1 tablespoon more of the Parmesan over top, drizzle with desired amount of chile oil, slice, and serve.
Repeat with second round of dough and remaining toppings.

By following these steps, you will have a delicious and perfectly prepared Food.

42ab84ef73.gt:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Thaw pastry according to directions on box (about 40 minutes).
Cut pastry into 3 sections along perforated lines.
Lay one section of pastry on a baking sheet to assemble.
Spread 2 tablespoons of pesto onto the pastry.
Next, space 5 shrimp evenly on top of the pesto.
Sprinkle with slivers of sundried tomatoes and pine nuts.
Using your fingers, fold over the sides of the pastry so they meet in the middle, and pinch to form a seal (although it will open while baking).
Bake one roll at a time, at 450 degrees F for 5 minutes, then lower oven heat to 375 degrees F and cook an additional 5-8 minutes until pastry is brown and puffed.
Repeat assembly and baking process with remaining two pastry sheets.
Slice each roll into five pieces (one shrimp in each piece) and serve warm.
Makes 15 appetizers.

7. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
8. Allow the cake to cool for a few minutes before cutting it into squares and serving.

259241dc1b.gt:
Drain the tuna, reserving 1 tablespoon of the liquid.
Put the tuna in a serving bowl and mash with a fork until it's as mushy as you can get it.
Stir the reserved liquid, the salad dressing, honey mustard, relish, celery, carrot, sugar, and salt into the tuna.
Adjust seasoning to taste.
259241dc1b.pred:
1. First, open the can of tuna and drain the water.
2. In a small bowl, mix the creamy salad dressing, honey mustard, sweet pickle relish, minced celery, and minced carrot.
3. Add the tuna to the bowl and mix well.
4. If the mixture seems too dry, add a bit more creamy salad dressing or white sugar to achieve the desired consistency.
5. Season the mixture with salt and pepper, to taste.
6. Serve the tuna salad on a sandwich or as a side dish.

a4c28c7c57.gt:
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the olive oil and after the oil is hot, stir in the eggplant.
Cook for 3-5 minutes, turning occasionally, until the eggplant is seared.
Stir in the onions, ginger and garlic, and then cook for about 1 minute, or until soft.
(If the pan is too dry from the eggplant absorbing all the oil, add a touch more olive oil when stirring in the onions.)
Reduce heat to low and stir in the coconut milk, fish sauce, curry powder, brown sugar, black pepper and optional chilies.
Simmer for about 2 minutes or until heated through and eggplant has absorbed some of the sauce.
a4c28c7c57.pred:
To prepare a perfect Food, follow these key steps:

1. Heat a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
2. Add the diced onion and cook until it is softened and slightly browned.
3. Add the sliced Japanese eggplant and cook until it is tender and slightly browned.
4. Add the grated ginger and minced garlic, and cook for a few seconds until fragrant.
5. Pour in the coconut milk, fish sauce, curry powder, brown sugar, and fresh cracked black pepper. Stir to combine.
6. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it cook for about 10-15 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened and the eggplant is tender.
7. If desired, add the sliced Thai chili for a spicy kick.
8. Serve the dish over rice or noodles, garnished with chopped cilantro.

By following these steps, you will have a delicious and well-balanced Japanese eggplant curry that is both flavorful and visually appealing.

8c7a346bad.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Lightly grease a cookie sheet.
Unroll dough on lightly floured surface and press seams together.
Sprinkle one side of block of cream cheese with enough dill to cover.
Place cream cheese, dill side down, in center of dough.
Sprinkle with more dill to cover.
Bring sides of dough up around cheese block and seal to completely enclose.
Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for approximately 15 minutes.
Serve warm.
8c7a346bad.pred:
To cook a delightful Food, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Roll out the crescent roll dough on a lightly floured surface to your desired thickness.
3. Spread the cream cheese evenly over the dough, leaving a small border around the edges.
4. Sprinkle the dried dill weed evenly over the cream cheese.
5. Fold the dough over the cream cheese, pressing the edges to seal.
6. Place the filled dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
7. Bake the crescent rolls for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
8. Remove the rolls from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before cutting them into slices.

This delightful Food combines the flaky texture of crescent roll dough with the creamy, tangy flavor of cream cheese, and the earthy, aromatic taste of dried dill weed. The result is a delicious and satisfying snack or appetizer that can be enjoyed by people of all ages.

af9fb785aa.gt:
Preheat oven to 275F/135C.
In a large bowl toss oatmeal, coconut, nuts, and sunflower seeds together.
In a separate bowl whisk together oil, honey, cinnamon, and vanilla.
Pour liquid mixture over oats and stir until everything is coated.
Pour mixture into a large rimmed baking sheet.
I also cover the baking sheet with baking paper but it's not necessary if you have a non-stick pan.
Bake for approximately 20-25 minutes, stirring once or twice.
Keep an eye on it so it doesn't burn.
Let it cool completely.
Blend in cornflakes if using.
Store in an airtight container.
af9fb785aa.pred:
[INST]

2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the old fashioned oats, unsweetened dried shredded coconut, slivered almonds, chopped walnuts, and unsalted sunflower seeds.

6f1343402a.gt:
Heat cumin seeds and mustard seed in hot dry skillet over high heat, swirling pan, until seeds start to pop.
Reduce heat to medium; add onions, chilies, and add a small amount of water; cook until onion is tender, adding more water as necessary to prevent sticking.
Add potatoes, ground cumin, coriander, turmeric, salt (to taste), and cayenne pepper, stirring to mix well.
Add 2/3 cup water, cover, reduce heat and cook for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until spices are absorbed and potatoes are tender.
Add a small amount of water at a time if all liquid evaporates.
Fold in cilantro just before serving.

1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the cumin seed, brown mustard seeds, and ground cumin.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the ground coriander, turmeric, salt, and cayenne pepper.
4. Cut the large onion into quarters and chop the serrano chilies.
5. Place the potatoes in a large mixing bowl and toss them with the spice mixture.
6. Heat a large skillet over medium heat and add the chopped onion. Cook until the onion is softened and translucent.
7. Add the serrano chilies to the skillet and cook for another minute.
8. Add the potatoes to the skillet and toss to combine.
9. Pour the spice mixture over the potatoes and toss to coat evenly.
10. Transfer the potato mixture to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender and slightly crispy on the edges.
11. Remove the dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
12. Serve the cooked potatoes with a sprinkle of chopped fresh cilantro on top.

193bc22f43.gt:
Microwave broccoli and CHEEZ WHIZ in microwaveable bowl on HIGH 1 min.
or until heated through, stirring after 30 sec.
Lightly smash each potato half with fork or spoon; place on crackers.
Top with broccoli mixture and bacon bits.
Serve warm.

1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked broccoli, Cheez Whiz Cheese Dip, and chopped cooked potatoes.
3. Season the mixture with salt, pepper, and any additional desired herbs or spices.
4. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish or casserole dish.
5. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
6. Remove the dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Serve the dish immediately, and enjoy with RITZ Crackers and OSCAR MAYER Real Bacon Bits as a side.

This delicious Food dish combines the nutritious and flavorful qualities of broccoli, potatoes, and cheese, while also adding a touch of crunch and savory flavor from the RITZ Crackers and bacon bits. The combination of these ingredients creates a satisfying and enjoyable meal that can be easily prepared and shared with friends and family.

f3d6579000.gt:
Combine milk and mustard in bowl; add cheese.
Microwave, stirring every minute, 2-4 minutes or until cheese is melted.
Serve with desired dippers.

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).

4. Spread the mixture onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.

11. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
12. Use a spatula to transfer the cheese and vegetable sticks or apple slices onto a serving platter.

f537025690.gt:
Mix chili sauce, lime juice, fish sauce, and cilantro; set aside.
Divide shrimp into 4 equal portions.
Lay each portion of shrimp in a neat row with tails pointed in the same direction.
Thread 2 thin wood or metal skewers (8 to 10 inches long) about 1 1/2 inches apart through center of each row of shrimp, pushing the shellfish close together.
Place shrimp on an oiled grill above a solid bed of hot coals or high heat on a gas barbecue (you can hold your hand at grill level only 2 to 3 seconds); close lid on gas grill.
Cook, turning once, until shrimp are pink, 2 to 3 minutes a side.
Brush tops of shrimp with the chili sauce mixture, turn over, and cook just until glaze bubbles and browns slightly, about 30 seconds (watch closely; glaze burns easily).
Brush tops with more chili mixture, then turn glaze down and cook just until it darkens slightly, about 30 seconds more.
Transfer shrimp to plates or a platter.
Season to taste with remaining chili mixture and juice from lime wedges.
f537025690.pred:
1. In a large bowl, mix together the 12 cup Thai sweet chili sauce (Mae Ploy), 2 tablespoons lime juice, and 1 tablespoon of Asian fish sauce (nuoc mam or nam pla).
2. Add the chopped cilantro and mix well.
3. Rinse the shelled and deveined shrimp and pat them dry.
4. Add the shrimp to the bowl with the sauce mixture and toss to coat the shrimp evenly.
5. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
6. Heat a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add a small amount of oil and cook the shrimp until they are pink and cooked through, about 2-3 minutes per side.
7. Remove the shrimp from the skillet and set aside.
8. Add the remaining oil to the skillet and cook the shrimp until they are cooked through, about 2-3 minutes per side.
9. Serve the cooked shrimp over a bed of cooked rice or noodles, and enjoy your delicious Thai-inspired dish.

7a6c6f2959.gt:
Dressing:.
Place the almonds and water into a blender or food proccesor and turn on high speed to puree.
Add remaining ingredients, except for oil, and run to blend and whip thoroughly.
With the motor running, slowly pour in oil and run until the dressing is thick and creamy.
(dressing can be prepared and refrigerated for up to 1 week.
).
As stated in the description, you may use 3/4 cup oil and 1/4 cup water or apple juice(or liquid of choice) and get a little thinner dressing.
Let sit for a few minutes to thicken up.
Salad:.
Put 1/2 cup of the dressing in the bottom of your salad bowl.
Add all ingredients, except lettuce, and toss to coat.
Serve:.
Put several lettuce leaves on each plate and add dressed salad.
Serve extra dressing on the side.
Enjoy!

1. In a large bowl, mix together the chopped almonds, water, lemon juice, fresh juice plus, honey, salt, and minced fresh basil. Allow the mixture to sit for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.

9. Serve the cooked ingredients immediately, allowing the flavors to meld together and enjoy the delicious and healthy meal.

c6b05c501b.gt:
Spread 1 bread slice with peanut butter, then spread other bread slice with jam; close to make sandwich.
Cook in skillet sprayed with cooking spray on medium heat 3 min.
on each side or until sandwich is golden brown on both sides.
Let stand 1 min.
; cut into quarters.

1b81060720.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Partially bake the pie crust for 5 minutes according to package (or your recipe) instructions.
Whisk together the sugar, flour, salt and cocoa powder in medium mixing bowl.
Blend in melted butter.
Add the eggs and vanilla and stir until well blended.
Pour into the pie crust and bake 45 minutes.

If crust gets too brown, cover with a pie shield or aluminum foil.
Allow to cool to room temperature (this allows the fudge to set up.)

I micowave a slice for about 20 seconds on high.
Top with your choice of ice cream, fudge sauce, whipped cream, nuts and cherries.

Heat greased barbecue to medium heat.
Grill wings 7 to 8 min.
on each side or until done.
Meanwhile, mix Miracle Whip and Sriracha sauce in large bowl until blended.

Cook dry beans according to instructions on packet.

Saute onions until they are soft and clear.

Heat the oil.
Cut the parts of the potato that you are going to fry into long strips.
If you aren't going to be washing in water, you should fry it quickly or it'll change color.

Cut broccoli and cauliflower into smaller pieces.
Heat water in a large wok to boiling and add broccoli and cauliflower.

283c2400cb.gt:
Transfer cream to bowl of 5-quart electric stand mixer fitted with whisk attachment.
Tightly cover top of bowl and mixer with plastic wrap.
Beat cream at moderately high speed until it holds soft peaks, 10 to 12 minutes.
Increase speed to high and beat until mixture separates into thick, pale-yellow butter and thin, liquid buttermilk, about 5 minutes more.
Strain mixture through colander into large bowl.
Using hands, vigorously knead butter in colander, squeezing out remaining buttermilk, until dense and creamy, about 5 minutes.
Transfer butter to large bowl, reserving buttermilk.
Using hands, knead salt into butter.
Roll into logs and wrap in plastic wrap or transfer to airtight container and refrigerate.
(Butter will keep up to 1 week refrigerated or 1 month frozen.)
Strain buttermilk through fine-mesh sieve, then cover and refrigerate up to 1 week.
283c2400cb.pred:
[INSTRUCTIONS]
1. In a large bowl, whisk together the heavy cream and fine sea salt until the salt is fully incorporated.
2. Place the bowl in the refrigerator to chill for at least 2 hours or overnight.
3. Preheat the 5-quart stand mixer (or larger) and attach the whisk attachment.
4. Slowly pour the chilled cream mixture into the mixer while whisking on low speed.
5. Increase the speed to medium and continue whisking until the cream reaches the desired consistency, which is usually around 70-72°F (21-22°C) and slightly thickened.
6. If the cream is too thick, you can add a small amount of warm water, a few drops of vanilla extract, or a pinch of sugar to achieve the desired consistency.
7. Once the cream reaches the desired consistency, transfer it to a clean, dry container and refrigerate until ready to use.

[/INSTRUCTIONS]

[/SYS]

093fcaf5a6.gt:
Start by heating a medium-sized pot (you will cook everything in this pot) on medium heat, then add the oil.
Once oil comes to temperature, add cubed pork belly.
Cook pork belly, turning as it cooks, until all sides are browned.
Once pork is browned, add onions, garlic, and ginger.
Give a good stir, and continue to cook for about 3 minutes or so.
Add the shrimp paste.
Turn on your vent on high as this stuff has some funk (good funk), and continue to stir.
Toss in chilies, stir again, then add coconut milk.
Bring to a simmer and cook for about 1 hour, on low, stirring along the way.
Before serving, taste and season with salt or pepper.
Now you are ready to dig in.
I like to serve with a small bowl of rice to the side, along with a soup bowl of the Bicol Express.
This dish is rich, creamy, spicy, funky, and overall totally comforting and right up my alley.

5765949efb.gt:
Combine sugar, pecans and orange peel in small bowl.
Melt butter in small bowl in microwave.
Cut cream cheese into 20 pieces the size of butter pat.
Seperate each biscuit in half part way and place cream cheese piece in and pinch edges back together.
Do all 20 biscuits.
Then dip in melted butter and dredge in sugar, pecan mixture.
Stand upright in lightly greased 12 cup bundt pan, space evenly.
Drizzle any remaining butter over and sprinkle with any remaining sugar,pecan mixture.
Bake at 350-375F for 45 minutes or until golden brown.
Immediately invert onto plate.
Combine powdered sugar, cinnamon and water, stir well.
Drizzle over hot bread.
Serve warm.

5bcb6c7ba1.gt:

3In large bowl, beat cake mix, margarita mix, water, oil, egg whites and 3 tsp zest with electric mixer on low speed 30 seconds, then on medium speed 2 minutes, scraping bowl occasionally.
Divide batter evenly among cups (two-thirds full).
Bake 18 to 23 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
Cool 10 minutes; remove from pan to cooling rack.
Cool completely.
In medium bowl, fold whipped topping, yogurt and 2 tsp lime zest until blended; add food coloring if desired and frost cupcakes.
Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup coarsely crushed pretzels.
Store loosely covered in refrigerator.

10. Serve and enjoy your mouthwatering Food!

).
Combine the garlic, lemon juice, salt and pepper in a medium bowl.

Taste and add a pinch of sugar if desired.

Garnish with sprigs of fresh mint just before serving.

f15f7c9832.gt:
Cut the chicken into thin diagonal slices, then into 1 cm strips.
Finely julienne the peppers.
Rub the shio-koji into the chicken.
Add the ingredients and rub to flavor the chicken.
Heat oil in a frying pan.
Spread the chicken and cook over high heat until the edges turn white.
Flip over, and brown both sides.
Add the peppers and shio-konbu and stir fry quickly.
Swirl in the sake and it's done!

57f1deb064.gt:
Heat oven to 400F.

Add the chicken and toss to coat.
Place the chicken in a roasting pan and roast until cooked through, about 45 minutes.

Drain and return to the pot.
Add the parsley and the remaining oil and toss to coat.
Transfer the chicken to individual plates.
Place the pan containing the drippings over medium-high heat.
Add the wine and cook, stirring and scraping the bits from the bottom of the pan, until the wine reduces slightly, about 5 minutes.
Divide the noodles among the plates and spoon the sauce over the top.

To cook a delicious chicken and egg noodle dish, follow these steps:

0f717fcce7.gt:
Bring a pot of water to the boil, add the oranges, cover and simmer for one hour.
Stain off the water.
Cool the oranges.
If you are in a hurry, I suggest you partly cool them -- (this will still work).
While they are cooling, food process the sugar with the eggs until the sugar is dissolved and pour into a bowl.
Cut the oranges in half and de-seed them and put the oranges (with peel and pith) into a food processor and pulp until reasonably smooth.
Pour the pulp into the sugar/egg mix and add the almond meal.
Gently mix together.
Pour mix into baking paper lined 24 - 26cm springform tin and bake for 50 - 60 minutes at 185C.
Serve with creme fraiche, whipped cream, or vanilla ice-cream -- makes an awesome dessert.
You could drizzle a little citrus liqueur around the plate.
Added thoughts -- This cake DOES NOT need any syrup poured over it.
NB.Simply double this recipe to get two large cakes.
It is just as successful.
Occasionally, I will add a slurp of Grand Marnier, Contreau, or Galliano; however, try it plain initially.
0f717fcce7.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. Clean and peel the oranges, removing the seeds and membranes.
3. In a large bowl, mix the peeled oranges, sugar, and eggs until well combined.
4. Add the almond meal to the mixture and stir until well combined.
5. Pour the mixture into a greased baking dish and bake for 45-50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
6. Allow the cake to cool for a few minutes before cutting it into slices and serving.

[/INST]

62bf8025cc.gt:
Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium high heat.
Add the onion and saute for three minutes, then add the garlic.
Continue cooking until the onions are soft, 1-2 minutes more.
Add the water and bring to a boil.
Add the jalapenos and carrots and cook for 5 minutes, until slightly softened.
Add the cider vinegar, 1 tbsp pickling salt, oregano and bay leaves and simmer for 1 minute.
Remove from heat and allow to cool completely.
Transfer the jalapenos, carrots and onions with slotted spoon or tongs into sterilized glass quart-sized jars.
Throw away the bay leaves.
Cover the vegetables with the cooking liquid until the jars are three-quarters full.
Add 1 tbsp pickling salt to each jar and fill to the top with white vinegar.
Cap each jar tightly and store in the refrigerator for up to several months.
The pickled vegetables can be used starting one week later.
62bf8025cc.pred:
To make a delicious Food dish using these ingredients, follow these steps:

2. Add the garlic cloves and cook for a few more minutes, stirring occasionally.
3. Add the water, jalapeno chiles, and carrot to the pot. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 30 minutes or until the carrot is tender.
4. In a small bowl, mix the pickling salt and dried oregano. Stir the mixture into the pot.
5. Add the cider vinegar, stirring to combine. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 15 minutes or until the flavors have melded together.
6. Remove the pot from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Strain the mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into a clean bowl, pressing on the solids to extract as much liquid as possible.
8. Stir in the white vinegar, and season with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Allow the mixture to cool completely before storing it in the refrigerator.

This dish is a flavorful and aromatic blend of ingredients, perfect for a delicious and refreshing salad dressing or marinade.

3af2ae11f5.gt:
Combine salt, pepper, chili powder and bay leaves.
Rub meat completely with liquid Smoke.
Place meat, fat side up, in a large roasting pan.
Sprinkle dry seasoning mixture on top.
Cover tightly.
Bake for 3 1/2 to 4 hours at 325 degrees.
Scrape seasoning off meat and cut in very thin slices across the grain.
Serve with barbecue sauce.
To make sauce, combine all ingredients.
Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally.
Cook for 10 minutes.
Serve with sliced brisket.
3af2ae11f5.pred:
To create a delicious and flavorful beef brisket dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. In a large, heavy-bottomed pot, combine the beef brisket, brown sugar, catsup, water, and liquid smoke. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 2-3 hours or until the beef is tender.
3. Remove the beef brisket from the pot and set aside to cool. Once cooled, shred the beef into bite-sized pieces.
4. In a large skillet, heat the butter over medium heat. Add the celery seeds, cayenne pepper, and dry mustard. Cook for about 1 minute, stirring constantly, until the spices are fragrant.
5. Add the shredded beef to the skillet and stir to combine. Cook for about 5 minutes, or until the beef is heated through.
6. In a small bowl, mix the Worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper. Pour the sauce over the beef mixture in the skillet, stirring to combine.
7. Serve the beef brisket over rice or noodles, garnished with chopped parsley if desired. Enjoy your delicious beef brisket dish!

db5fd3bd93.gt:
Preheat oven to 325 F.
In a large skillet over medium heat, saute the bacon until almost cooked, but not too crisp.
Remove bacon from the skillet with a slotted spoon and place it in a large bowl.
Drain all but about 1 tablespoon of the bacon grease from the skillet and discard it or use it for another purpose.
Add the onion and green pepper into the skillet, if using.
Saute for a few minutes to soften.
Add them into the large bowl with the bacon.
Into the large bowl add the undrained pork and beans, the 2 cans of rinsed and drained beans and the rest of the ingredients and mix well.
Pour into a 9 x 13 inch baking dish.
Cover the dish with a sheet of foil and bake at 325 F for 45 minutes.
Uncover and continue baking for 20-25 more minutes.
Cooks Notes: Sometime I will add a chipotle chile with a little of the adobo sauce that has been finely diced.
You know I cant get enough of those!
It is also delicious to turn them into cowboy beans (what Nanny called them) and add cooked ground beef or sausage.

c7ae046d51.gt:
Place buttermilk, butter or margarine, sugar, salt, flour, whole wheat flour, and yeast into pan of bread machine.
Bake on White Bread setting.
Cool on wire racks before slicing.
c7ae046d51.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the buttermilk, margarine, sugar, and salt. Mix until well combined.
3. Add the bread flour and whole wheat flour to the bowl, and mix until a dough forms. If the dough is too dry, add a bit more buttermilk; if it's too sticky, add a bit more flour.
4. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic.
5. Place the dough in a greased bowl, cover it with a damp cloth, and let it rise in a warm place until it has doubled in size, about 1-2 hours.
6. Punch the dough down and transfer it to a floured surface.
7. Roll the dough out to a thickness of about 1/2 inch (1.5 cm).
8. Cut the dough into desired shapes using a cookie cutter or a knife.
9. Place the shaped dough on a greased baking sheet, and let it rise for another 30 minutes.
10. Bake the cookies in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown.
11. Allow the cookies to cool on a wire rack before serving.

3fcf600832.gt:
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.
In a small bowl, add balsamic vinegar, brown sugar and chicken broth; mix well, set aside.
Rinse pork and pat dry and season with salt and pepper.
In an oven proof skillet, add olive oil and pork.
Sear pork until all sides are seared and lightly brown, about 10 minutes.
Remove pork from pan.
In the same pan over medium low heat, add the balsamic vinegar mixture and stir to loosen up all the brown bits from bottom of pan.
Stir and cook until it resembles a glaze.
Place pork back in pan and turn to coat until all sides are covered with balsamic mixture.
Place in the oven and roast for 25 minutes or until pork is no longer pink.
When pork is done, remove from pan and cover for about 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a skillet, add butter and pears and cook over medium low heat until pears are tender, about 10 minutes.
Just before you take the pears off the stove, add a splash of Stella Artois Cidre and mix well.
Cut pork into 4 equal sizes.
Place 1/2 cup of sweet mashed potatoes on each plate, place the pork over the sweet potatoes, and lay pears over pork.
Sprinkle with goat cheese.
3fcf600832.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced pears and cook until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the balsamic vinegar, brown sugar, chicken broth, salt, and pepper.
4. Season the pork tenderloin roast with salt and pepper. Place the pork in a roasting pan and pour the balsamic vinegar mixture over it.
5. Roast the pork in the preheated oven for about 1 hour or until it reaches an internal temperature of 145°F (63°C).
6. While the pork is cooking, cook the sweet potatoes in a saucepan with a dash of salt and pepper. Cook until they are tender and mash them.
7. In a separate pan, heat the butter or margarine over medium heat. Add the diced pears and cook until they are tender.
8. In a small bowl, mix the goat cheese crumbles with a pinch of salt and pepper.
9. Once the pork is cooked, remove it from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes. Slice it into thin pieces.
10. In a large bowl, combine the cooked sweet potatoes, pork, and pear mixture.
11. Serve the pork and sweet potato mixture over a bed of mashed sweet potatoes.

[/INST]

16241b3374.gt:

Line a baking sheet with parchment paper, set aside.
Combine the peanut butter, brown sugar, granulated sugar, vanilla extract and egg in a large bowl and stir until fully combined.
Form 24 balls, 1-inch in diameter, and set evenly spaced apart on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake until lightly browned and crisp on the edges, 15 minutes.
Remove the cookies from the oven, and cool for 5 minutes.
Use your thumb or the back of a spoon to press into the middle of each cookie to create an indent about 1/4-inch deep.
Spoon 1/2 teaspoon of the chocolate-hazelnut spread into each cookie indent, refrigerate until the chocolate-hazelnut filling is no longer runny, 10 to 15 minutes.
Cook's Notes: These tasty cookies last for up to 2 weeks.

Mix butter, margarine, flour, sugar, vanilla together.
Keep dough in refrigerator overnight.
After the dough has refrigerated overnight, take it out of the fridge, and start making small balls (a little smaller than a golf ball I use a Tablespoon full) out of the dough.
After you make your balls, roll each one out into a flat disc, and add hoop cheese and nuts and a Tablespoon of preserves (or more if youd like) into the center of the disc.
Then roll the discs up.
Seal edges by pinching them together (you can add a little water too, if you need some adhesive) and bake at 350 degrees F until golden brown (roughly 8 10 minutes).
*Hoop cheese is also known as farmers cheese.

7. Add the hoop cheese or farmers cheese, and mix until well combined.
8. Pour the mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.

Sautee onion and celery

587189f28c.gt:
Okay.. so, not everyone is going to be extremely lucky like we were and have their friends spend over 12 hours smoking a pork shoulder with pineapple injection and giving you a Tupperware full to go home with...
But if you are or you know how to smoke your own.. this recipe is super exciting.
Spread out some delicious, crunchy tortilla chips, (I used Calidad brand) on a small baking sheet and cover with shredded cheese of your choice,( again, I used marble cheddar), be thorough, every hates a cheeseless chip.
Put in oven on 350 for about 3-4 minutes or until cheese is melted.
Take chips out of the oven and sprinkle with sliced black olives
Add a moderate layer of refried beans and another layer of cheese and stick back in the oven for 2 minutes
Sprinkle with Tapatio(or your favorite hot sauce
Spread a layer of your shredded meat and another layer of cheese.
Place back in oven for two more minutes.
Get out your salsa, sour cream and guacamole!
I just sliced up an avocado :P. Its time to eat!

7. Stir everything together until the ingredients are well combined and the flavors are evenly distributed.
8. Serve the mouthwatering Food immediately, and enjoy!

Try to avoid smashing tofu.
Drizzle in cornstarch mixture, gently swirling pan to incorporate (sauce will thicken) and simmer tofu in sauce for 2 minutes more.

Transfer to a low bowl or platter.
Sprinkle with scallions and cilantro sprigs.

Have them for breakfast.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with two long sheets of Reynolds Wrap Aluminum Foil, overlapping them in opposing directions so you make a cross, with plenty of foil at each end to eventually fold over into the center.
Lightly spray with cooking spray and set aside.
In a large mixing bowl, stir together cream, shallot and garlic.
Add parsnips, sweet potato and turnip and carefully toss together until all the pieces are well coated.
In another mixing bowl combine 1 cup of cheese, green onion and thyme and toss together.
To assemble, place a single layer of cream-coated root vegetable pieces onto the foil-lined baking sheet and season generously with salt and pepper.

Repeat with another layer of vegetables, salt and pepper and cheese mixture and continue with this pattern until all the ingredients have been used (finishing with a layer of vegetables).
Bring each side of the excess foil hanging over the baking sheet together and seal tightly, leaving room for heat circulation inside.
Bake gratin in the oven for 40 to 45 minutes or until vegetables are fork tender.
Open foil carefully by cutting along top fold with a sharp knife, allowing steam to escape; then open top of foil.
Uncover gratin and sprinkle remaining cheese over the top.
Place gratin under a broiler and broil for 30 seconds to 1 minute or until cheese has melted and the top has browned slightly.
Allow gratin to cool for about 10 minutes before cutting up and serving.

Squeeze cloves into a small bowl and mash with a fork with remaining 1/2 TBS olive oil and 1 TBS balsamic vinegar.
Toss together with potatoes and peppers.

Serve at room temperature.

0118ce719d.gt:
Toast your bread, butter it but not too much so its not soggy, put your seasonings on and dice into bite size pieces and you now have emergency croutons!

8b4a7055f2.gt:
Mix mayo, soy, juice, wasabi and onion together, fold through the crab meat and pile into the prepared avocado.
Serve immediately.
