Beat on low until combined, about 1 minute.
Pour in heavy cream and whip on low for 30 seconds.
Stop the mixer and scrape down the bowl with a rubber spatula.
Turn mixer on medium-high speed and beat for two minutes, or until mixture is thick.
Turn off mixer, then fold in raspberries until just combined.
Pour into cooled pie pan and spread evenly.
Freeze for two hours, or until very firm.
Cut into slices and top each slice with cookie crumbs, dollops of whipped cream, and extra raspberries.
Keep in freezer, allowing time to thaw before serving.
e10d62e4d9.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the melted butter and sugar together until smooth.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the instant vanilla pudding mix and heavy whipping cream.
5. Gently fold the pudding mixture into the butter-sugar mixture.
6. Fold in the raspberries and gently mix until combined.
7. Fold in the melted chocolate sandwich cookies.
8. Spread the mixture evenly into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
9. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
10. Allow the cake to cool completely before cutting it into squares.
11. Garnish with extra raspberries for a touch of color and freshness.

[/INST]

50ad0077cb.gt:
Put all ingredients except the olive oil with the tuna steak to marinade.
Leave it for approximately 30 minutes to marinade (if you leave it longer it with take more in flavor but not necessary for this type.)
After marinating the tuna do not throw away the marinade you will use it as cooking liquid.
Start with a pan and place the olive oil to heat up, place in the tuna 1 minute per side to sear.
Return to low heat and leave it for 8 minutes per piece when the cooking liquid is getting low put some of the marinade.
It will enhance the taste and give it a great taste.
I decorated the plate with some coleslaw, tomatoes, lemon and deep fried potato shavings.
50ad0077cb.pred:
To cook a delightful tuna steak, follow these steps:
1. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet or pan over medium heat.
2. Season the tuna steak with salt and pepper, then add it to the skillet. Cook for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until the tuna is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
3. Pour the white wine over the tuna, and let it cook for a few minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.
4. Add the light soy sauce, and stir to combine.
5. Add the fresh garlic cloves and lemon juice, and stir to combine.
6. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.
7. Serve the tuna steak over a bed of rice or noodles, and enjoy your delicious meal.

[/INST]

d34f8abc06.gt:
Saute pepper and onion in skillet with Pam.
Add soup, Rotel tomatoes and chicken.
Alternate layers of tortillas and soup mix.
Sprinkle cheese on top.
Bake at 325F for 40 minutes or until hot and bubbly.
Serves 4.
WW Points: 5 pt.
d34f8abc06.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the green bell pepper and cook for another 5 minutes, until softened.
4. Add the cubed cooked chicken to the skillet and cook until it is fully cooked through.
5. Pour the Healthy Request cream of mushroom or chicken soup into the skillet, stirring to combine.
6. Add the Rotel Tomatoes, corn tortillas, and shredded Mexican cheese to the skillet. Stir to combine.
7. Pour the mixture into a baking dish, and bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Serve the dish hot, and enjoy!

[/INST]

b7705a9251.gt:
Saute -- In a large pan, heat the oil.
Add the garlic, onion and red pepper and saute for 2-3 minutes on medium until slightly soft.
Beans and spinach -- Add the beans, seasoning and saute on medium high to high until cooked through, about 5 minutes.
As they cook I like to take a fork and slightly mash the beans a bit to get a good consistency.
I like to get them a little crisp and browned but not fried dark brown.
Just a light browning is good.
Add the spinach and break up as it cooks.
If too dry you can use a little white wine, chicken broth or just water to loosen the sauce if necessary.
Garnish with some good olive oil and ground pepper.
b7705a9251.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Rinse the canned beans and drain them.
3. In a large bowl, combine the beans, onion, minced garlic, and dried rosemary.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the olive oil, red pepper flakes, kosher salt, and black pepper.
5. Pour the oil mixture over the beans, onion, and garlic mixture, and toss to combine.
6. Add the spinach, parsley, and minced rosemary to the bowl, and toss to combine.
7. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish or a large casserole dish.
8. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for about 45-60 minutes, or until the beans are tender and the sauce is bubbly and slightly thickened.
9. Remove the dish from the oven, and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.
10. Serve the dish hot, garnished with a drizzle of olive oil.

[/INST]

In the image, there is a bowl filled with a mixture of beans, onion, garlic, and rosemary. The beans are drained but not rinsed, and the dish is ready to be baked. The final dish will be a delicious and healthy meal, perfect for a vegetarian or vegan diet.

db15adcf9f.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Cut tops off of heads of garlic in a straight line across.
Rub extra virgin olive oil all over heads; wrap loosely in foil and place on a baking sheet.
Roast garlic at 400 degrees F until caramelized and soft, approximately 30-35 minutes.
Leave oven at 400 degrees F and line large baking sheet with nonstick foil for easy cleanup.
In a large bowl, add ground turkey breast, chopped baby spinach, chopped fresh parsley, beaten egg, melted palm shortening (or olive oil), salt, pepper, and carefully squeeze roasted garlic heads to release the roasted garlic into the bowl.
With your hands, mix everything together well until all ingredients are incorporated evenly.
Roll balls by hand in uniform sizes to ensure even cooking in the batch.
Place on nonstick foil-lined (or parchment paper) baking sheet.
Bake at 400 degrees F for about 25-30 minutes or until thoroughly cooked.
db15adcf9f.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the extra virgin olive oil over medium heat. Add the ground turkey breast and cook until browned, breaking it up into smaller pieces as it cooks.
3. Add the chopped baby spinach and cook until wilted.
4. Add the chopped fresh parsley and cook for another minute.
5. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg and organic palm shortening or more olive oil until well combined.
6. Add the whisked egg mixture to the skillet with the turkey and spinach. Cook until the egg is fully cooked and the filling is hot.
7. Carefully remove the skillet from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Meanwhile, preheat your oven-safe skillet or baking dish.
9. Place the cooked filling into the preheated skillet or baking dish.
10. Sprinkle the cooked filling with salt and pepper to taste.
11. Place the skillet or baking dish in the preheated oven and bake for 15-20 minutes or until the filling is hot and bubbly.
12. Serve the cooked turkey and spinach filling in the skillet or baking dish, and enjoy your delicious meal!

[/INST]

70b786a095.gt:
Preheat the oven to gas 4 / 180C / 350F with and line 2 baking trays with foil and have 2 spare baking trays handy
Peel the beets and slice very thinly, 1/16 inch thick with a mandolin but be careful of your fingers.
In a large bowl, toss the sliced beets with the extra virgin olive oil
Arrange the beets in a single layer on each tray and sprinkle with a small amount of the salt.
You can use plain sea salt or any flavoured salt of preferrence.
Stack an extra baking tray on top of each layer of beetroot.
This keeps the crisps flat.
Put one tray on the oven top shelf and the other on the bottom
Bake until the edges of the beets begin to dry out, about 20 minutes.
Peek around 17 minutes to check!
Remove the extra trays that are on top of the beets and rotate the trays so the top one now goes in the bottom and the bottom one goes to the top
Bake a further 17 - 20 minutes.
Remove the crisps as they become lighter in color.
Transfer to a wire rack, they will crisp up as they cool
Keep in a lidded container for up to a week
70b786a095.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit (190 degrees Celsius).
2. Wash and peel the beets, then cut them into even-sized pieces.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the beets, extra virgin olive oil, minced garlic, and rosemary sea salt. Mix well to ensure the beets are evenly coated.
4. Spread the beet mixture evenly on a baking sheet or roasting pan.
5. Roast the beets in the preheated oven for about 30-40 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
6. Remove the beets from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
7. Serve the roasted beets as a side dish or a main course, garnished with a sprinkle of rosemary sea salt if desired.

[/INST]

d5926ad471.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 F. Lightly grease and flour a pie dish.
Rub the seasoning on the chicken breasts.
Place in a medium saucepan and add enough water to cover.
Bring to a simmer and cook over medium heat for 10 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through.
Drain and dice chicken.
In a large bowl, combine chicken, cream of chicken soup, cream of mushroom soup, cheddar cheese, mozzarella cheese, mixed vegetables, and salt and pepper.
Mix thoroughly.
Lay one sheet of pastry in the bottom of the greased and floured pan.
Pour chicken mixture over pastry.
Cover with second sheet of pastry.
Seal edges of the top and bottom pastries by pinching them together.
Cut steam vents in the top crust.
Bake in preheated oven for 50 minutes, until pastry is golden brown.
d5926ad471.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the chicken breasts, Old Bay Seasoning, and salt and pepper to taste. Mix well.
3. In a separate bowl, combine the canned condensed cream of chicken soup and canned condensed cream of mushroom soup. Mix well.
4. Pour the soup mixture over the chicken breasts in the large bowl. Mix well to ensure the chicken is evenly coated.
5. Transfer the chicken mixture to a baking dish.
6. Layer the chicken mixture with the shredded cheddar cheese and shredded mozzarella cheese.
7. Add the frozen mixed vegetables on top of the cheese.
8. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Remove the dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
10. Carefully slice the pie crusts into desired shapes and place them on top of the chicken and cheese mixture.
11. Return the dish to the oven and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes or until the crusts are golden brown.
12. Remove the dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
13. Serve the dish immediately and enjoy!

[/INST]

830e83ffb1.gt:
Halve your bread crosswise.
Hollow out the inside of the bread halves to make the pockets.
Do your best to keep from putting holes in the roll.
Fill with your favorite pasta!
Note: Push the pasta mixture down into the bread pocket to allow more spaghetti to fit inside.
Once hollowed out, you can stuff your bread with any pasta.
Try it with a butter sauce, olive oil, pesto, tomato sauce or anything you like.
Go all out and add sausages and peppers, chicken, or mini meatballs.
You can even throw in a Caesar or mixed green salad tossed with dressing.
You are only limited by your imagination.
830e83ffb1.pred:
To create a delicious meal using the ingredients provided, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).

2. Cut the two loaves of French or Italian bread into bite-sized pieces.

3. Cook the pasta of your choice according to the package instructions.

4. While the pasta is cooking, prepare the mini meatballs by mixing ground beef, breadcrumbs, egg, onion, garlic, and seasonings. Shape the meatballs and set aside.

5. Prepare the Caesar salad by tossing the romaine lettuce with a dressing made from Caesar dressing mix, olive oil, lemon juice, and grated Parmesan cheese.

6. Prepare the Greek salad by combining the romaine lettuce, tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, olives, and feta cheese. Drizzle the dressing over the salad.

7. Roast the vegetables of your choice, such as bell peppers, zucchini, and cherry tomatoes. Season with salt, pepper, and your favorite herbs.

8. In a large bowl, combine the cooked pasta, bread pieces, and roasted vegetables.

9. Add the meatballs to the bowl and toss everything together.

10. Serve the meal on a large platter, garnished with additional fresh herbs, if desired.

This meal combines the flavors of French or Italian bread, pasta, and roasted vegetables to create a delicious and satisfying dish. The Caesar and Greek salads provide a refreshing contrast to the main course, and the mini meatballs add a hearty element to the meal.

0dddf99191.gt:
Trim pork tenderloin removing fat and sinew, slice thinly across the grain (1/4" thickness), place in a bowl.
Add marinade ingredients (soy sauce, white wine, sriracha sauce, honey and ginger), mix to distribute sauce evenly and set aside.
Chop veggies.
Heat wok on high heat for a few minutes, add sesame oil, when oil just starts to smoke, add pork slices, turning frequently.
Stir-fry until pork is mostly cooked and opaque, about 5 - 8 minutes.
Remove pork from wok into a clean bowl/plate, set aside.
In the juices left in the wok, stir in chopped garlic, then add broccoli & carrots.
Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, adding more sesame oil if desired.
Add baby corn and stir-fry for another 1-2 minutes.
Return pork to wok and stir into veggies, add more soy sauce, sriracha, and honey if needed to create a liquid gravy of about 1/2 cup in volume.
Push food to the outer edges so liquid is settled in the bottom of wok.
In a seperate bowl combine cool water & corn starch.
Add mixture to liquid gravy in the wok and stir until thickened.
Mix everything together and voila!
Serve immediately with cooked rice.
(Basmati/wild blend cooked in chicken stock and nutmeg is nice!)
0dddf99191.pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix cornstarch with cool water to form a slurry. Set aside.
3. In a large skillet or wok, heat sesame oil over medium-high heat. Add minced garlic and cook for about 1 minute, until fragrant.
4. Add the pork tenderloin to the skillet and cook for about 5-7 minutes, until browned on all sides.
5. Remove the pork from the skillet and set aside.
6. Add the broccoli florets, baby carrots, and baby corn to the skillet. Cook for about 3-5 minutes, until the vegetables are tender but still crisp.
7. Add the cornstarch slurry to the skillet, stirring continuously to prevent lumps. Cook for about 1-2 minutes, until the sauce thickens.
8. Return the pork to the skillet and toss everything together until the pork is heated through.
9. Serve the pork and vegetable mixture over rice or noodles.

[/INST]

7d493176df.gt:
In a large saucepot, combine the potatoes, coleslaw, carrots, and chicken stock.
Add 4 cups water; the liquid should barely cover the vegetables.
Bring to a boil, then cover halfway and reduce the heat to simmer until tender, about 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, whisk the beer and mustard.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to simmer and add the bratwurst.
Simmer gently until cooked through, about 20 minutes.
Using a slotted spoon, transfer the bratwurst to the vegetable mixture; discard the beer mixture.
Divide the stew among dishes and serve with mustard.
7d493176df.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the Coleslaw and carrot chips.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the reduced-sodium chicken broth, beer, and Archer Farms Brew Masters Mustard.
4. Add the beer bratwurst to the bowl with the broth mixture.
5. Carefully transfer the beer bratwurst to a baking tray, making sure not to break them.
6. Drain the mini gold potatoes and pat them dry.
7. Spread the drained mini gold potatoes on a separate baking tray.
8. Roast the beer bratwurst in the oven for 15-20 minutes, or until cooked through.
9. Remove the beer bratwurst from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes.
10. Carefully transfer the cooked beer bratwurst to the bowl with the broth mixture.
11. Add the drained mini gold potatoes to the bowl with the broth mixture.
12. Carefully transfer the mixture to a large pot or oven-safe dish.
13. Cook the dish in the oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender and the liquid has thickened.
14. Serve the dish immediately, garnished with additional beer and Archer Farms Brew Masters Mustard, if desired.

[/INST]

8237def972.gt:
1.
Preheat oven to 375.2.
To prepare cake, combine rhubarb and 2 tablespoons flour in a medium bowl; toss well to coat.3.
Place brown sugar and 5 tablespoons butter in a large bowl; beat with a mixer at medium speed until light and fluffy.
Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition.
Add sour cream, rind, and vanilla; beat until well combined.4.
Lightly spoon 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour and whole wheat flour into dry measuring cups; level with a knife.
Combine flours, baking soda, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, and salt, stirring with a whisk.
Gradually add flour mixture to butter mixture, beating at low speed just until combined.
Fold in rhubarb mixture.
Spread batter into a 9-inch square baking pan coated with cooking spray.5.
To prepare streusel, combine turbinado sugar and 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon in a small bowl.
Cut in 2 tablespoons butter with a pastry blender or 2 forks until mixture is crumbly; stir in nuts.
Sprinkle streusel evenly over batter.
Bake at 375 for 50 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in the center comes out clean.
8237def972.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a 9-inch (23 cm) round cake pan.
2. In a large bowl, combine the chopped rhubarb, flour, brown sugar, and softened butter. Mix until well combined.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs, sour cream, orange rind, vanilla extract, and all-purpose flour.
4. Add the wet mixture to the dry mixture and mix until just combined.
5. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
6. Bake the cake for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
7. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
8. To make the streusel, combine the turbinado sugar, ground cinnamon, and chilled butter in a small bowl. Mix until well combined.
9. Cut the cooled cake into wedges and arrange them on a serving platter.
10. Sprinkle the streusel evenly over the cake.
11. Serve and enjoy!

[/INST]

de5ceb6ef3.gt:
Put yogurt in a bowl.
Stir in ginger, diced chile and salt.
Put oil in a small skillet over medium heat.
Add mustard and cumin seeds and let sizzle until seeds begin to pop, about 1 minute.
Carefully stir hot contents of skillet into yogurt.
Add chopped mint, cover and let flavors mingle for at least 15 minutes.
Raita may be prepared several hours before serving.
de5ceb6ef3.pred:
1. In a small bowl, mix the yogurt, ginger, chile, salt, and vegetable oil.
2. In a small saucepan, heat the mustard seeds and cumin seeds over medium heat until they start to sizzle.
3. Pour the yogurt mixture into the saucepan and stir to combine.
4. Cook the mixture over low heat for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until it reaches your desired consistency.
5. Remove from the heat and stir in the chopped mint.
6. Serve the yogurt sauce immediately or refrigerate it for later use.

[/INST]

This recipe will yield a delicious and flavorful yogurt sauce that can be used as a dip, a topping, or a base for various dishes. Enjoy!

c577db5950.gt:
Squeeze the lime wedges into a small glass; add wedges and mint to glass.
Crush with the back of a spoon for 30 seconds.
Add soda, rum, Simple Syrup, and nectar; stir gently.
Serve over ice.Note: Nutritional analysis includes Simple Syrup.
c577db5950.pred:
1. First, prepare the ingredients:
- Rinse the lime wedges and fresh mint leaves under cold water.
- Crush the ice in a blender or using a rolling pin.
- In a cocktail shaker, combine the crushed ice, 2 tablespoons of rum, 3 tablespoons of Simple Syrup, and 1 tablespoon of mango nectar. Shake well until the ice is cold and the ingredients are well-blended.
- In a glass, combine the 2 lime wedges and 5 fresh mint leaves.
- Pour the shaken mixture over the lime wedges and mint leaves in the glass.
- Garnish the drink with a sprig of fresh mint.

Enjoy your delicious and refreshing cocktail!

2069c35857.gt:
Bring water to a boil in a covered saucepan.
Add butter, cumin, raisins, currants, zest, and rice.
Stir the rice and return to a rolling boil.
Cover and reduce heat to low.
Cook 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat and add chives.
Fluff rice with fork and transfer to a serving dish.
Cover rice liberally with toasted sliced almonds or smoked almonds.
2069c35857.pred:
1. In a large saucepan, combine the water, butter, and cumin seed. Bring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 10 minutes, or until the cumin seed is fragrant and the water has been absorbed.

2. Add the golden raisins, currants, and lemon or orange zest to the saucepan. Cook for an additional 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.

3. Add the rice to the saucepan and stir to combine. Cook for about 15 minutes, or until the rice is tender and the liquid has been absorbed.

4. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the chopped chives.

5. Serve the savory Food hot, garnished with the lightly toasted or smoked almonds.

[/INST]

e55ff056b8.gt:
1.
Mix soy sauce, lime juice, vegetable oil, chili garlic sauce and ketchup.
2.
Add chicken breasts to mixture and refrigerate for at least 6 hours.
3.
Remove from refrigerator and season chicken with salt and pepper.
4.
Place on a hot grill or bake in a 400 degree oven until cooked completely through.
A meat thermometer should read at least 155-160 degrees.
5.
Mix mayonnaise and Thai chili sauce.
Both the Thai chili sauce and the chili garlic sauce should be available in the Asian food section of the grocery store.
4.
Brush 1 Tbl of the mayonnaise-Thai chili sauce mixture over each hamburger bun.
5.
Place chicken on the bun and serve with lettuce and tomato.
e55ff056b8.pred:
To create a delicious and flavorful dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).

2. Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper, then place them on a baking sheet.

3. In a small bowl, mix the Thai sweet chili sauce and chili-garlic sauce.

4. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken breasts and cook until they are fully cooked through, about 6-8 minutes per side.

5. While the chicken is cooking, prepare the buns by spreading mayonnaise on both sides.

6. Once the chicken is cooked, remove it from the skillet and place it on a plate.

7. In the same skillet, add the ketchup, lime juice, soy sauce, and the sauce mixture you prepared earlier. Cook the sauce over medium heat until it thickens slightly, about 2-3 minutes.

8. Place the cooked chicken on top of the sauce mixture, then top it with the buns, cut side up.

9. Serve the dish immediately, and enjoy your delicious chicken sandwich with Thai sweet chili sauce and chili-garlic sauce.

[/INST]

f1211da4d4.gt:
In a serving dish, add quinoa, watermelon, red onion, feta and mint.
Gently toss to combine.
Drizzle in olive oil and balsamic vinegar.
Toss to combine.
Top with mint garnish.
Serve chilled.
f1211da4d4.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, watermelon balls or cubes, thinly sliced red onion, and crumbled feta.
3. In a small bowl, mix the extra virgin olive oil and balsamic vinegar.
4. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat evenly.
5. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
6. Transfer the salad to a serving dish and garnish with torn mint leaves.
7. Serve immediately and enjoy!

[/INST]

[/SYS]

ee5c4e9487.gt:
Arrange cauliflower and carrots in four half-pint canning jars; set aside.
Heat remaining ingredients to a boil in a saucepan over medium heat, cook 10 minutes.
Turn off heat; let steep 5 minutes.
Pour mixture over the vegetables to cover.
Cover jars tightly; cool to room temperature, about 1 hour.
Refrigerate at least three days before serving.
ee5c4e9487.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the cauliflower florets with the olive oil, salt, and pepper.
3. Spread the cauliflower out on a baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the cauliflower is tender and slightly caramelized.
4. While the cauliflower is cooking, in a small bowl, whisk together the white wine vinegar, sea salt, dry mustard, cumin, and turmeric.
5. Once the cauliflower is cooked, remove it from the oven and let it cool slightly.
6. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the sliced carrots and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until they are tender but still slightly crisp.
7. Add the garlic to the skillet and cook for 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant.
8. Pour the white wine vinegar mixture over the carrots and garlic in the skillet, and stir to combine.
9. Add the cooked cauliflower to the skillet and stir to combine.
10. Serve the dish immediately.

[/INST]

This recipe is a delicious and healthy way to prepare cauliflower and carrots, incorporating a variety of flavors and textures. The dish can be enjoyed as a side dish or as a main course, depending on the portion size.

97b16dfccd.gt:
Cook pasta according to package directions.
Drain and set aside in a large bowl.
Cook bacon.
When cool enough, crumble into bite-size pieces.
Set aside.
In a small bowl, stir together the ranch dressing, green onions, cheddar cheese and black pepper.
Pour mixture over the pasta and add chopped bacon.
Stir together and serve.
97b16dfccd.pred:
1. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions, usually boiling for 8-10 minutes.
2. While the pasta is cooking, cook the bacon in a pan over medium heat until crispy.
3. Once the pasta is cooked, drain it and set it aside.
4. In a small bowl, mix the buttermilk ranch dressing.
5. In a large bowl, combine the cooked pasta, crispy bacon, green onions, and shredded cheddar cheese.
6. Toss the pasta mixture with the buttermilk ranch dressing, and season with black pepper to taste.
7. Serve the delectable Food immediately.

[/SYS]

f78a4f2c70.gt:
Preheat oven to 425F.
Coat baking sheet with cooking spray.
Heat large, deep skillet over medium heat.
Add 1 Tbs.
oil, and swirl to coat pan.
Add onion and cook 5 minutes, or until onion becomes translucent, stirring often.
Stir in button mushrooms, garlic, and salt, and cook 8 to 10 minutes, or until mushrooms are soft and most of liquid is evaporated, stirring frequently.
Stir in rice, and cook 1 to 2 minutes longer, or until heated through.
Remove from heat, and stir in goat cheese.
Fill each portobello with about 1/3 cup filling mixture.
Toss tomatoes with lemon juice in bowl, and lay tomato halves cut-side up over tops of filled portobellos.
Place stuffed portobellos on baking sheet greased with remaining 1 Tbs.
oil, and sprinkle each with 1 tsp.
breadcrumbs.
Bake 30 to 35 minutes, or until mushrooms are cooked through and breadcrumbs are golden.
Sprinkle with parsley.
f78a4f2c70.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat 1 Tbs. of the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the mushrooms and cook until they release their liquid and become tender, about 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
4. In a separate skillet, heat the remaining 1 Tbs. of olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
5. Add the cooked wild rice to the skillet with the mushrooms and stir to combine. Cook for a few minutes until the rice is heated through.
6. In a small bowl, mix the herbed goat cheese, lemon juice, and breadcrumbs. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Place the portobello mushrooms on a baking sheet and season with salt and pepper. Drizzle with the herbed goat cheese mixture and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the mushrooms are tender and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. In a large bowl, toss the cherry tomatoes with the lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper.
9. To assemble the dish, place the cooked portobello mushrooms on a plate, and top with the cooked wild rice mixture. Garnish with chopped parsley.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

d1d3e72257.gt:
Dice the tomato into 2-3 cm cubes.
Thinly slice the garlic.
Salt and pepper the cod.
Prep the shrimp.
Put the olive oil, red chili pepper, and garlic into a frying pan and saute over low heat.
Add the cod and cook both sides over medium heat.
Add the shrimp.
Quickly cook both sides, and add the water and tomatoes.
When it comes to a boil, simmer for 4 minutes over medium to high heat as you pour the broth over the fish.
Add the olive oil, and season with herb salt once the acqua pazza comes to a boil.
Dish it up, and scatter parsley on top.
d1d3e72257.pred:
To create a delicious and satisfying dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the sliced garlic, thinly sliced onion, and a pinch of salt. Allow the mixture to sit for 5-10 minutes to release the flavors.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the herb salt, olive oil, and a pinch of salt.
4. Rinse the shrimp and pat them dry with paper towels.
5. Place the shrimp in the bowl with the garlic and onion mixture, and toss to coat the shrimp evenly.
6. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the olive oil and the shrimp mixture, and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the shrimp are cooked through and the garlic is fragrant.
7. Remove the shrimp from the skillet and set aside.
8. In the same skillet, add the sliced onion and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the onion is softened.
9. Add the red chili pepper and cook for 1-2 minutes, or until the chili pepper is slightly charred.
10. Add the water to the skillet and bring to a boil.
11. Add the tomatoes, herb salt mixture, and the cooked shrimp to the skillet. Simmer the mixture for 5-7 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened and the shrimp are heated through.
12. Season the dish with salt and pepper to taste.
13. Serve the dish over cooked pasta or rice, and garnish with chopped parsley or Italian parsley.

This recipe combines the flavors of shrimp, tomatoes, garlic, and chili pepper to create a delicious and satisfying dish. The combination of ingredients results in a rich and flavorful meal that is both visually appealing and delicious.

a0e261ef2d.gt:
Stir liquid soap into baking soda.
Add the water, and stir to be as smooth as possible.
Add the vinegar and stir again.
Pour into a squeeze bottle.
(A clean, empty ketchup or syrup bottle works well.)
Shake well before using, and keep tightly closed between uses.
a0e261ef2d.pred:
To make the Food using the provided ingredients, follow these steps:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 12 cups of baking soda and the 12 cups of liquid soap.
2. Gradually add the 23 cups of water, stirring constantly to ensure the mixture is well-blended.
3. Once the mixture is smooth, add the 2 tablespoons of white vinegar, and mix until the desired consistency is achieved.
4. Use the prepared mixture to make the Food, following the recipe or instructions provided.

Please note that the specific instructions for making the Food may vary depending on the recipe or dish being prepared. Always consult the recipe or instructions provided to ensure the best results.

8afb34ca7c.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Quarter the large strawberries and halve the smaller ones.
Place the strawberries in a 9-inch pie plate or 8x8 baking dish.
Sprinkle the sugar over the strawberries and toss several times.
Roast the strawberries for 15-20 minutes, stirring once during the baking time.
The strawberries are done when they have softened and the juices are thick and bubbly.
Cool completely and store in the fridge.
8afb34ca7c.pred:
1. Wash the strawberries thoroughly to remove any dirt or debris.
2. Cut the strawberries into halves or smaller pieces, depending on the desired size.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the strawberries, sugar, and any desired additional ingredients (e.g., lemon juice, vanilla extract, or cornstarch).
4. Mix the ingredients together until the sugar is evenly distributed and the strawberries are coated.
5. Cover the bowl and refrigerate the mixture for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
6. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
7. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat to make it easy to remove the cooked strawberry mixture.
8. Spread the cooled strawberry mixture evenly over the prepared baking sheet.
9. Bake the strawberry mixture in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the edges are slightly caramelized and the mixture is bubbly and cooked through.
10. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
11. Using a spatula or a butter knife, carefully transfer the cooked strawberry mixture to a serving dish.
12. Serve the strawberry mixture immediately, or refrigerate it for a few hours to allow the flavors to meld together even more.

[/INST]

bbff2a5297.gt:
Clean the shrimp and pat dry.
Slice and toast the baguette.
Peel all the garlic and mince finely.
Add to a pan over medium low heat with the olive oil.
We have a clay pot from Spain, but any pan will work.
Keep stirring, allowing the garlic to sizzle lightly (you want to make sure not to burn the garlic) for a few minutes.
Add the paprika, salt and pepper, and stir.
Bring the heat up to medium and add the shrimp to the pan.
Let the shrimp cook for 90 seconds, flip, and add the white wine.
Let everything cook together for another 2 minutes, or until the shrimp is just cooked through.
Place shrimp on toasted bread, drizzle with garlic oil, and garnish with parsley.
bbff2a5297.pred:
1. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine shrimp, garlic, olive oil, paprika, smoked paprika, salt, and black pepper. Mix well.
3. Spread shrimp mixture evenly on a baking sheet.
4. Roast shrimp in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until cooked through and pink.
5. Remove from oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
6. In a small bowl, mix white wine and chopped parsley.
7. Pour the white wine mixture over the cooked shrimp and toss to coat.
8. Serve the shrimp immediately, garnished with parsley.

[/INST]

53ee6640d1.gt:
Using an espresso machine or cappuccino maker, prepare 2 shots espresso.
Fill a large serving glass 2/3 with ice.
Do not use extract or ice cream topping in place of syrup (use types specially made for beverages).
Add vanilla syrup, sugar (if desired), and espresso to glass and top up with cold milk.
Stir or shake briskly until syrup and sugar is nicely blended in the drink.
53ee6640d1.pred:
1. In a saucepan, heat the milk over medium heat until it reaches the desired temperature.
2. Add the sugar and vanilla coffee syrup or other flavor coffee syrup, stirring to combine.
3. If desired, add ice to the mixture to achieve the desired consistency.
4. Pour the mixture into a mug and add the espresso.
5. Stir the ingredients together to ensure they are well combined.
6. Enjoy your delicious coffee drink.

[/INST]

b3eb381c7e.gt:
Finely grind almond paste in processor.
Add softened butter, flour, and egg; blend until smooth.
Preheat oven to 400F.
Roll out puff pastry on floured surface to 13x11-inch rectangle.
Fold 3/4 inch of edges over; press to adhere to make 11 1/2x9 1/2-inch rectangle.
Transfer to rimmed baking sheet.
Pierce surface evenly with fork, avoiding folded edges.
Spread almond paste mixture evenly over crust within folded edges.
Arrange pear slices atop filling, overlapping slightly.
Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon sugar.
Bake until crust is deep golden and pears are tender, about 38 minutes.
Cool slightly.
Meanwhile, stir vinegar and remaining 1/4 cup sugar in heavy small saucepan over medium heat until sugar dissolves.
Increase heat; boil until syrup is reduced to 1/4 cup, about 6 minutes.
Place tart on platter.
Drizzle syrup over.
Sprinkle lightly with peppercorns and serve warm.
b3eb381c7e.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the almond paste, crumbled butter, and flour. Mix until well combined.
3. Add the large egg and mix until the dough comes together.
4. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to a thickness of about 1/4 inch.
5. Transfer the dough to a 9-inch (23 cm) round, springform pan, or a similar-sized baking dish.
6. Arrange the sliced pears on top of the dough, leaving a small border around the edges.
7. In a small bowl, mix the sugar and black raspberry vinegar or raspberry vinegar.
8. Sprinkle the crushed pink peppercorns over the pears, if desired.
9. Bake the pastry for 35-40 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbly.
10. Remove the pan from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
11. Carefully remove the pastry from the pan and let it cool completely on a wire rack.
12. Slice and serve the pastry.

[/INST]

048c81274c.gt:
in small sauce pan boil chiles and tomatillos.
when tender add to blender with onion and garlic.
blend on high until smooth.
in large fry pan melt butter/margerine and add cooked pasta.
cooke mixing every few minutes to prevent burning.
the color ur looking for is about 1/4-1/2 of the pasta turning golden brown.
add salsa from blender to pasta and mix thoroughly.
Then add sour cream/ crema mexicana and mix thoroughly.
salt to taste at this time.
lower heat to low and let simmer and obsorb juices.
crumble cheese on top and cover with lid to allow some melting...
serve right away and enjoy..goes well with any meat dish or even just a salad...
048c81274c.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet or oven-safe pan, melt the butter or margarine over medium heat.
3. Add the cooked angel hair pasta to the pan, stirring to combine with the melted butter or margarine.
4. Add the tomatillos, jalapenos, and garlic to the pan. Cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender.
5. Add the panela or queso fresco cheese to the pan, stirring to combine with the pasta and vegetables.
6. Season the mixture with salt to taste.
7. Transfer the pasta and vegetable mixture to a large baking dish or oven-safe casserole dish.
8. In a small bowl, mix the crema mexicana or sour cream with the clove of garlic and a pinch of salt.
9. Pour the crema mixture over the pasta and vegetable mixture.
10. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the pasta is cooked through and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
11. Serve the dish immediately and enjoy!

[/INST]

18f9bb7f6e.gt:
Mix all ingredients except the Romaine and the whole croutons in a small bowl or a "cruet".
Toss with Romaine and croutons.
Serve with a sprinkle of fresh shredded parmesan.

1. In a large bowl, combine the olive oil, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, Dijon mustard, garlic, and crushed red pepper flakes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
2. Add the grated parmesan cheese and crushed croutons to the bowl, and toss to combine.
3. In a separate bowl, combine the torn romaine lettuce and croutons.
4. To assemble the salad, place the dressing mixture in the center of the salad, and toss to coat the lettuce evenly.
5. Serve the salad immediately, garnished with the anchovy, if desired.

5f080b5a48.gt:
Preheat oven to 375.
Cream together eggs, butter, both sugars, crisco, and vanilla.
In separate bowl mix dry ingredients and slowly add to the wet.
Spoon on to cookie sheets.
You can roll each dough ball in sugar or icing them later if desired.
Bake at 375 for 12-15 minutes.
5f080b5a48.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the butter, Crisco, and sugar.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the powdered sugar, vanilla, and salt.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients (flour, baking soda, cream of tartar) to the wet ingredients, mixing until well combined.
6. If the dough is too dry, add a small amount of water, one tablespoon at a time, until the desired consistency is reached.
7. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to 2 hours.
8. On a floured surface, roll out the dough to your desired thickness (1/4 inch or 1/2 inch).
9. Use a cookie cutter or a round cookie cutter to cut out your desired shapes.
10. Place the cookies on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
11. Bake the cookies for 8-10 minutes, or until they are golden brown around the edges.
12. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

These instructions should provide a clear and concise guide for cooking up a delicious Food using the provided ingredients. Remember to follow the recipe carefully and adjust the baking time and temperature according to your oven and the thickness of the cookies. Enjoy your homemade treats!

ede4b858c3.gt:
Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
Drizzle 1 tablespoon of olive oil over both sides of each mushroom.
Sprinkle the mushrooms with salt and pepper.
Grill until the mushrooms are heated through and tender, about 5 minutes per side.
Meanwhile, add the extra-virgin olive oil and garlic in a medium bowl, and whisk until well blended.
Toss the tomatoes, cheese, and basil until evenly coated.
Season with salt and black pepper.
Place 4 hot grilled mushrooms gill side up on 4 individual plates.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper if needed.
Fill up the mushroom cap with the bruschetta and cheese mixture.
Drizzle a little bit more extra-virgin olive oil over if needed.
Serve and enjoy!
ede4b858c3.pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the mushrooms and cook until they are tender, about 5-7 minutes. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the minced garlic, salt, and black pepper.
4. Add the garlic mixture to the skillet with the mushrooms and cook for another 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. Add the tomatoes and cook until they are softened, about 5-7 minutes.
6. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked mushrooms, tomatoes, and garlic mixture.
7. Add the basil leaves and mozzarella cheese to the bowl and toss to combine.
8. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Serve the dish immediately, and enjoy your delicious portabello mushroom and tomato bake.

[/INST]

b65ea7e6a7.gt:
Boil the pasta according to the instructions on the package.
In a large frying pan, heat the oil and over a medium heat, soften the garlic.
After a couple of minutes, add the tomatoes, tomato puree and sugar, and leave to stew over medium-low heat for 10 minutes.
Add the mascarpone and stir until it has melted into the sauce.
Add the parsley or basil and season to taste with salt and pepper.
When it is ready, drain the pasta and add it to the pan with the sauce.
Mix well and then serve.
b65ea7e6a7.pred:
1. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions, usually boiling for about 8-10 minutes.
2. In a large skillet, heat the sunflower oil over medium heat.
3. Add the minced garlic and cook for about 1 minute, stirring constantly, until fragrant.
4. Add the diced tomatoes and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. Add the tomato puree, sugar, salt, and pepper. Cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. Add the cooked pasta to the skillet and toss to combine.
7. Add the mascarpone cheese and stir until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth.
8. Add the finely chopped parsley or basil and stir to combine.

[/INST]

fcb625ec64.gt:
Cut the carrot into thin strips.
Rehydrate the kanpyo in water.
Place the pork into the kombu, and then place the carrots on top.
Roll it up from the front with the carrot, and tie in two places with the kanpyo.
Add the A condiments and Step 2 to a pot, cover with a drop lid, and boil for at least 40 minutes until the kombu softens.
Stick with a toothpick, and cook until it pierces straight through.
After it has softened, turn off the heat, let cool, cut into half, and arrange on a plate.
fcb625ec64.pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Clean and cut the carrot into small, even pieces.
3. Clean and cut the ginger pork meat into small, even pieces.
4. Clean and cut the kanpyo into small, even pieces.
5. Rinse the kombu under cold water and pat it dry with a paper towel.
6. In a large pot, combine the dashi, sake, mirin, sugar, and soy sauce. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat.
7. Add the ginger pork meat, carrot, and kanpyo to the pot. Cook the ingredients for about 10-15 minutes, or until the pork is cooked through and the vegetables are tender.
8. Transfer the cooked ingredients to a large mixing bowl.
9. Add the cooked rice to the bowl, and mix everything together until well combined.
10. Transfer the mixture to a greased baking dish, and bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the rice is cooked through and the dish is heated through.
11. Serve the dish hot, and enjoy your delicious homemade Food!

[/INST]

[/INST]

6206f8059f.gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees.
Lightly grease a 9 x 5 loaf pan.
In a large bowl, combine butter, sugar, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg, baking soda, baking powder and salt, beating till smooth.
Add the mashed bananas, jam, honey and eggs, again beating until smooth.
Add the flour, then the walnuts, stirring just until smooth.
Spoon batter into the prepared loaf pan, smoothing the top.
Let rest at room temperature for 10 minutes.
Bake bread for 45 minutes.
Gently lay a piece of aluminum foil across the top, to prevent over-browning.
Bake for an additional 20 to 25 minutes.
Remove the bread from the oven; a long toothpick or cake tester inserted into the center should come out clean, with the most a few wet crumbs clinging to it.
The tester shouldn't allow any sign of uncooked batter.
If it does, bake the bread an additional 5 minutes, or until it tests done.
Allow the bread to cool 10 minutes in the pan.
Remove it from the pan, and cool it completely on a rack.
6206f8059f.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the vanilla extract and cinnamon, and mix well.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the nutmeg, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, alternating with the honey, and mix until just combined.
6. Fold in the mashed bananas and chopped walnuts.
7. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9x13 inch baking dish.
8. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
9. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.
10. Once cooled, dust the cake with powdered sugar, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious homemade banana cake!

fd96b8b1a7.gt:
Heat about 1-2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a saucepan over medium low heat.
Add the mushrooms.
Cook them with the lid on for about 9 minutes or until golden brown, stirring occasionally.
Transfer to a food processor and pulse until finely ground.
In the same saucepan (add a little more oil if needed), over medium low heat, combine the minced mushrooms and onions.
Saute until onions are nice and soft and then add the ground turkey.
As it cooks, break up the turkey.
After a few minutes add all of the remaining ingredients (except the buns).
Continue to cook until the turkey is browned and no longer pink.
Spoon mixture onto buns and top with shredded cheddar cheese, if desired.
(Recipe adapted from Pass The Sushi, who in turn adapted it from Americas Test Kitchen.)
fd96b8b1a7.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet or oven-safe pan, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the mushrooms and cook until they are tender, about 5-7 minutes.
3. Add the diced onion and cook until it is softened, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the ground turkey and cook until it is browned and cooked through, breaking it up into smaller pieces as it cooks. Season with salt and pepper.
5. In a small bowl, mix the ketchup, mustard, BBQ sauce, apple cider vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, chili powder, garlic powder, and cayenne pepper.
6. Add the cooked turkey mixture to the skillet or pan, and stir in the sauce mixture. Cook for a few minutes, until the flavors are combined.
7. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish or a casserole dish.
8. Add the buns, cut side down, on top of the filling.
9. Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the buns are golden brown and the filling is hot and bubbly.
10. Serve the delicious Food hot, and enjoy!

643060cd52.gt:
Throw all ingredients into a bowl and combine!
(You can add 3tsp of Cacao powder for a slight chocolatey flavour)
643060cd52.pred:
1. In a blender or food processor, combine the 4 tablespoons of casein protein powder, 4 tablespoons of peanut butter, and 8 cubed small dates.
2. Add 1 tablespoon of honey and 7 tablespoons of water to the mixture.
3. Blend the ingredients until smooth and creamy.
4. Optionally, you can add a pinch of salt and a sprinkle of cinnamon for extra flavor.
5. Pour the mixture into a bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
6. Serve the creamy, nutritious, and delicious dessert or snack.

This recipe creates a delicious and nutritious treat that combines the protein and healthy fats from the casein protein powder and peanut butter with the natural sweetness of the dates and honey. The addition of water helps to create a smooth and creamy texture, while the salt and cinnamon add a touch of flavor. This recipe is suitable for those looking to incorporate more protein and healthy fats into their diet while enjoying a tasty and satisfying treat.

84fd3c9208.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees, cut top off of squash and remove pulp and seeds, place upside down on cookie sheet and fill pan 1/2 way up with water, cover with foil and bake 45 minutes, remove and make sure it is fork tender, if not continue cooking in 10 minute intervals, leave on pan to cool.
While it is baking, in rice cooker cook rice with 2 cups vegetable broth, diced zucchini, 1 diced carrot, chopped parsley, and about 1/2 cup water.
When rice is done cooking, stir it well and add the raw tomato, pepper and 1/2 of the onion diced.
In a Large skillet add olive oil and brown 1/2 of the diced onion, when brown add the ground turkey, sage, garlic and mushrooms -- continue cooking until meat is done -- add the rice mixture to the meat mixture and stir well, use the remaining vegetable broth to deglaze pan and get moisture level up for oven baking.
Remove about 3/4 of the squash meat and puree for pie or freeze for later use.
Fill squash with the rice/meat mixture about 1/2 full then add 1/2 the cheese, then layer remaining rice mixture on top and top it all with the remaining 1/2 cup of cheese.
Bake at 350 degrees for about 20 minutes just to get the cheese melted and the flavors melded.
Makes a great presentation to the table with the squash full of the meal!
84fd3c9208.pred:
To prepare the delicious meal, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Cut the squash into 1-inch pieces and toss them in a large bowl with olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread them out on a baking sheet and roast for 30-40 minutes, or until tender and slightly caramelized.
3. In a large pot, combine the brown rice, white rice, vegetable broth, and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 45-50 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed.
4. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion, garlic, and mushrooms, and cook until the onion is translucent and the mushrooms are tender.
5. Add the ground turkey to the skillet and cook until browned, breaking it up into smaller pieces as it cooks.
6. Add the zucchini and carrots to the skillet, and cook until they are tender.
7. Stir in the cooked squash, sage, and ground sage.
8. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Serve the meal on a large platter, garnished with fresh parsley and grated parmesan cheese. Enjoy your delicious and nutritious meal!

0f967b0694.gt:
In a large bowl, toss together the spinach, cranberries, blue cheese, tomatoes, avocado and red onion; set aside.
In a small bowl, whisk together jam, vinegar, walnut oil, pepper and salt.
Taste, and adjust amounts to suit your liking.
Pour over the salad and toss to coat.
0f967b0694.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the spinach, cranberries, blue cheese, and chopped tomatoes.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the raspberry jam, red wine vinegar, and walnut oil.
4. Pour the dressing over the spinach mixture and toss to coat evenly.
5. Season the salad with salt and pepper to taste.
6. Transfer the salad to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the spinach is tender and the dressing is slightly caramelized.
7. Remove the salad from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Add the diced avocado to the salad and toss to combine.
9. Serve the salad immediately, garnished with freshly ground black pepper and a drizzle of walnut oil if desired.

[/INST]

ec81905a61.gt:
Place the dry pancake mix into a large bowl.
Add the eggs, club soda and melted shortening.
Use a wire whisk to mix carefully until there are no lumps (dont over mix).
Allow the batter to rest while you preheat your griddle or skillet over medium-high heat.
Use about 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in the preheated skillet for each pancake; use 1/2 cup batter for each pancake.
Flip pancake only once when you see open bubbles appear on the surface and the edges appear dry around the pancake.
Makes about 10 pancakes 8 inches in diameter.
ec81905a61.pred:
To cook a delightful Food, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine 4 cups of Bisquick or 4 cups of Jiffy baking mix, 3 extra large eggs, beaten, and 14 cups of melted Crisco shortening. Mix until well combined.
3. Add 2 cups of club soda, room temperature, to the mixture and stir until the batter is smooth and well combined.
4. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9x13 inch baking dish.
5. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
6. Allow the cake to cool for a few minutes before removing it from the baking dish and allowing it to cool completely on a wire rack.

This delightful Food is a delicious and moist cake that is perfect for serving at gatherings or enjoying as a treat on its own. The combination of Bisquick, Jiffy baking mix, eggs, Crisco shortening, and club soda creates a tender and flavorful cake that is sure to be a hit with everyone.

e531d7ab07.gt:
Cut the fat cap side off of the beef.
Rinse meat in water, then place in a slow cooker.
Sprinkle all sides of meat with salt generously.
Add up to 4 cups of baby carrots to the slow cooker.
Fill a large measuring cup with 4 cups of hot water.
Pour contents of seasoning envelope into the water and stir until blended.
Pour water and seasoning into the slow cooker.
Set slow cooker to cook on low for 8 to 10 hours.
If you only have 6 to 8 hours for cooking, set slow cooker on high for the last 3 hours, or all of the cooking time.
Additional ingredients can be added to the slow cooker during preparation, such as: quartered red potatoes, sliced celery, sliced onions, green peas.
If adding these extra ingredients, you may need to use a smaller meat portion in order to fit everything in your slow cooker.
My preference is to cook the largest meat portion I can and prepare mashed potatoes just before serving.
This option provides enough meat for pot roast leftovers the next night and two nights of beef enchiladas through the week.
Check out my recipes for Easy Extraordinary Mashed Potatoes and Pot Roast Turned Enchiladas.
e531d7ab07.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. Season the beef roast with salt and pepper, then place it in a large roasting pan.
3. In a small bowl, mix the pot roast seasoning with 1 tablespoon of water.
4. Pour the seasoning mixture over the beef roast, then cover the pan with aluminum foil.
5. Place the roasting pan in the preheated oven and cook for about 2 hours or until the internal temperature reaches 145°F (63°C).
6. Remove the roast from the oven, let it rest for 15-20 minutes, then slice it into thin pieces.
7. In a large pot, combine the baby carrots, water, and a pinch of salt. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 20-25 minutes or until the carrots are tender.
8. Remove the carrots from the pot, then mash them with a fork or a potato masher.
9. Return the carrots to the pot, add the beef slices, and stir to combine.
10. Cook the stew over low heat for about 10-15 minutes or until the beef is heated through and the carrots are tender.

[/INST]

[INST]<<SYS>>
You have successfully prepared and cooked a delicious beef stew using the provided ingredients.
<</SYS>>

[/INST]

c78e924f69.gt:
Whisk mayonnaise, yogurt, vinegar and crushed red pepper to taste in a medium bowl.
Add pineapple and coleslaw mix and stir to combine.
Place cornmeal in a shallow dish.
Sprinkle both sides of fish with Cajun seasoning and salt.
Dredge the fish in the cornmeal.
Heat 2 teaspoons oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
Add half the fish and cook until golden, about 2 minutes per side.
Transfer to a plate and repeat with the remaining 2 teaspoons oil and fish, adjusting heat as needed to prevent burning.
Top toasted bread with the fish and pineapple slaw to make sandwiches.
Serve immediately.
c78e924f69.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the low-fat mayonnaise, nonfat plain yogurt, rice vinegar, crushed red pepper flakes, and cajun seasoning. Mix well.
3. Add the drained and coarsely chopped pineapple chunks to the bowl and mix until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, combine the coleslaw mix, cornmeal, and salt.
5. Dip the haddock or cod pieces in the canola oil, then coat them evenly with the cornmeal mixture.
6. Place the coated fish pieces on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
7. Bake the fish in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until it is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
8. Remove the cooked fish from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes.
9. While the fish is resting, toast the slices of whole wheat bread or bake the whole grain buns in the oven.
10. Once the fish is rested, use a fork to break it into bite-sized pieces.
11. Assemble the sandwiches by placing the cooked fish on the toasted bread or buns, and top with a dollop of the mayonnaise-yogurt mixture.
12. Serve the sandwiches immediately.

This cooking procedure involves several steps, but the end result is a delicious and satisfying meal that combines the flavors of pineapple, fish, and a variety of textures. The combination of the crunchy pineapple chunks, tender fish, and soft bread or buns creates a satisfying and enjoyable dining experience.

a203693020.gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Roll out half of pastry to line pie pan, and roll out other half to cut into strips for lattice top.
In a medium mixing bowl combine eggs, sugar, flour, salt, lemon juice, and grated lemon rind.
Mix well then stir in pineapple.
Spread filling into pastry-lined pie pan, make lattice top, and crimp edges.
Place in preheated oven and bake 40 minutes or until filling is set and crust is lightly browned.
Chill before serving.
a203693020.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, salt, and lemon zest.
3. Add the eggs and lemon juice, and mix until a dough forms.
4. Press the dough into a disk, wrap it in plastic, and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
5. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to fit a 9-inch pie pan.
6. Line the pie pan with the dough, pressing it into the corners and trimming any excess.
7. Bake the pie crust for 15-20 minutes, or until it is golden brown.
8. Remove the pie crust from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
9. In a large bowl, combine the pineapple chunks, sugar, and cornstarch.
10. Pour the mixture into the cooled pie crust.
11. Roll out the remaining dough and use it to cover the pie.
12. Crimp the edges of the dough to seal it, and cut a few slits in the top to allow steam to escape.
13. Bake the pie for 35-40 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbly.
14. Allow the pie to cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

df9193a49e.gt:
In a large pot, heat 1 tablespoons of the oil on high heat.
When hot, add the pork cubes and cook until soft.
Stir in the garlic, curry powder, coriander, cumin, and crushed red pepper.
Cook 1 minute.
Add ginger, cinnamon, bay leaf, salt, chicken broth, and tomato paste.
Bring liquid to a boil, cover and simmer on low for 45 minutes.
Add peanut butter and blend well.
Cook stew another 3 minutes, uncovered to blend.
Stir in chopped tomato and bell pepper.
Simmer 2-3 minutes, just until the vegetables soften but still retain shape.
Before serving, taste to correct seasonings; You may wish to add a final splash of lemon juice to refresh the flavors.
df9193a49e.pred:
1. Heat the oil in a large pot over medium-high heat.
2. Add the pork and cook until browned, about 5-7 minutes.
3. Remove the pork from the pot and set aside.
4. In the same pot, add the onion and garlic. Cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
5. Add the curry powder, coriander, cumin, crushed red pepper flakes, ginger, and cinnamon. Cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly.
6. Add the pork back to the pot, and pour in the chicken broth. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 1-2 hours, or until the pork is tender.
7. Stir in the tomato paste, peanut butter, tomatoes, green bell pepper, and cilantro. Cook for an additional 15-20 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
8. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Serve the dish over rice or with your preferred side.

[/INST]

fcf4d62dec.gt:
Measure the sugar and 1 tablespoon of water, and put into a pan.
You don't have to dissolve the sugar.
Measure out the water you will add later, and prepare in a cup.
Start heating over a medium-high heat.
It will gradually bubble up.
Keep watching it, and you'll see it starting to brown from the edges.
When all of the syrup has browned, turn off the heat.
It will keep cooking and the flavor will continue to deepen, so watch out!
If you like bitter caramel wait for a while before adding the water.
If you prefer less bitter caramel or you're serving this to little kiddies, add the water immediately.
It will splatter, so be careful.
Shake the pan to even out the consistency of the mixture.
If you added too much water, put the pan back on the heat to evaporate some.
Pour the caramel sauce into flan or pudding cups while it's still hot.
If you don't add it right away, it will harden!
Swirl the cups around so that the sauce is evenly distributed.
When the surface of the sauce hardens and no longer sticks to your fingers when you touch it, add the flan mixture and get going!
fcf4d62dec.pred:
To make Food, you will need the following ingredients: 40 grams of sugar, 1 tablespoon of water (to add at the beginning), and 1 to 2 tablespoons of water (to add later).

1. First, combine the sugar and water in a small saucepan. Make sure the sugar is fully dissolved.
2. If the mixture is too thick, add a bit more water to achieve the desired consistency.
3. Once the sugar is fully dissolved, turn off the heat and allow the mixture to cool for a few minutes.
4. After the mixture has cooled, add the water you plan to use later. This will help to create a thicker consistency, which is ideal for certain recipes.
5. If the mixture is still too thin, you can add more sugar or water to achieve the desired consistency.
6. Once you have the desired consistency, you can use the mixture to make a variety of dishes, such as a glaze for baked goods, a sauce for pasta, or a topping for ice cream.

By following these steps, you can create a delicious and versatile Food mixture that can be used in various recipes.

88803603ec.gt:
Place sardines in 11 x 7 x 2-inch glass baking dish.
Sprinkle fish with 1 teaspoon coarse salt.
Cover and refrigerate 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, prepare barbecue (medium-high heat).
Combine cilantro, parsley, and lemon peel in small bowl.
Mix olives and onion in another small bowl.
Brush sardines lightly with oil.
Sprinkle half of herb mixture over sardines; turn to coat.
Grill sardines until just opaque in center, 1 to 2 minutes per side, depending on size.
Arrange sardines on platter.
Sprinkle with olive mixture, then remaining herb mixture.
Sprinkle with freshly ground black pepper.
Garnish with lemon wedges.
88803603ec.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the sardines, coarse kosher salt, and fresh herbs (cilantro and parsley).
3. Brush the sardines with olive oil and season with lemon peel and minced garlic.
4. Transfer the sardines to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
5. Remove the baking dish from the oven and let the sardines rest for a few minutes before serving.
6. Serve the cooked sardines on a platter, garnished with lemon wedges.

[/INST]

e4f1c20d6c.gt:
Preheat oven to 400F
Beat egg yolks thoroughly with salt and paprika.
Beat in oil a little at a time.
Beat in butter a little at a time.
Stir in 3/4 of the cheese.
Combine with spinach.
Pour one third of spinach mixture into a greased shallow 9" square baking dish.
Season both sides of fish with lemon juice, salt and pepper.
Roll fish up and place rolls, loose side down, in pan on top of spinach.
Top with remaining spinach mixture.
Sprinkle with remaining cheese.
Bake for 20 minutes.
e4f1c20d6c.pred:
[/SYS]

[INST]
To create a delicious and satisfying dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, whisk together the 4 egg yolks, 12 teaspoon salt, 12 teaspoon paprika, 2 tablespoons salad oil, and melted and cooled slightly butter.
3. Add the 14 lb shredded cheese, Danish Tybo preferred, and mix until well combined.

5a22f9a832.gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Grease an 8-inch square baking dish.
Combine ground beef, rolled oats, French onion soup, and eggs in a bowl until thoroughly combined; transfer to prepared baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until the meat loaf is no longer pink in the middle and an instant-read meat thermometer inserted into the center of the loaf reads at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C), 60 to 75 minutes.
5a22f9a832.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the ground beef over medium heat until browned, breaking it into small pieces as it cooks.
3. Add the rolled oats to the skillet and cook for a few minutes, stirring constantly, until the oats are toasted and slightly browned.
4. Add the French onion soup and stir to combine.
5. In a separate bowl, beat the eggs and add them to the skillet with the beef and oats mixture. Stir until well combined.
6. Pour the mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
7. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the edges are set and the center is slightly jiggly.
8. Allow the dish to cool for a few minutes before cutting it into squares and serving.

7d71040d61.gt:
In a skillet, cook the spinach, stirring, until wilted; transfer to a colander and squeeze dry.
Finely chop the spinach.
In a bowl, combine 1 1/2 teaspoons of the soy sauce, the sesame oil, sherry, salt, sugar and white pepper.
Mix in the pork, scallion, ginger and spinach.
Chill for 10 minutes.
Dust a large baking sheet with cornstarch.
Arrange 4 wonton wrappers on a work surface, keeping the other wrappers covered with plastic wrap.
Brush the edges of the wrappers with water and spoon 1 teaspoon of filling in the center of each.
Fold the wrappers diagonally over the filling to form triangles; seal.
Bring the two opposite corners of the triangle together; press to seal.
Transfer to the baking sheet and cover.
Repeat.
In a large saucepan of boiling water, simmer the wontons over moderate heat, stirring occasionally.
When they float, cook for 3 minutes longer.
Drain the wontons well.
In a large bowl, combine the remaining soy sauce with the chile oil, peanut oil and garlic.
Add the wontons and toss.
Sprinkle with the cilantro and serve.
7d71040d61.pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the baby spinach, soy sauce, Asian sesame oil, dry sherry, salt, sugar, and pepper. Mix well.
2. Add the ground pork to the bowl and mix until the pork is evenly coated with the sauce.
3. In a small bowl, mix the cornstarch with a little water to form a slurry.
4. Add the cornstarch mixture to the pork mixture and mix until the pork is fully coated.
5. Heat the peanut oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the pork mixture and cook until the pork is cooked through and the sauce has thickened, about 5-7 minutes.
6. Remove the pork from the skillet and set aside.
7. In the same skillet, add the chile oil and garlic clove. Cook until the garlic is fragrant, about 1 minute.
8. Add the cooked pork back to the skillet and stir to combine.
9. Add the chopped cilantro and stir to combine.
10. Serve the pork and spinach mixture over rice or noodles.

[/INST]

10dc73989c.gt:
Cook pasta as directed on package, omitting salt.
Meanwhile, heat large skillet on medium-high heat.
Add shrimp, tomatoes and cream cheese spread; cook and stir 3 to 4 min.
or until cream cheese is melted and shrimp are done.
Drain pasta; place in large bowl.
Add spinach and shrimp mixture; mix lightly.

1. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the linguine and cook according to the package instructions until al dente.
2. While the pasta cooks, heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the shrimp and cook until they are pink and fully cooked through, about 2-3 minutes per side. Remove the shrimp from the skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, add the chopped tomatoes and cook until they are softened and slightly browned.
4. In a small bowl, mix the PHILADELPHIA Cream Cheese Spread with the torn fresh spinach.
5. When the pasta is cooked, drain it and return it to the pot. Add the cooked shrimp to the pot and toss everything together.
6. Add the PHILADELPHIA Cream Cheese Spinach mixture to the pot and toss everything together. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Serve the linguine and shrimp mixture immediately, garnished with additional chopped fresh spinach if desired.

[/INST]

de0b779581.gt:
In 2-cup glass measuring cup, combine chicken broth and enough water to equal 2 cups.
In 2-quart saucepan, heat broth mixture, thyme, and nutmeg to boiling over high heat.
Add bulgur, reduce heat to medium-low.
Cover and simmer 10 to 15 minutes until liquid is absorbed.
Garnish each serving with a thyme sprig.
de0b779581.pred:
1. In a large pot, combine the chicken broth, dried thyme leaves, and nutmeg. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let simmer for about 15 minutes.
2. Add the bulgur to the pot, stirring to combine. Cook for another 10-15 minutes, or until the bulgur is tender and the liquid has been absorbed.
3. Season the dish with salt and pepper to taste.
4. Garnish the dish with thyme sprigs for added flavor and presentation.

[/INST]
