feb321aa71.gt:
Rinse lobster shells and body parts with cold water to clean.
Add lobster parts to stock pot.
Add water to cover.
Add lemon juice and garlic salt.
Bring pot to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes.
Use tongs to remove and discard lobster shells and body pieces.
Add vegetables and simmer another 30 minutes.
Use slotted spoon to remove vegetables.
Reserve and serve with cooked rice.
Line a collander with cheescloth and ladel stock to strain through cheescloth into a pot.
Discard solids.
Lobster stock can be refrigerated for 10 days or frozen for 6 months.
Use in sauces, dips, soups and stews.
feb321aa71.pred:
1. First, gather all the necessary ingredients, including 1 lobster shells, 1 lobster body parts, 1 cup of water, 1 tsp of garlic salt, 1 tbsp of lemon juice, 1 cup of sliced carrots, 1 cup of sliced celery, and 3 cloves of sliced garlic.

2. In a large pot or saucepan, combine the lobster shells, lobster body parts, water, garlic salt, and lemon juice. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 20 minutes or until the lobster shells are tender.

3. Remove the lobster shells and body parts from the pot, reserving the liquid.

4. In a large skillet or frying pan, heat some oil over medium heat. Add the sliced onion and cook until it is softened and translucent.

5. Add the sliced carrots and celery to the skillet and cook for a few minutes, stirring occasionally, until they are tender but still slightly crisp.

6. Add the reserved liquid from the pot to the skillet, stirring to combine.

7. Add the sliced garlic to the skillet and cook for a few more minutes, stirring occasionally, until the garlic is fragrant and slightly browned.

8. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.

9. Serve the cooked lobster shells and body parts over the cooked vegetables, and enjoy your delicious lobster dish!

[/INST]

e8b69ecf30.gt:
Combine flour, salt and ricotta; mix thoroughly.
Knead dough on lightly floured board until dough is smooth.
Set dough aside on corned of floured board.
Cut small pieces from dough and quickly roll dough into a "finger thin" roll, and cut into pieces about 1/2 inch long.
Flatten each piece gently with thumb and bring long sides together to form a hollow tube or shell shape.
Arrange the gnocchi on a lightly floured cloth or board, dust them lightly with flour.
After shaping all the dough, gently drop the gnocchi into a large pot of boiling, salted water.
Cook them about 10-12 minutes, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking.
When they rise to the surface, remove them from the pot with a strainer.
Place in a heated bowl.
Serve with your favorite pasta sauce and sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese.
e8b69ecf30.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, salt, and ricotta cheese.
3. Add 1 cup of water, and mix until the dough comes together. If the dough is too dry, add more water, 1 tablespoon at a time, until it reaches the desired consistency.
4. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to a thickness of about 1/4 inch (0.6 cm).
5. Cut out the dough into desired shapes using a cookie cutter or a knife.
6. Place the shaped dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
7. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown around the edges.
8. Remove the cookies from the oven, and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your homemade savory cookies!

ffd5e1942a.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 F. Spray an 8x8 baking pan with cooking spray and set aside.
In a large bowl, cream together cream cheese and butter until light and fluffy with a electric hand mixer.
Add in egg and cake mix and beat until combined.
Fold in white chocolate chips and sprinkles.
Pour batter into prepared pan.
Bake for 30 minutes, or until bars turn golden brown.
Remove from oven and let them cool completely.
Cut into bars and serve.
Enjoy!
Note: Funfetti cake batter bars will keep covered for about five days.
ffd5e1942a.pred:
To prepare a delicious and visually appealing Food using the provided ingredients, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Grease and flour a 9x9 inch baking pan.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the softened cream cheese, softened butter, and egg. Mix until smooth and creamy.
4. Add the softened white chocolate chips and colored sprinkles, if desired. Mix until well combined.
5. Gradually add the cake mix to the cream cheese mixture, mixing until a smooth batter forms.
6. Pour the batter into the prepared baking pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
7. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
8. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.

This delicious and visually appealing Food is ready to be enjoyed by your friends and family. The combination of cream cheese, butter, and cake mix creates a moist and flavorful cake, while the white chocolate chips and colored sprinkles add a touch of color and sweetness.

83dee537f7.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Mix all of the ingredients (except the tomato sauce) together and form into (2) loaves.
Place loaves onto a lightly greased foil lined and rimmed cookie sheet.
Bake for 45 minutes, then pour one can tomato sauce over each loaf.
Return to oven to bake for another 15 minutes.
Let set 10 minutes before serving.

feb5ca6df3.gt:
Brown sausage in a medium skillet over medium high heat, stirring to break apart.
Drain, and place in a bowl.
Stir in softened cream cheese, drained sauerkraut, and mustard until thoroughly combined.
Cover, and refrigerate for 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Place beaten eggs and crushed crackers in separate bowls.
Roll sausage mixture into small balls and dip first into egg, then roll in cracker crumbs to coat.
Arrange on a sheet pan.
Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes, turning once for even browning.
Serve warm.

3. Add the sauerkraut, Dijon mustard, and beaten eggs to the mixture, stirring until well combined.
4. Press the mixture into the bottom of a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.

6. While the casserole is baking, prepare the topping by crushing the buttery round crackers.
7. Once the casserole is done, remove it from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Sprinkle the crushed crackers evenly over the top of the casserole.

0e59f10230.gt:
Put all of the ingredients except for the ice into a blender.
These should total 1 cup of liquid.
Blend these ingredients on low a few times.
Fire up the "ice crush" (or highest speed) on the blender for about 30 seconds.
Pour into a 600ml glass and enjoy!

16b48ecd6b.gt:
All the ingredients in brackets can be added according to your own taste.
Peel and slice the potatoes and cook them for about 10 or 15 minutes in a microwave.
Fry the chopped onion with garlic (and chopped chilli).
Add the beef chunks (bacon bits) to the already fried mixture.
Cook the meat.
Add the sliced peppers (mushrooms).
When the meat is cooked add the potatoes and toss everything together until everything is heated through.
If the meat looks like it's drying add a little bit of wine (or water with a dash of vinegar if you don't want to or can't use alcohol).

53797b9666.gt:
Mix together the egg, milk, and sugar in a deep bowl or tupperware container.
If you mix up the egg whites to break them up thoroughly, and it'll turn out better.
Cut the frozen bread into 4 pieces.
Use a skewer to poke holes into it.
It's hard for the egg mixture to get absorbed near the crusts, so be sure to poke holes there!
Soak the bread in the egg mixture.
After about two minutes, flip the bread over.
The bread is soft, so if you're worried about breaking it, use a spatula to flip.
Once both sides have completely soaked, fry it up and enjoy!
This is a version made without cutting up the bread.
It might look a bit unappealing with all those holes, but you won't be able to tell at all after it's been fried!
If it's too soft, it can break, but you can use a spatula to safely flip it over.
You can make more french toast with the remaining egg mixture if you like, but I like to pour it over the bread to fill in the holes!
!
53797b9666.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Lightly grease a baking sheet or a silicone mat.
3. Place the frozen bread on the baking sheet or silicone mat.
4. Crack the egg on the bread, and then pour the milk over the egg.
5. Add the sugar to the mixture.
6. Bake the bread in the preheated oven for 10-15 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and the egg is cooked through.
7. Remove the bread from the oven, and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing it.

[/INST]

a896ff3f80.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat; cook and stir shallot until translucent, about 5 minutes.
Pour balsamic vinegar into skillet and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and simmer until balsamic vinegar mixture is reduced by half, about 10 minutes.
Stir often.
Cut chicken breasts from one side through the middle horizontally to within one-half inch of the other side.
Open the two sides and spread them out like an open book.
Spread half the goat cheese onto one half of each chicken breast and drizzle 1/3 of the reduced balsamic vinegar mixture over the goat cheese.
Close the chicken breasts over the goat cheese and secure with toothpicks.
Arrange chicken into a baking dish.
Drizzle with remaining 1/3 of the balsamic reduction.
Bake in the preheated oven until the chicken is no longer pink inside, the filling is hot, and the juices run clear, 30 to 35 minutes.
An instant-read meat thermometer inserted into the center of a filled breast should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C).
a896ff3f80.pred:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the chicken breast halves, olive oil, and salt. Mix well and set aside for 15 minutes.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the shallot, balsamic vinegar, and a pinch of salt.
4. After 15 minutes, drain the chicken and pat it dry with paper towels.
5. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken to the skillet and cook until it is browned on both sides and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes per side.
6. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
7. In the same skillet, add the shallot mixture and cook until it has reduced by half, about 3-4 minutes.
8. Add the goat cheese to the skillet and stir until it has melted and combined with the sauce.
9. Return the chicken to the skillet and toss it in the sauce until it is fully coated.
10. Transfer the chicken and sauce to a baking dish and bake for 10-12 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and slightly caramelized.
11. Serve the chicken and sauce over a bed of rice or pasta.

[/INST]

77ef934d1a.gt:
Process cranberries in blender or food processor; pour sugar over cranberries and stir to dissolve.
Bring 3/4 cup of water to a boil; stir in gelatin and let cool.
Stir cooled gelatin into cranberries, and add pineapple, orange juice, apple and pecans.
Mix well, cover and refrigerate overnight.
Whip cream and beat in cream cheese.
In a glass serving dish, layer half of the cranberry mixture, then the whipped cream mixture, then the remaining cranberry mixture.

2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cranberries, sugar, and red Jell-O mix.

4. Pour the mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish.

6. Allow the mixture to cool for a few minutes before adding the whipping cream and cream cheese.

Mix cream cheese and sugar well with mixer.
Add vanilla and Cool Whip; mix well.

Ices 1 triple layer cake or 2 other cakes.

4cdb9f81ba.gt:
Add the creamed corn and water to a pot, and turn on the heat.
When the mixture starts to simmer, add the soy milk.

Once the consomme is dissolved, add the heavy cream.

b12f641798.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F with rack in middle.
Pat beef dry and season with 2 1/2 teaspoons salt and 1 teaspoon pepper.
Heat oil in pot over medium-high heat until it shimmers, then brown meat, without crowding, in 3 batches, turning, about 8 minutes per batch.
Transfer to a platter.
Reduce heat to medium, then add carrots, celery, onions, and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally, until well browned, about 12 minutes.
Push vegetables to one side of pot.
Add tomato paste to cleared area and cook paste, stirring, 2 minutes, then stir into vegetables.
Add vinegar and cook, stirring, 2 minutes.
Stir in wine, bay leaves, and thyme and boil until wine is reduced by about two thirds, 10 to 12 minutes.
Add broth to pot along with water, beef, and any juices from platter and bring to a simmer.
Cover and braise in oven until meat is very tender, about 2 1/2 hours.
Set a large colander in a large bowl.
Pour stew into colander.
Return pieces of meat to pot, then discard remaining solids.
Let cooking liquid stand 10 minutes.
While beef braises, peel potatoes and cut into 1/2-inch-wide wedges.
Slice carrots diagonally (1-inch).
Add potatoes and carrots to stew (make sure they are submerged) and simmer, uncovered, stirring occasionally, until potatoes and carrots are tender, about 40 minutes.

6. Add the beef back to the pot, along with the bay leaves, thyme, and broth. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to a simmer and cook for 1 1/2 to 2 hours, or until the beef is tender and the sauce has thickened.
7. Add the potatoes and carrots to the pot, and continue to cook for an additional 30 to 45 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
8. Season the stew with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Serve the stew in bowls, garnished with crusty bread.

8. In a separate mixing bowl, combine the 10 whole medium new potatoes with 1 tablespoon of salt.

10. Once the beans and bacon are cooked and the potatoes are done, remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the dishes cool for a few minutes.
11. Serve the cooked beans and bacon mixture alongside the roasted potatoes, and enjoy your mouthwatering Food!

aa904a4678.gt:
Place your jello shot cups on a cookie sheet (that you know will fit in your fridge).
This will make for easy transport.
Place 2 cups VERY hot water (but not boiling) in a pitcher.
Slowly pour in contents of jello packages while stirring constantly.
Stir until completely mixed (about 2 minutes).
Add in the remaining ingredients and stir well.
Pour into plastic jello shot cups or you can use a 9x13 pan if you don't have the cups.
Chill 4 hours or more until set.
If you are using a cake pan, simply cut the set jello into squares and place on individual cupcake cups for serving.
If you want to get silly, top each one with a small dollop of whip cream just before serving!
aa904a4678.pred:
To make a delicious cocktail using these ingredients, follow these steps:

1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the two boxes of blue Jello gelatin and the very hot water. Stir until the gelatin is fully dissolved.
2. Add the coconut rum and blue schnapps to the mixture, stirring to combine.
3. Pour the mixture into a large pitcher or a punch bowl.
4. Add the unsweetened pineapple juice to the bowl, stirring to combine.
5. Refrigerate the mixture for at least 4 hours or overnight, allowing the flavors to meld together.
6. Serve the cocktail in glasses, garnished with a slice of pineapple and a maraschino cherry, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious blue cocktail!

112e4c6352.gt:
Slice panettone into 1 inch slices; cut each slice into 4 wedges.
In a small bowl, whisk together the mascarpone, orange preserves, and orange juice.
In a separate large bowl, whisk the eggs, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Dip the panettone into the egg mixture, coating well.
Place into the hot oil; fry until golden brown, about 3 minutes per side.
Serve with the orange mascarpone sauce.
112e4c6352.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the mascarpone cheese, orange juice, and orange marmalade until smooth.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, whisking well after each addition.
4. Gradually add the ground cinnamon and nutmeg, whisking to combine.
5. Pour the mixture into a greased 9-inch (23cm) springform pan.
6. Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until the center is set and the edges are slightly golden.
7. Remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Carefully run a knife around the edges of the pan to release the cake.
9. Invert the cake onto a serving plate and let it cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Food!

99ac5fb3f6.gt:
Mix first 10 ingredients in a bowl.
Take a wonton wrapper and place 1 heaping teaspoon of filling in center.
Moisten edges with water, fold over and press to seal edges.
Add 3 tablespoons of Peanut Oil to a large skillet and saute until the bottoms are golden brown.
When golden brown, add 1/2 cup chicken broth, cover pan and simmer 8 minutes.
Remove from pan.
Reserve broth in a separate bowl and repeat process until all potstickers are cooked.
Keep warm on a plate covered.
99ac5fb3f6.pred:
[INST]To craft delicious Food using the provided ingredients, follow these steps:
1. In a large bowl, combine the ground pork, chopped green onions, soy sauce, rice wine, sesame oil, minced garlic, and beaten egg. Mix well to ensure that the ingredients are evenly distributed.
2. Add cornstarch to the mixture, stirring to combine.
3. Gradually add chicken broth, stirring constantly, until the mixture reaches the desired consistency.
4. If the mixture is too thick, add more chicken broth to achieve the desired consistency.
5. Preheat peanut oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
6. When the oil is hot, carefully drop the mixture by the spoonful into the skillet or wok, forming small patties. Cook the patties until they are golden brown on both sides, then carefully flip them over and cook for an additional minute.
7. Remove the patties from the skillet or wok and place them on a plate or tray lined with paper towels to drain any excess oil.
8. To assemble the dish, place a wonton skin on a plate, add a small patty of the pork mixture, and drizzle with soy sauce. Repeat this process until all the wonton skins are filled.
9. Serve the dish immediately, and enjoy your delicious Food!

[/INST]

c2277ff083.gt:
In a large pot, bring the water and salt to a boil; add the lentils, reduce the heat to medium-low and cook for 30 minutes or until the lentils are tender but not overcooked; drain.
In a colander, rinse the cooked lentils under cold water until slightly cool, then place them in a bowl.
Whisk together the remaining ingredients; pour over the lentils and combine well.
Chill for 1 to 2 hours and serve cold.
c2277ff083.pred:
1. In a large pot, combine 8 cups of water and 2 tablespoons of salt.
2. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 20-25 minutes or until the lentils are tender.
3. While the lentils are cooking, in a separate bowl, whisk together 14 cups of olive oil and 14 cups of white wine vinegar.
4. Once the lentils are cooked, add the whisked oil and vinegar mixture to the pot.
5. Stir in 12 teaspoons of dried ground cumin and 12 teaspoons of dried ground coriander.
6. Add a pinch of cayenne pepper for a spicy kick.
7. Stir everything together, and let the mixture cook for a few more minutes.
8. Taste the dish and adjust the seasoning as needed.

This step-by-step procedure outlines the process of cooking a delicious and flavorful lentil dish using the provided ingredients. The cooking time and seasoning adjustments are crucial to achieving the desired taste and texture.

e05a7c1c5e.gt:
Preheat oven to 400F.
Stir together salt, allspice, and cayenne.
Pat pork dry and sprinkle spice rub all over pork, pressing to adhere.
Heat oil in a 12-inch heavy skillet over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking, then brown pork, 1 tenderloin at a time, on all sides, about 1 minute each.
Transfer as browned to a large roasting pan and arrange 2 inches apart.
Roast in middle of oven until an instant-read thermometer inserted diagonally 2 inches into center of each tenderloin registers 155F, 20 to 25 minutes.
Let pork stand 5 minutes before slicing.

d069fb1925.gt:
Cut off the stem of the shiitake mushrooms and cut into bite size pieces.
Put water and the seasoning ingredients in a pot and let it boil.
Then, add the shiitake mushrooms, cover with a drop lid, and cook it for about 10 minutes on low heat.
Stir the pot sometimes.
Take off the drop lid when the liquid boils down and remove from the heat when the liquid has almost gone.
When it has cooled down a little, it is done.
You can keep it in the fridge for about 3 days so make some and keep it for bento lunch box.
It will be an extra dish for dinner if you keep some in the fridge.
d069fb1925.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Rinse the shiitake mushrooms and pat them dry with a paper towel.
3. In a small bowl, mix the soy sauce, mirin, sake, and sugar.
4. Place the mushrooms in a baking dish, and pour the soy sauce mixture over them.
5. Roast the mushrooms in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
6. Remove the mushrooms from the oven, and let them cool for a few minutes.
7. Serve the roasted shiitake mushrooms as a side dish or a main course, garnished with fresh herbs if desired.

[/INST]

7a20842b45.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large bowl using an electric mixer or stand mixer, beat butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add eggs, one at a time.
Add vanilla.
In another bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder and salt.
Add the flour mixture and bananas to the butter mixture in the mixer, alternating between the two.
Line each muffin cup with a paper liner.
Fill each muffin cups about 2/3 full with batter and bake for 17-20 minutes until a tester inserted into a cupcake comes out clean.
Remove from the oven and let cool on a wire rack.
Let cupcakes cool completely before frosting.
For the frosting, using an electric mixer or stand mixer, cream butter until light and fluffy.
Add confectioners sugar 1/2 cup at a time, beating well after each addition.
Add vanilla and milk and beat until frosting is well combined.
Add in strawberry preserves 1 tablespoon at a time until frosting is creamy.
Frost cooled cupcakes and store in the refrigerator.
7a20842b45.pred:
To cook the Food with these ingredients, follow these steps:

1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the softened butter, sugar, eggs, and vanilla extract. Mix until well combined.
3. Gradually add the flour, baking powder, and salt to the mixture, stirring until a smooth dough forms.
4. Fold in the mashed bananas and softened butter.
5. In a separate bowl, mix the confectioners sugar, vanilla extract, and milk.
6. Add the strawberry preserves to the mixture and mix until well combined.
7. Pour the wet mixture over the dry mixture and mix until just combined.
8. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9-inch (23cm) round cake pan.
9. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean.
10. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

415a9b7161.gt:
Preheat the oven to 350F and line a 6-cup muffin pan.
Place the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat and cook until the aroma is nutty and the milk solids start to turn brown on the bottom of the pan, about 5 minutes.
With a spatula, transfer the browned butter into a large mixing bowl.
Add the brown and white sugars, eggs and vanilla to the bowl and mix until combined.
Whisk together the flour, ground hazelnuts, baking powder and salt.
Pour the dry ingredients into the browned butter mixture and mix until fully incorporated.
Gently fold in the raspberries.
Spoon the muffin batter into the paper cups.
Scatter the tops with a few of the cracked hazelnuts, while gently pressing them securely into place.
Bake for 15-18 minutes, until a cake tester inserted in the center comes out clean.
Let the muffins cool briefly in the pan, and then place them on a wire rack to cool.
415a9b7161.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, alternating with the raspberries and hazelnuts. Mix until just combined.
6. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9-inch (23cm) round cake pan.
7. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
8. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. Once the cake is fully cooled, dust it with the lightly cracked hazelnuts as garnish.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Food!

615e73ba74.gt:
The best way to capture the elusive flavor of summertime.
Ben and Jerry prefer small peaches because they have more flavor and less water than the larger ones.
Combine the peaches, 1/2 cup of the sugar, and the lemon juice in a bowl.
Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours, stirring the mixture every 30 minutes.
Remove the peaches from the refrigerator and drain the juice into another bowl.
Return the peaches to the refrigerator.
Whisk the eggs in a mixing bowl until light and fluffy, 1 to 2 minutes.
Whisk in the remaining 3/4 cup sugar, a little at a time, then continue whisking until completely blended, about 1 minute more.
Pour in the cream and milk and whisk to blend.
Add the peach juice and blend.
Transfer the mixture to an ice cream maker and freeze following manufacturer's instructions.
After the ice cream stiffens (about 2 minutes before if is done) add the peaches, then continue freezing until the ice cream is ready.
Makes 1 generous quart.
615e73ba74.pred:
[/INST]

1. First, gather all the necessary ingredients: 2 cups peaches finely chopped, ripe, 1 1/4 cups sugar, 1/2 each lemon juice and milk, and 2 cups heavy whipping cream.

2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the peaches, sugar, and lemon juice. Mix well to ensure the sugar is evenly distributed.

3. Add the milk to the bowl and mix until the ingredients are well combined.

4. In a separate bowl, whip the heavy whipping cream until it reaches the desired consistency.

5. Gently fold the whipped cream into the peach mixture.

6. Carefully pour the mixture into a baking dish and bake in a preheated oven at 350°F (175°C) for approximately 45 minutes, or until the mixture is set and slightly golden brown on top.

7. Allow the dish to cool for a few minutes before serving.

8. Enjoy your delicious peach cobbler!

[/INST]

[/INST]

[/INST]

0a605c19e8.gt:
Add everything but the shrimp to a gallon-sized freezer bag.
Seal the bag and shake well to combine.
Taste test for spiciness; add sriracha for more heat, and tomato paste and olive oil for less heat.
When youre happy with it, add the shrimp and marinate in the fridge for 45 minutes.
Dump the entire bag, marinade included, into a pre-heated frying pan.
Fry the shrimp until theyre curled up and no longer translucent, a couple of minutes on each side.
You can also skewer and grill the shrimp.
Serve over rice, pasta, udon, in lettuce wraps with carrot and sprouts, as an appetizer ...
0a605c19e8.pred:
1. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet or frying pan over medium heat.
2. Add the minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
3. Add the chopped parsley and cook for another minute.
4. Squeeze the juice of the whole lemon into the pan, and add the sriracha sauce.
5. Cook for a few more minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sauce has thickened slightly.
6. Add the tomato paste, oregano, salt, and pepper to the pan. Cook for a few more minutes, stirring occasionally, until the flavors have melded together.
7. Add the shrimp to the pan, stirring to coat them evenly with the sauce. Cook until the shrimp are cooked through and pink, about 3-4 minutes.
8. Serve the shrimp and sauce over rice or pasta, and enjoy!

[/INST]

2893fcfb35.gt:
Heat a medium skillet over medium-high heat.
Spray with nonstick cooking spray.
Add the diced onion and saute until tender, about 5 minutes.
Add the diced apple and saute until tender, about 3 minutes.
Then remove from heat and set aside for the moment.
In a medium sized mixing bowl, melt the butter (you can do this in the microwave, heating for 30 seconds, stirring, then heating for additional 30 second increments if needed).
Then add the bread crumbs to the melted butter and toss to coat.
Into the bread crumb mixture, mix in the onion and apple.
Add the shredded cheese and mix to thoroughly combine.
Slice the pork chops lengthwise leaving about 1/2 an inch on one side still intact (you are basically making a pocket for the filling mixture).
Stuff pork chops with bread crumb mixture.
Secure the pork chops closed using toothpicks.
Spray each side of the pork chops with nonstick cooking spray and season with salt and pepper.
Grill the pork chops (or cook on a skillet) over medium to medium high heat until the juices run clear, about 20-25 minutes.
Remove from the grill and let rest about 5 minutes.
Remove toothpicks.
Serve and enjoy!
!
2893fcfb35.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the melted butter, bread crumbs, and shredded cheese. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
3. Dip each pork chop into the butter mixture, ensuring it is evenly coated.
4. Place the pork chops on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
5. Bake the pork chops in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 145°F (63°C).
6. Remove the pork chops from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes before slicing them into individual portions.
7. Serve the pork chops with a side of the melted butter and bread crumb mixture, allowing the diners to dip the pork chops into the sauce.

This delicious dish combines the flavors of the onion, apple, and pork tenderloin chops, creating a satisfying and savory meal. The melted butter and bread crumb mixture adds a rich and crispy texture to the dish, making it a delightful culinary experience.

0ede22d38c.gt:
Chop onion and celery.
Saute celery and onion in vegetable oil in a 2-quart saucepan over medium heat until tender.
Add chicken stock and frozen vegetables.
Cover and cook until vegetables are cooked, about 10 minutes.
If vegetables are too large, you may wish to cut them into smaller pieces.
Stir in cream of chicken soup, chicken and milk and heat through, stirring occasionally.
Cut cheese into chunks and add to soup, stirring until melted.
Taste and season if needed.
(It shouldnt need much if any salt.)
Serve immediately with crackers.
0ede22d38c.pred:
To prepare a delicious and satisfying meal using the provided ingredients, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the onion and celery, and cook until they are softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the chicken stock, and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, and let the soup simmer for about 10 minutes.
4. Meanwhile, in a separate pot, combine the frozen cauliflower and broccoli. Add enough water to cover the vegetables, and cook until the cauliflower and broccoli are tender, about 10-15 minutes.
5. Drain the cooked cauliflower and broccoli, and return them to the pot. Add the cream of chicken soup, and stir to combine.
6. In a separate bowl, mix the shredded chicken, milk, and processed cheese.
7. Add the chicken mixture to the soup, and stir to combine.
8. Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Transfer the soup to a large baking dish, and cover it with foil.
10. Bake the soup in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the cauliflower and broccoli are tender.
11. Serve the soup hot, garnished with crackers, if desired.

[/INST]

dd8991d2f0.gt:
Bring water for noodles to boil in a large pot.
Cook noodles according to instructions on package, then drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil, and then add onion.
Saute onions for 10-15 minutes, over medium-low heat until lightly browned.
Add broccoli and 1/4 cup water.
Cover pan and saute 5 minutes or so until broccoli turns bright green and begins to soften.
Stir in garlic and salt.
Then stir in sesame oil, agave and ume vinegar.
In a small bowl, combine arrowroot and 1 tablespoon water, stirring vigorously to make a paste without any lumps.
Pour the paste over the broccoli and mix quickly and vigorously to loosen any of the mixture that sticks to the bottom of the pan.
Place noodles on individual plates, then top with broccoli mixture.
Garnish with scallions, cilantro and peanuts.
dd8991d2f0.pred:
To prepare a perfect Food using the ingredients provided, follow these key steps:

1. Prepare the ingredients:
- Rinse the mung bean noodles and set aside.
- Chop the onion and broccoli into smaller pieces.
- Rinse the peanuts and set aside.
- Rinse the scallions and set aside.
- Rinse the cilantro and set aside.

2. Prepare the sauce:
- In a small bowl, mix the celtic sea salt, sesame oil, agave nectar, ume vinegar, arrowroot, and water.

3. Cook the noodles:
- Bring the water to a boil in a large pot, then add the mung bean noodles and cook until they are tender but still have some bite.
- Drain the noodles and set aside.

4. Cook the vegetables:
- In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
- Add the onion and cook until it is softened and translucent.
- Add the broccoli and cook until it is tender but still has some crunch.

5. Combine the ingredients:
- In a large bowl, combine the cooked noodles, vegetables, and sauce.
- Toss everything together until the noodles are evenly coated with the sauce.

6. Serve the Food:
- Transfer the noodle mixture to a serving bowl and garnish with the chopped cilantro and peanuts.

By following these key steps, you will have prepared a delicious and nutritious Food using the ingredients provided.

6902fabddb.gt: Stir salt, pepper, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, and cayenne pepper in an airtight container, seal, and shake to combine.

To craft Food using the provided ingredients, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix together 1/4 cup of kosher salt, 4 teaspoons of ground black pepper, 1 teaspoon of paprika, 1 teaspoon of garlic powder, and 1/2 teaspoon of onion powder.

The baking time may vary depending on the size and type of Food you are crafting, so be sure to monitor it closely to ensure it is cooked to your desired level of doneness.

e766664a53.gt:
Heat the oven to 450 degrees F with a rack in the middle position.
Take a small slice off of the bottom of each potato so that they will sit flat, and then a small slice (about 1/4) from each end.
Make slices crosswise down the potato at 1/4 intervals, leaving 1/4 at the bottom.
Make sure you do not cut all the way through.
Rinse the sliced potatoes under cold running water, making sure water gets between each slice to wash away excess starch.
Place the potatoes on a plate, bottom side up, and microwave for 5 minutes (do not cover).
Flip the potatoes over, then microwave for another 5 minutes.
While the potatoes are in the microwave, make the topping.
Pulse the bread in a food processor until you have coarsely ground crumbs.
In a medium bowl, use a fork to mix the crumbs with the melted butter, cheddar cheese, Parmesan cheese, paprika, garlic powder, oregano, minced garlic, salt, and pepper until it forms a chunky paste.
Set aside.
When the potatoes are finished in the microwave, place them on a rimmed baking sheet.
Drizzle slowly with olive oil, so that it can run into the slices.
Fan the slices slightly, then dash each one with paprika, garlic powder, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Bake for 30 minutes, until the potatoes are cooked through and the edges are just starting to brown.
Remove from the oven and turn the broiler on.
Press the topping onto the top of the cooked potatoes, pressing into any slices that you easily can, but being careful not to rip the potatoes.
Place under the broiler for a couple of minutes, until the topping is bubbly and starting to brown.
e766664a53.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. Wash the potatoes thoroughly and pat them dry.
3. Cut the potatoes into evenly sized chunks, about 1-inch (2.5 cm) in size.
4. In a large mixing bowl, combine the potatoes, olive oil, paprika, garlic powder, oregano, salt, pepper, minced garlic, and a pinch of paprika and garlic powder. Mix well.
5. Spread the potato mixture evenly on a baking sheet or roasting pan.
6. Roast the potatoes in the preheated oven for 45-50 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly crispy on the outside.
7. Remove the potatoes from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
8. Meanwhile, melt the butter in a small saucepan over low heat.
9. Once the potatoes are cool enough to handle, use a fork to mash them into a coarse, rustic texture.
10. Add the melted butter to the potatoes and stir to combine.
11. Add the shredded cheese and stir until the cheese is melted and the mixture is well combined.
12. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
13. Transfer the potato mixture to a serving dish and serve immediately.

[/INST]

This delicious and hearty dish is perfect for a cozy meal or a side dish to accompany your favorite main course.

84dcc3c2e0.gt:
Combine all the ingredients in a cocktail shaker with a few ice cubes and shake vigorously.
Pour into a chilled cocktail glass and garnish with a wedge of lime.
84dcc3c2e0.pred:
1. In a shaker filled with ice, combine 1 ounce of Vanilla Vodka, 1 ounce of Rum, 1 ounce of Midori, 1 ounce of Lime Juice, and 1 ounce of Pineapple Juice.

3. Strain the mixture into a glass filled with ice.

5. Serve immediately and enjoy the refreshing and flavorful cocktail.

b240a9e8bb.gt:
Heat oven to 250F degrees.
Mix together cornmeal, flour, sugar, and baking powder.
Combine egg whites, milk and margarine, mix well.
Pour milk mixture into the dry ingredients, stir until just smooth (do not over mix).
In a large non stick skillet heat the 2 tbsp oil, heat until quite hot but not smoking.
Drop in a 1/4 cup of batter for each fritter.
Cook approx 4-6 minutes on each side.
Keep warm in the oven covered with foil until you have cooked all the fritters.
Serve with Blueberries or other fruit.

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cornmeal, flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg whites until they are light and fluffy.
4. Gradually add the melted margarine to the egg whites, whisking until well combined.

704ac085bf.gt:
Get the 2 slices of bread and the peanut butter and banana.
Spread the peanut butter on one of the slices of bread.
Slice up as much banna as the bread can fit on it.
Place the two slices of bread together.
And now it is ready to eat.
704ac085bf.pred:
[/INST]

1090169845.gt:
Preheat the over to 400F.
Divide the fish into 2 portions placing each in the center of a piece of foil (spraying the foil with some cooking oil is a good idea).
Salt and pepper to taste.
To each portion add pieces of pinched-off-the-stem fresh dill, a splash of lemon juice (or a slice of lemon) and half a pat of butter (optional).
Fold the foil into a packet by folding the edges up until they meet over the center and folding over to seal.
Put the packets in an oven dish and bake for 15 minutes.
Remove and serve.
1090169845.pred:
To craft a delicious meal using the provided ingredients, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).

2. Rinse the new zealand orange roughy fillet and pat it dry with paper towels.

3. Season the fillet with salt and pepper, to taste.

4. If using lemon juice, squeeze the juice from the lemon over the fillet. If using lemon slices, place them on top of the fillet.

5. In a small bowl, mix the butter, dill, and lemon juice (or slices) to create a butter mixture.

6. Place the fillet in a baking dish, and pour the butter mixture over it.

7. Bake the fillet in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until it is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.

8. Serve the cooked fillet with a side of your choice, such as rice or a vegetable salad.

Enjoy your delicious meal!

Preheat oven to 325F
mix cake in bowl...following the directions on the box.
add jell-o pudding
add strawberry extract
add 1\2 can of strawberry frosting
pour mixture in a floured cake pan.
I used a bundt pan

once cake has cooled, take the un-used portion of the frosting and microwave for 10 seconds.
stir and drizzle with spoon over cake

820cb37cdd.gt:
1.
Brown the onion in the olive oil until turning translucent.
Add the garlic.
2.
Add both sausage and beef, break into very small pieces and cook through.
3.
Add spices and seasonings, remove from heat.
Drain and cool.
In a food processor, add ricotta cheese, Parmesan cheese, egg, and the sausage/ground beef mixture.
Process together until it reaches an almost paste-like consistency.
Refrigerate until ready to use.
Can also be frozen.

b9b1d42894.gt:
Combine first 6 ingredients.
Pour mixture over chicken in slow cooker.
Cook 3-4 hours on low.
Serve with no-yolk egg noodles.
Number of Servings: 4.

3. In the same skillet, cook the chopped garlic over medium heat until fragrant.
4. Add the hidden valley ranch dressing mix and stir until well combined.
5. Gradually pour in the cream of chicken soup, stirring constantly to avoid lumps.
6. Add the skim milk, reduced-fat sour cream, and chopped chicken breasts to the skillet. Cook over medium heat until the chicken is fully cooked through.
7. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
8. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked chicken, bacon bits, and ranch dressing mixture.
9. Transfer the mixture to a 9x13 inch baking dish.
10. Pour the skim milk evenly over the chicken and bacon mixture.
11. Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the sauce is bubbly and the chicken is cooked through.
12. Remove the casserole from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

This cooking procedure involves several steps, including preheating the oven, cooking the bacon bits, chopping the garlic, preparing the ranch dressing mixture, cooking the chicken and sauce, combining the ingredients, pouring the skim milk, and baking the casserole. The final result is a delicious and satisfying dish that combines the flavors of the bacon bits, garlic, ranch dressing, chicken, and cream of chicken soup, resulting in a comforting and satisfying meal.

1c2ae05e91.gt:

Lightly grease/spray a 2 1/2 qt casserole dish; set aside.
In a mixing bowl, combine the melted butter, onion, cheese soup, milk, egg, cheese, crushed crackers, salt, pepper, tarragon and nutmeg; mix well.
Gently fold in the hot cooked carrots to the mixture.
Turn mixture into prepared casserole dish.
Bake, uncovered at 375 for 25-30 minutes.

1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).

3. Add the low-fat milk, egg, and shredded cheddar cheese. Mix until well combined.
4. Add the crushed crackers, salt, pepper, and tarragon. Mix until well combined.
5. Pour the mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish.
6. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the center is set.
7. Serve hot and enjoy!

8dfa9a04cc.gt:
In shallow bowl, mix flour, egg, vanilla, milk, and lemon jce.
Dip rings to cover.
In deep skillet heat oil to about 375*.
Fry rings, in batches of 3 or 4 for 2 1/2 minutes or until golden brown.
Place on paper towels and dust with sugar on both sides.

2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, egg, and vanilla. Mix until well combined.
3. Gradually add the milk, stirring constantly, until the batter reaches the desired consistency.
4. Pour the batter into a greased baking dish.
5. Bake the cake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
6. Allow the cake to cool for a few minutes before removing it from the baking dish and transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.
7. While the cake is cooling, prepare the apple rings by dipping them in the beaten egg, then coating them in a mixture of flour, sugar, and cinnamon.

8c25573d0e.gt:
In a mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar until fluffy.
Beat in flour.
Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour.
Roll out onto a well-floured surface to 1/4-in.
thickness.
Brush lightly with egg.

x 1-in.
strips.
Place 1 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets.

Cool on wire racks.

2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the egg and beat until well combined.

5. Fold in the chopped almonds.
6. If desired, sprinkle the colored crystal sugar on top of the dough.

8. Cut the dough into desired shapes using a cookie cutter or a sharp knife.
9. Place the cookies on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.

11. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

87f97ac544.gt:
Preheat oven to 350A.
Slice ham in half.
If using slices of cheese, cut in quarters.
Roll desired amount of ham and cheese up in each biscuit.
Use toothpick to hold in place.
Bake 15 minutes or until golden brown.

Little smokies sausages with cheese and a tsp of chili; slices of pepperoni with mozzarella and a tsp of pizza sauce or marinara, etc.

2. In a medium-sized mixing bowl, combine the biscuits and ham slices.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the cheese and a small amount of milk until the cheese is melted and smooth.
4. Pour the melted cheese mixture over the biscuit and ham mixture.
5. Mix everything together until the cheese is evenly distributed and the mixture is well combined.
6. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish, and press it down to form a compact layer.
7. Bake the mixture in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Remove the dish from the oven, and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

This delicious meal can be enjoyed with a side of vegetables or a salad, and can be customized with additional ingredients or seasonings to suit your taste preferences.

b188749dcd.gt:
Combine fennel seeds, cumin seeds, caraway seeds, cracked wheat, butter or margarine, molasses or barley malt, and orange zest in 1 1/3 cup of boiling water.
Soak for 1 hour.
(This pre-soaks the cracked wheat and pre-releases the other flavors.)
Add seed mixture along with baking soda, whole wheat or rye flour, high-gluten bread flour, dry yeast, gluten, and buttermilk powder into the pan of a bread machine in the order suggested by the manufacturer.
Select the cycle for White Bread and the Light Crust setting.
Start.
b188749dcd.pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the boiling water, fennel seed, cumin seeds, caraway seed, cracked wheat, and butter. Allow the mixture to cool for a few minutes.
2. Add the molasses, orange zest, baking soda, rye flour, bread flour, active dry yeast, gluten flour, and powdered buttermilk to the bowl. Mix the ingredients well.
3. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic. Cover the dough with a damp cloth and let it rise in a warm place for about 1-2 hours, or until it has doubled in size.
4. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
5. Punch down the dough and transfer it to a lightly floured surface. Roll out the dough to a thickness of about 1/2 inch (1.5 cm).
6. Cut the dough into desired shapes using a cookie cutter or a sharp knife. Place the shaped dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
7. Bake the cookies in the preheated oven for about 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your homemade cracked wheat cookies!

adf0775fd4.gt:
Bring a large saucepan of salted water to a boil.
Fill a large bowl with ice water.
In another large bowl, whisk the shallot, vinegar and sour cream together.
Whisk in the olive oil until emulsified.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add the sugar snap peas to the boiling water and blanch for 20 seconds.
Add the snow peas and cook for 20 seconds.
Add the frozen baby peas and cook for 20 seconds longer, until the sugar snaps and snow peas are crisp-tender and the baby peas are heated through.
Drain and immediately transfer the colander to the ice water to stop the cooking.
Drain again and pat the peas dry.
Add the peas to the dressing, season with salt and pepper and toss to coat.
Serve.
adf0775fd4.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the minced shallot, sherry vinegar, sour cream or creme fraiche, and olive oil. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
3. Add the sugar snap peas and snow peas to the bowl, tossing to coat the vegetables evenly with the dressing.
4. Transfer the vegetables to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
5. Roast the vegetables in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
6. Remove the vegetables from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
7. In a large bowl, combine the vegetables with the frozen baby peas.
8. Toss the vegetables and peas together until they are well-coated with the dressing.
9. Season the vegetables with salt and pepper to taste.
10. Serve the mouthwatering Food immediately, and enjoy!

1296229d55.gt:
Pick your favorite way of preparing meat.

This would work well in a pressure cooker, too.
Place meat, sauces, seasoning and sugar together.
Adjust the amounts to your preferences.

4f880f7c86.gt:
Add the kinako and sugar to a bowl and combine well.
Then add the soy milk (or milk) to the bowl as well and cream everything together with a rubber spatula.
If the mixture is too dry, try adding some more milk.
Once mixed, wrap it in some cling film and squeeze and shape the mixture together with your hands so that the mixture forms a ball.
Once the mixture has reached a consistency where it can be shaped into a ball with your bare hands, shape the mixture into whatever shapes you like I usually roll mine out with a rolling pan over the cling film then slice it into pieces.
You can replace the sugar with brown sugar if you like.
Feel free to sprinkle the kinako truffles with kinako powder, cinnamon, or anything that comes to mind at the end as well.
4f880f7c86.pred:
To make a delicious Kinako-flavored dessert, follow these steps:

1. In a small bowl, mix 50 grams of Kinako with 15 grams of sugar (or brown sugar) until well combined.
2. In a separate bowl, mix 5 tablespoons of Soy milk (or milk) with the Kinako mixture until smooth and creamy.
3. Pour the mixture into a small ramekin or individual serving dish.
4. Refrigerate the dessert for at least 2 hours or overnight to allow the flavors to meld and set.
5. Serve the Kinako-flavored dessert at room temperature or slightly chilled.

This dessert is a delightful combination of the rich, nutty flavor of Kinako and the smooth, creamy texture of the Soy milk. The result is a delicious, satisfying treat that can be enjoyed on its own or paired with a cup of tea or coffee.

68d4e3063b.gt:
Preheat oven to 400F
Clean wing sections, salt and pepper, I stay light on the salt because the sauce adds some also.
Spread wings out on baking sheet, place in preheated oven for about 45 minutes.
About 5 minutes before the wings are done, in a small container (I use a coffee mug) mix the sauce ingredients.
I put a little sauce in a big enough bowl to hold the wings and mix them.
Add about 1/3 wings, about 1/3 sauce, same thing twice more.
I find that just makes it easier to evenly coat the wings.
If you want to add a little chart to the coating, you can broil the wings for a minute per side, keep an eye on them do you don't over do it.
My daughter does not like it that way, so we skip this step when she is home.
Serve immediately.

1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the ground black pepper, salt, and sesame oil.
3. Add the wing sections to the bowl and toss them to coat the wings evenly with the seasoning mixture.
4. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
5. Spread the wings out on the prepared baking sheet, leaving some space between them for even cooking.
6. Roast the wings in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until they are cooked through and the meat is no longer pink.
7. While the wings are cooking, prepare the sauces by combining the ranch dressing, BBQ sauce, and soy sauce in a small bowl.
8. Once the wings are cooked, remove them from the oven and transfer them to a serving platter.
9. Pour the sauce mixture over the wings and toss them to coat evenly.
10. Serve the wings immediately, and enjoy!

[/INST]

In a food processor, combine the garlic and cucumber and process until finely minced.

91462bb341.gt:
Preheat oven to 400.
Combine bread crumbs, Italian seasoning and garlic powder in shallow dish.
Dip chicken in egg, then crumb mixture; turn to coat.
Arrange chicken in 13 x 9-inch baking dish.

88e444eb93.gt:
Preheat oven to broil.
Line a baking sheet with foil.
Halve the green bell pepper, red bell pepper, jalapeno peppers, and serrano peppers lengthwise and discard stems and seeds.
Place on baking sheet and brush the peppers with olive oil.
Roast peppers under the broiler until the skin blackens and blisters, 3 to 5 minutes.
Place peppers in a bowl and cover with plastic wrap; allow the peppers to steam until the skins loosen, about 10 minutes.
Peel skin off the peppers and discard.
Combine the green bell pepper, red bell pepper, jalapenos, serrano, onion, tomato, garlic, cilantro, diced tomato with juice, lime juice, salt, black pepper, and beer in a blender.
Blend to desired consistency.
Transfer to a bowl and allow to cool in the refrigerator for 30 minutes before serving.
88e444eb93.pred:
[/INST]

2. In a large bowl, combine the green and red bell peppers, jalapeno peppers, serrano peppers, onion, tomato, garlic, cilantro, and canned diced tomatoes.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lime juice, salt, and pepper.
4. Pour the dressing over the vegetable mixture and toss to coat evenly.
5. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and roast in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and slightly caramelized.
6. Serve the roasted vegetables over a bed of rice or quinoa, and enjoy your delicious and healthy meal.

a0b7c1096b.gt:
Strain plums through a sieve over a bowl, reserving juice.
Cut plums in half; discard pits.
Combine plums, reserved juice, red wine, honey, cinnamon, and cloves in a medium saucepan.
Bring to a boil.
Cover; reduce heat, and simmer 15 minutes.
Place half of soup in a blender; process until smooth.
Pour into a bowl.
Repeat procedure with other half of soup.
Stir in liqueur and rind.
Place 3/4 cup soup into each of 6 wine goblets.
Top each serving with 1 tablespoon yogurt and 1 mint sprig, if desired.

2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the plums, red wine, honey, cinnamon, cloves, Cointreau, lemon rind, and vanilla yogurt. Mix well.
3. Transfer the mixture to a 9x13-inch baking dish.
4. Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until the mixture is bubbly and the edges are slightly caramelized.
5. Remove the dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
6. Serve the dish warm, garnished with a sprig of mint if desired.

[/INST]

This delicious dish combines the sweetness of the plums, the tanginess of the red wine, and the warmth of the spices. The addition of the Cointreau or orange-flavored liqueur adds a touch of citrusy flavor, while the vanilla yogurt provides a creamy texture. The mint sprigs can be used to enhance the dish's aroma and add a refreshing touch. This dish is perfect for a cozy evening or a special occasion, and it can be easily customized with different fruits and flavors to suit individual preferences.

27dd242a7a.gt:
Mix first 6 ingredients together and place in an oven proof casserole dish.
Sprinkle cheese on top and bake for 15 to 20 minutes at 350.
Serve hot over chips,this isn't very good cold.

8b290d6b5c.gt:
Preheat oven to 330 degrees F (165C).
Butter and flour a 10 inch bundt pan.
Combine flour, baking powder, soda, cinnamon, nutmeg and salt.
In large bowl, cream butter with sugar until light and fluffy (no less than 6 minutes).
Add eggs; beat until smooth.
Add flour mixture alternately with yoghurt (or sour cream); beat until smooth.
Pour batter into prepared pan.
Bake about 1 hour, or until tester comes out with a few moist crumbs attached.
Preheat broiler.
Combine brown sugar, butter, almonds, coconut, milk and vanilla.
Spoon mixture over top of cake.
Place under broiler, 3 inches from heat source until lightly browned.
WATCH VERY CAREFULLY as this can go from caramelly to burned in no time!
8b290d6b5c.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, cream the softened butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
4. Combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt in a separate bowl.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture, alternating with the Greek yogurt (or sour cream) and milk, beginning and ending with the dry ingredients.
6. Fold in the chopped toasted almonds and sweetened coconut.
7. Pour the batter into a well-greased and floured 9x13 inch baking dish.
8. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
9. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

This delightful Food is a delicious cake that combines the flavors of coconut, almonds, and spices. The ingredients include 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 1 teaspoon baking soda, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, 12 teaspoon nutmeg, 14 teaspoon salt, 12 cup butter, softened, 1 12 cups sugar, 3 eggs, 1 cup Greek yogurt (extra-thick) or 1 cup sour cream, 12 cup packed light brown sugar, 1 tablespoon butter, melted, 12 cup chopped toasted almond, 14 cup sweetened coconut, 14 cup milk, and 12 teaspoon vanilla extract. The cake is baked in a 9x13 inch baking dish and is ready to be enjoyed.

0349f80c73.gt:
Mix all ingredients (using a hand mixer will get the lumps out).
Chill.
Serve!

3. Add the spinach, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
4. Transfer the mixture to a 9x13 inch baking dish.
5. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the center is set.
6. Allow the dish to cool for a few minutes before cutting it into squares and serving.

3a73e25c27.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Crumble the sausage into a saucepan over low heat; cover and cook until sausage is completely browned, stirring every 30 seconds; drain.
Place the bread on a baking sheet with the crust sides down.
Arrange the cooked sausage evenly over both halves of bread.
Top each with tomato slices, red bell pepper strips, mozzarella slices, green olives, and black olives.
Bake in preheated oven for 10 minutes.
Whisk together the olive oil, balsamic vinegar, oregano, basil, salt, pepper, onion, and garlic in a bowl.

Cut into 2 inch slices to serve.

2. In a large skillet, cook the sausage over medium heat until browned, breaking it up into smaller pieces as it cooks.

4. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked sausage, tomato mixture, mozzarella cheese, and oregano. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
5. Spread the mixture evenly over the cut-in-half Italian bread slices.
6. Bake the bread in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
7. Remove the bread from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Cut the bread into slices and serve.

This step-by-step guide will help you create a delicious and satisfying Italian-inspired sandwich using the provided ingredients.

68fde60a06.gt:
In Dutch oven, place beef, onion, garlic, salt and pepper.
Combine water and tomato paste; pour over beef mixture.
Bring to a boil; reduce heat to low.
Cover tightly and simmer 1 3/4 to 2 hours or until beef is tender.
Remove beef from cooking liquid; cool slightly.
Meanwhile skim fat from cooking liquid, if necessary.
Trim and discard excess fat from cooked beef.
Shred beef with 2 forks.
In Dutch oven, combine 2 cups cooking liquid, steak sauce, brown sugar and cornstarch mixture.
Bring to a boil; cook and stir 1 to 2 minutes or until slightly thickened.
Add shredded beef; mix well.
Continue to cook until thoroughly heated, stirring occasionally.
Place equal amounts of beef mixture on bottom half of each bun.
Sprinkle with green onions and close with top half of bun.
Serve with additional steak sauce, if desired.
Makes 12 servings (serving size: 1 sandwich).
68fde60a06.pred:
[/SYS]

2. In a large oven-safe pot or Dutch oven, cook the beef, onion, and garlic over medium heat until the beef is browned and the onion is softened. Season with salt and pepper.
3. Add the water, tomato paste, A.1. Original Sauce, brown sugar, and cornstarch mixture. Stir to combine.
4. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 2 hours, or until the beef is tender and the sauce has thickened.

6. Meanwhile, preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).

acfdff90be.gt:
Cut the meat into strips along the grain.
Put the chicken and all the ingredients up to the soy sauce and honey in a bowl and rub in well with your hands.
Leave to marinate for 30 minutes.
After 30 minutes, wipe the excess moisture off the chicken pieces and add 1 tablespoon of cake flour.
That way the batter will stick well to the chicken.
To make the batter: Put the panko in a resealable bag and crush into a fine powder by rolling a rolling pin over the bag.
You can also do this in a food mill or food processor.
Put the crushed panko and the remaining ingredients marked with in a bowl and mix to combine.
Add 250 ml of beer and mix until blended.
The batter should be about the consistency of heavy cream.
If it's too thick add a little more beer, mixing between additions.
Pour cooking oil in a frying pan and heat over medium to about 170C.
Coat each piece of chicken in batter and deep fry.
To avoid the batter from cracking and falling off, turn the pieces over gently after about 30 seconds even if the surface has not hardened.
When the pieces are golden brown, take them out and drain off the oil very well to finish.

a87b593bc7.gt:
Set oven to 325 degrees.
Prepare an ungreased 10-inch tube pan.
In a large bowl, sift together flour, baking powder and salt, then sift one more time, then beat in oil, egg YOLKS, 1/4 cup plus 3 tablespoons lemon juice, water and lemon peel with an electric mixer at low speed for about 3 minutes.
In a large dry copper or stainless steel bowl beat the room temperature egg whites with cream of tartar until stiff but not dry.
Fold in about 1/4 of the whites into the batter to lighten, the gently fold in the remaining whites.
Pour the batter into the ungreased tube pan.
Tap on the counter to release any air pockets.
Bake for about 1-1/4 hours, or until the cake is springy to the touch.
Immediately invert cake in pan over neck of a bottle (I use an empty beer bottle for this).
Cool the cake completely while inverted.
Remove the cake from the bottle and place on the counter.
Run a knife around the edges of the pan to loosen cake.
Transfer the cake to a serving plate.
Dust with powdered sugar.

and butter a large baking sheet.

Tear each lettuce leaf into 4 pieces.
Split scones and spread each split side with honey-mustard butter.
Make sandwiches with scones, lettuce, and folded slices of ham.

Brown hamburger in large pot (you don't want to crumble it up too fine--big pieces are the best).

Let it simmer until heated.

In a small frying pan, toast pine nuts over low heat, turning often, and cooking just until nuts are lightly browned.
Remove from pan and set aside.

Bring a small pot of water to a boil and add peas.

Add linguine and cook according to package instructions for al dente.
Drain pasta, reserving about 1/2 cup of pasta water.
Return pasta to the pot and add pesto, the 1/3 cup of remaining peas, and 1/4 cup of the pasta water.
Toss together until pesto adheres to the linguine, adding more pasta water if needed.
Serve immediately, sprinkling with black pepper and additional Parmesan cheese to taste.

0a98a1820b.gt:
In a large pot, bring 2 cups of dry split peas and 6 cups of water to a full boil.
Add the sage and salt.

Preheat the oven to 400 F. Cut the eggplants in half lengthwise, drizzle 2 tablespoons of olive oil and some salt on the cut side flesh.
Place the eggplants skin-side up on a baking sheet.
Bake for 30 minutes or until the flesh is very soft.

Cook onions until soft and browned, about 15 minutes.
Then remove from heat and set aside.
Add the cooked split peas into a blender and blend until creamy.
Transfer the split peas back into the large pot.
Scoop the eggplant flesh into the blender and discard the skin.
Add the sauteed onion and a cup of the vegetable broth in with the eggplant and blend until smooth.
Transfer the eggplant mixture into the large pot with the split peas.
Add the remaining vegetable stock and bring to a gentle boil so that everything is heated through.
Then remove from heat.
Serve with shredded cheese on top.

2. While the split peas are cooking, prepare the sage rub by combining 2 teaspoons of rubbed sage, 1 teaspoon of salt, and any additional seasonings to taste.

4. In the same skillet, add 3 cups of vegetable broth and cook the onion until it is soft and translucent.
5. Return the eggplant to the skillet and add the cooked split peas. Stir the ingredients together and season with the sage rub.
6. Adjust the seasoning to taste, and serve the dish hot.

This recipe combines the flavors of the eggplant, onion, and sage to create a delicious and hearty meal. The split peas provide a nutritious and filling base, while the eggplant and onion add depth and texture to the dish. The sage rub adds a savory and aromatic touch, enhancing the overall taste of the meal.

In a small pot over medium heat, add coconut milk, sugar, salt and 1 cup of the chopped fruit.

e40bcadd25.gt:
(Cake) Preheat oven to 180C.
Grease and line a 20cm round cake tin.
Place butter, chocolate and sugar in a medium sized saucepan.
Cook over low heat, until butter melts and sugar has dissolved.
Sift the plain flour, self raising flour and bicarb into the saucepan.
Add almond meal, sour cream, eggs and vanilla essence.

Let the cake cool then ice and decorate it.
Icing: Place chocolate and butter in a heatproof bowl over simmering water.
Cook until chocolate melts.
Remove from heat and continue stirring until mixture thickens to an icing consistency.

10. To make the icing, melt the milk chocolate in a heatproof bowl set over a saucepan of simmering water. Allow the chocolate to cool slightly.
11. In a separate bowl, beat the butter until soft and fluffy. Gradually add the cooled chocolate mixture, beating until well combined.
12. Add the vanilla essence and beat until smooth and well combined.
13. Spread the icing over the cooled cake pieces, and garnish with chopped milk chocolate if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Food dish!

b7d53a2696.gt:
Make the cookie base: Position a rack in the middle of the oven and heat the oven to 350 degrees F. Put the butter in a food processor, along with the flour, light brown sugar, cinnamon, and salt.
Pulse until the mixture is well combined (about 20 pulses).
Scatter the dough into a 9x9-inch baking pan and press it evenly over the bottom.
(Wipe out the processor bowl but don’t bother washing it.)
Bake the base until firm and lightly browned, about 25 minutes.
When the cookie base comes out of the oven, sprinkle the grated chocolate evenly over the top.
(Don’t turn off the oven.)
Set the pan aside.
Make the pecan topping: As the cookie base bakes, pulse the pecans in the food processor until coarsely chopped.
In a medium-size heavy saucepan, melt the butter.
Stir in the dark brown sugar, honey, cream, and salt.
Simmer for 1 minute, stirring occasionally.
Stir in the pecans.
Pour the pecan mixture over the chocolate-sprinkled cookie base, spreading evenly.
Bake until much of the filling is bubbling (not just the edges), 16 to 18 minutes.
Let cool completely in the pan.
When ready to serve, cut into 16 squares.
Tightly covered, these bars will keep for about five days (though they never last that long).
b7d53a2696.pred:
To create a delicious and satisfying dessert, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 6 ounces of cold unsalted butter, 9 ounces of unbleached all-purpose flour, and 12 cups of packed light brown sugar.
3. Add the ground cinnamon, table salt, and finely grated bittersweet chocolate to the mixture. Mix until the ingredients are well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the toasted pecans and 1 cup of packed dark brown sugar.
5. Add the pecans to the butter mixture, and mix until the ingredients are well combined.
6. In a small saucepan, heat the honey and heavy cream over low heat until the honey is melted and the mixture is smooth.
7. Add the honey mixture to the butter mixture, and mix until the ingredients are well combined.
8. Pour the mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
9. Bake the dessert in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the center is set.
10. Allow the dessert to cool for a few minutes before cutting it into squares and serving.

This delicious dessert is perfect for sharing with friends and family, and it is sure to be a hit at any gathering.

ebbeab0277.gt:
Cover baking sheet with parchment.
Dip 12 plastic teaspoons, 1 at a time, in white chocolate; shake spoon gently over bowl of melted chocolate to remove excess chocolate.
Place on prepared baking sheet.
Refrigerate 10 min.
or until chocolate is firm.
Melt semi-sweet chocolate.
Partially dip each spoon in chocolate; return to baking sheet.
Refrigerate 10 min.
Use decorating gels to decorate spoons to resemble snowmen faces as shown in photo.
ebbeab0277.pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the Baker's White Chocolate and melted Baker's Semi-Sweet Chocolate.
2. Stir the mixture until smooth and well-combined.
3. Add the orange and black decorating gels to the chocolate mixture, stirring gently to ensure even distribution.
4. If the mixture is too thick, you can add a small amount of milk or cream to achieve the desired consistency.
5. Pour the chocolate mixture into a baking dish or a silicone mold, ensuring that it is evenly distributed.
6. Refrigerate the chocolate mixture for at least 30 minutes to allow it to set and harden.
7. Once the chocolate is set, remove it from the refrigerator and let it sit at room temperature for a few minutes before cutting it into desired shapes or slices.

This recipe for making a flavorful Food involves melting two types of chocolate, adding orange and black decorating gels, and allowing the mixture to set before cutting it into desired shapes or slices. The result is a delicious and visually appealing dessert or treat that can be enjoyed by people of all ages.

9405c380d3.gt:
Place a large pot or saucepan over medium-high heat.
Add the butter, allow to melt then add the garlic, ginger, 1/2 of the cream, soy sauce, a few grindings of black pepper, pinch of salt, sugar and sweet potatoes.
Reduce heat to low, cover and cook until the sweet potatoes are very tender, about 45 minutes.
Remove from heat, mash with a potato masher adding the remaining cream.
Taste, adjust seasoning with black pepper and soy sauce as needed.
Sprinkle with chopped cilantro and serve.
9405c380d3.pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the butter, light cream, sugar, soy sauce, tamari, ginger, garlic, and black pepper. Whisk until smooth.
3. Add the sweet potatoes or yams to the bowl and toss to coat the vegetables evenly with the sauce.
4. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish, making sure to evenly distribute the vegetables.
5. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and slightly caramelized.

In the cooking tutorial, you have provided the necessary ingredients and steps to make a delicious sweet potato or yam dish.
